CaHoY-SNG-il2AhQ6dBUdQ.text: Cannot love this place more. It does not look nice outside but the inside is amazing. A full Mexican experience. We had two fishes. One is whole fish and one is fish with salsa topped. Both are good! If you like crispy, the whole fish is what you want; if you like spicy, the salsa one is your choice!Just the service needs to be better, we wait for 15m to get water and drinks. A great place the hang out with friends. Also, the chips are bomb! They are served warm!! I love this place! Besides, it is near the ranch market. If you want to buy some grocery after a lunch or dinner, go there!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine wall
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One is whole fish and one is fish with salsa topped.

WWn6keeCAiPOXCkrcsLUCQ.text: The service was great, the food was just as good.  I just came in from Buffalo, NY and it's been awhile since I've had good Mexican food.  the carne asada burrito nd ceiveche tostada hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carñe asada heaven.

He9u_aU1RJH3SzF2nSk9Yg.text: Growing up in Phoenix I've tried a wide variety of Mexican restaurants. Finally a friend introduced me to Mariscos Hermosa and I fell in LOVE. Be forewarned, the location doesn't look very appealing from the outside. It isn't in the best of neighborhoods but don't let that fool you, this place is amazing! Inside it's very charming, Mexican sea life decor, the tables are very colorful and all look different. Soccer games are usually played on the televisions, it would be a good spot to come to watch your favorite team over some margaritas or delicious horchatas!   Their ceviche de pescado and camaron is my favorite dish. I'm a big seafood lover and this place knows how to do it right. If you're into oysters I also suggest ordering that to start. So good! Chips and salsa are given upon seating and their salsa verde is a bit spicy but so delicious. I wish I had a jar of it at home. Great horchata and cheap Negra Modelos! The staff has always been great and very friendly.   This place is a hidden gem.

S5PIFSVNXcZs0uouLilnxQ.text: This restaurant is the best Mexican I ever tasted, every dishes are super, the price and service are wonderful

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1wW1qT3ROVo720u37Oo9Dg.text: Awesome - lunch back for dinner the same week - fish is fresh and great variety of seafood!

3I-ZGwoqcOb2MnyXtf2W5A.text: Everything was delicious!! The molcajete was the bomb! Waitress was very helpful and good service from all the restaurant... free complimentary fish tostada delicious.. the horchata is the best I ever try!

6hNAhnRxei8DwezUXvzyHA.text: Really enjoyed the fish dish I ordered. I would definitely come again. I want to try their shrimp cocktails, I spoke to the waiter and he assured me that they don't put ketchup in their cocktails.  That to me is a sign of good taste. The waiter also gave me a free ceviche tostada to try. I also received a free slice of cake compliments of yelp. The taste was fantastic so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The free slice of cake was fantastic and huge

dGo7Svr8XUU0SUhAc0QEpQ.text: First off I prefer Mariscos Sinaloa so we will continue to go there instead.  I was a bit afraid to park my vehicle outside in this neighborhood with all the locals walking around.  The ambiance inside the restaurant was cute and enjoyable.  The server just had a flat affect.  He was neither friendly or rude.  I thought the menu prices were a bit high.  We paid the full prices for lunch on a weekend.  We got plenty of free chips and the two salsas.  I really enjoyed the green one.  We did not receive any free tostadas like other yelpers report receiving.  The portion sizes were good and I left full with some leftovers.  My son is 12 years old and tried a half order of Oysters on the half shell.  It was his first time trying oysters and he really liked them.  I ordered a bean and cheese burrito, the cheese enchiladas and quacamole to share with my two little girls.  We really enjoyed the beans, the rice (and I am not usually a fan of rice!), and the guacamole.  The enchiladas were just okay.

q4YAetdAoVpoPIOxoIm1PA.text: Best Mariscos I have ever had in Arizona. everything was so fresh and delicious. I had all cold Mariscos, which included: shrimp, callos de scallops, and oysters. wife had fried fish which she loved. service was great. I will definitely keep coming back here every day I am in mood for Mariscos.

WMlvTTOKD8Zc_bJwiDyQBQ.text: Camarones aguachile are aweeeeeeeeeeeeeesome!!!  I love this place if you like seafood and Mexican food then look no further this place is the bomb.  The service is good, they have great drinks alcoholic and non, and the food is amazing.  Plus the ceviche tostada for free at the beginning along with chips and salsa just tops off how wonderful this place is.    I admit it is pricey but the ingredients are fresh and we are in the desert so you gotta pay for good stuff and this place is for sure worth it.

l8pJUYMSs6B2T__RuAO5mg.text: Mariscos Playa Hermosa is kind of in the, shall we say, less savory area of town, but don't let that deter you from trying it out! The outside pretty much looks like a crummy box but the inside is super colorful and lavishly decorated. I wasn't sure what to expect but the food sufficiently impressed me.  You get two salsas with a basket of chips--both of which are super delicious. The avocado salsa was tasty and not super watered-down like at some places. The red one, which is semi-spicy, is very tasty. I don't even know how to describe it. It was just so.... TASTY.  We received some salmon (I think?) ceviche on a crispy tortilla with our meals. Very yummy and the veggies in it tasted fresh. I ordered the enchiladas de jaiba and the others ordered fish tacos. Both were good although I think I liked the fish tacos better than my enchiladas. I thought the fish was really good and light. I noticed the rice seemed to be made with those frozen mixed veggies you get at the supermarket, which I thought was kind of funny, but it still tasted good so I guess it didn't matter.  Service was very prompt even though the server wasn't particularly engaging. I actually prefer my service to be this way, so if you prefer a waiter/waitress that likes to make conversation, then maybe this isn't the place for you. Interior of the restaurant looked relatively clean.  I definitely recommend Mariscos Playa Hermosa. Don't be scared of the rundown appearance of the area! I cannot speak on the authenticity of the food but at least it was yummy.

m5rIcbslO9Ylhyviigjz4A.text: So my coworker and I had a business trip to Chandler, AZ and I had told him about my last two experiences eating seafood in the desert. Fish tacos that looked and tasted like nasty dried chunks of leather. You figure AZ shares a border with Mexico so they must share some learnings but it was nothing like the awesome fish tacos you get in San Diego. Need to avoid seafood in AZ.  We randomly drove by this place and decided, ok that looks interesting. Surprised me when I found it was another seafood joint. MMmm ok we're here and too hungry to look for another place.  So I ordered the crab enchilada plate and it was actually pretty good. Real crab meat stuffed enchiladas with rice and beans on the side. The shrimp ceviche tostada appetizer was also pretty good as well.  The exterior looks a bit sketchy but the interior decor was cute with a fishy motif straight out of the Bahamas. All in all a nice place for lunch.

bD6OdZuUdfxL9vc8RUP-Cg.text: In my never ending quest to find the best mexican food in the universe I came across this lovely little colorful gem in central Phoenix. Warning, the color scheme in this place may cause seizures, minor heart explosions, massive weight gain, restless torso syndrome and restless leg syndrome. First off you know you're in the right place where you wonder if you're car is safe to park there. You walk in and a complete array of colors hit you, leaving you breathless, speechless and eventually i'm sure sightless. The food and margeritas were amazing. Shrimp Cerviche was to die for. It was delicious and I have to honestly say that although my quest to find the best mexican food in the universe will never be complete, this is my favorite place for shrimp Cerviche so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A colorblinded mans paradise

-TYRMunY0ysXNj-OK2ACNA.text: We come here about once every month or so and love it here. I like to order the molcajete, which is basically a huge pot filled with meat and seafood, in their "Diabla" sauce. It is spicy as heck, but I can't stop eating it! It's my favorite sauce by far. The food is always fresh, as well as the veggies they serve on the side. The staff are all friendly and very attentive to you. The atmosphere is very chill, with different cumbias playing softly in the background and a soccer game always on TV. They just recently remodeled and now there's way more seating, so wait times are cut in half. I love Playa Hermosa and am a loyal regular. Five out of five stars.

-WpLN_ZvVS9JnEHlGVA7HA.text: BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER.  Do not even look at the menu, people. Just order a Dos Equis and the Molcajete Caliente with verde sauce.   My boyfriend and I found this place on the Yelp app, like most eateries we visited while in Phoenix. I cannot express how happy this place made us. We loved the restaurant, the service and the food so much that we actually came back and ate there again before heading to the airport.  The Molcajete Caliente is $22 for two people. You each get your own ceviche tostada and plate of rice, beans and salad (all delicious). They also bring a warmer with corn or flour tortillas. But the main event... a volcanic-like cast iron cauldron (a molcajete) teeming with bubbling green sauce with various kinds of grilled meats and seafood hanging around the outside. The smell alone will bring you halfway to heaven, but ZOMG, taste explosion! SO GOOD.   It comes with two breaded fish filets, two pieces of grilled steak, two of chicken and four big shrimp. Plus, there are little chunks of octopus in the sauce itself. If I had to choose a favorite, it would be the fish (or the seafood in general), but every bite of everything was honestly amazing. It may be the best sauce I've ever eaten.   The service was superb both visits---super friendly, fast and helpful. The server was the one who recommended the molcajete in the first place, actually. The prices are almost unbelievable ($22 for a VOLCANO OF FOOD??).   The restaurant itself is really clean and full ceramic tiles and colorful artwork. Some reviewers have commented about the dodgy location. The neighborhood seemed fine to me, though I don't live in Phoenix so I could be mistaken. It's mostly residential, but well-worth making a special trip (like, every single day) for this food!  Note: If you're planning on ordering the ceviche as an appetizer, just be aware that you might not get your house ceviche tostadas. We didn't get ours the second visit because my boyfriend insisted on getting a full order of ceviche. He was hoping they would bring both (because he's insane and would eat an ocean full of ceviche if left on his own), but they didn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oVFfu1oIIUFirdOrOoz3Pw.text: Excellent place to get great seafood!  Restaurant and Food:  The restaurant is nice and cozy.  At max, there are maybe 15 tables in the entire joint.  However, don't let the size, location, and lack of flashy chain-like display fool you.  The menu has a wide array of choices from fish tacos to different styled fish plates.  I had a fish plate prepared with garlic and a lemon pepper seasoning (Pescado Ajo Mojo I think) as well as an horchata for my beverages.  The food was impeccable!  In my experience, coming across fresh seafood in Phoenix is hard.  The seafood was well prepared and fresh (no gamy-fishy taste).   Additionally, the menu has pictures of almost every dish so you can gauge your interest in a choice (Visual examples appeal to me).  Service:  Spot on along with the food!  As mentioned previously, the restaurant is not that big.  Our server was always on top of her game and frequently stopped in to check on us.    Atmosphere:  The restaurant has a bright decor that is very fun and fitting for the type of restaurant.  Not to sound cliche, but you will feel almost as if you are at mom's kitchen (I'm Hispanic and my parent's house has similar decor).    Overall, this place wowed me with the food and the service.  For the price and quality you will receive at Mariscos Playa Hermosa, I doubt you can find many places in the neighborhood that will compete with this place.  Try it and see for yourself!

bLmJv3ajFhUdT_LT5YNYhg.text: After the fish tacos here, I feel like I haven't had them anywhere else. So good. The ceviche tostada and crab enchiladas--packed with crabmeat--were absolutely delicious.   The ambience was bright, draft beer was deep, and service perfect. The owner even comped us tostadas. This place deserves another star!

duadG79MAVhgspwd3qL8YQ.text: Drove almost an hour to come here and will never come back.   I took my mom here because of the rating and for her birthday. As soon as you walk in you'll see frames and frames of how they were on the newspaper. The place is cute and We were greeted by friendly staff members as soon as we walked in.  We went ahead and ordered their shrimp cocktail, shrimp tostada and oysters. When the oysters came out, right off the bat we knew it wasn't fresh. My mom ate one oyster and immediately said "I'm not going to eat anymore" and had a disgusted look on her face. She said when she swallowed it it wasn't cold but tasted warm so I touched one of them and she was right. We told the waitress and she got the manager. He stuck his thumb in one of them and said "it's cold" then says "do you guys still want it?" We told him "no". After that incident my moms cocktail came out and I had a bite from it. That was also warm and so I told my mom to put ice in it from her water. The only thing that was good was my little dish. It had a lot of chopped up shrimp and pico de gallo on top of a tostada.   Man I'm surprised of their ratings.. I've had better Mexican food elsewhere.

vLrv_3_rutdWM0XFVMerTQ.text: Awesome food, ceviche, shrimp cocktail everything! Sometimes they are crowded and super busy but bring you out a free ceviche tostada to hold you over. Great Place

2C-dsbF4CooBwOD9fCe26w.text: Everything was so good - service, food, atmosphere.  I had the caldo siete mares (seven seas soup).  The broth was so good and the fish was so tender.  Also a huge bowl.  Looking forward to going back.

yV9P5yfP2TVDXR1-A76wDg.text: Visiting Phoenix from central California (Watsonville)for work I am a huge mexican seafood lover but skeptical about it in the desert and this place did not let me down hands down! Great flavor and excellent service will definitely be coming back nextime im in the area. Prices were very affordable as well.

ddEC0x0uW3szYCJxjdATmQ.text: I had quite high expectations for our meal here this weekend and to be honest, I wasn't blown away.  After further consideration, I think I perhaps ordered something that just wasn't for me.    Things that bothered me:    My house margarita was blue.  The drink menu said it had tequila and lime.  What was in there that was blue?    My shrimp had the digestive tract intact which is a turnoff for me.  The Garlic Shrimp (which I see from other reviews is very popular) just didn't work for me.  It was essentially peppers, onions and shrimp in a literal bowl of garlic butter.    Things I liked:    The chips and salsa were excellent as were the tortillas.    Loved the complimentary ceviche tostada.    The coconut cake was out of this world.

Hy9tk_xNrxRSEFf2B1jJ1Q.text: Yelp has led me to another amazing joint for food.  I went to Mariscos Playa Hermosa with family for my brother's birthday and this place blew my socks off. The food and staff were equally responsible for why I left wishing this gem was closer to my residence. From beginning to end, our visit was great.   For the food, we started with guac. and a shrimp cocktail. The guac. was so flavorful and man, they jammed so much shrimp in the great cocktail. What a start!!! Next we ordered the Molcajete Caliente (shrimp, beef, chicken, fish, octopus in a green sauce). As we were anticipating the arrival of our dish they brought us all out a complimentary ceviche tostada. This was my first ceviche and I was impressed. Not saying much though since I have nothing to compare it to :). Now for the Molcajete, I loved it so much. Every meat was perfectly cooked and the boiling hot green sauce was perfect. To go with the meat, they provide each person with their own tortillas, beans, and rice. Okay, the tortillas were good, the beans were good, but the rice was the best I have had. I just loved everything about the dish. I would eat it for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and then do it all over again the next day.  As for service and as mentioned above, it was equally impressive. I wish I remembered the young ladies name but she provided wonderful service. She checked on us often and always did it with a smile. The staff also came in at the tail end of the meal and sang the happy birthday song to my brother. What I have never seen before is they sang it first in English and then Spanish. What a cool idea.   My family will be back again soon and you should stop in too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Staff treating my brother to a fun birthday celebration. Great service.
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loved the rice.
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete caliente  (shrimp, beef, chicken, fish, and octopus in green sauce) was so good. Highly recommend!

wwEFGqGZf1fHYoovOo1vyQ.text: the margaritas are gucci, the food is great, over all 11 out of 10. Recommend the really hot rock bowl with the green stuff.. fat nut.

dgQk5dMHjLtWYg7kEqL0yQ.text: I came by myself on a Tuesday night hoping for a decent meal. What I got was a fantastic meal with impeccable service. First I started with a Michelada, well seasoned and just the right ratio of red, to beer. Hey oh! Just what I needed.  I was excited for the prepared Oysters which were top notch, filled with extras, and fresh. They also treated me to a fish ceviche tostada, that I would absolutely purchase again. Get the ceviche tostada.   The recommendations from staff were spot on and I wish I had gotten the fajitas because when the sizzling skillet's flavor wafted past me... I realized I should have purchased them immediately.   Still, my entree was fantastic and that rice, unique, and flavorful.   Can we talk about the ambiance here? Super duper colorful and unique (at least for Phoenix)!

Jurh1FhbSnQUA4GFwdaprQ.text: I have to give Mariscos Playa Hermosa a really bad review. I called them at 7:45pm before driving from Scottsdale to ensure they would take us in. Their website says they close at 9pm. When I called they told me that as long as I got here at 8:30pm they would take us in. We arrived at 8:18pm & they had the doors closed. I called them from outside their door at they said they are closed. There service is horrible, they are not ethical or trustworthy. I'm really upset that they made us drive over 15 miles & not provide the service hours they advertise. I do not recommend this place at all.

TvjyxETnllU4GYtvm6yuKQ.text: Omg first time here and I was NOT disappointed. I'm from San Diego so I do compare all mariscos. I always am on a hunt for a good mariscos when i travel and this place was def was comparable to San Diego. Everything we had was delicious. Service was great. Pricing wasn't to bad. It's seafood so it's not cheap. I was very content and will come back when I'm in AZ again.

HzN7Y_8V6aFzqTHwm-aT3g.text: This is our first time at Arizona and without question, this place is easily one of the best restaurants we've been to. When we go out to eat, we look for 3 things: good service, good food and above all, the environment. Mariscos playa excelled on all three giving us an authentic mexican experience with waiters and waitress treating us like family.

tbt1td-C2BUa_97xj4YoOg.text: This is a casual restaurant  that brings to the desert authentic flavors of a marisqueria. At Mariscos Playa Hermosa, quality, fresh and delicious  ingredients are served  in respectable portions. I wish I could sample the entire menu.  Each bite takes my back to the costa!

R6gRbPsZFPrqkrr2wM_Pzw.text: Hands down the best Mariscos in Phoenix! Great selection of food. And great atmosphere!

B8T4jfPt3dSi8zzD4DK34w.text: Will never return to this restaurant again! I've been here several times and I have never been treated the way I was today. My boyfriend placed a phone order which I went to pick up. When I get there I go to the counter and let the gentleman know I was there to pick up an order, he tells the girl with glasses and curly hair behind the counter I was there to pick up a phone order and she very rudely says I didnt call in an order and she doesnt have one. Then another girl who overheard comes up and says "I have your phone order" she was nice and asked me to wait. So I'm standing there waiting and as the other female is walking back to the counter she elbows be and doesnt bother saying I'm sorry, excuse me, or I apologize. I continued to wait which at this point I'm super angry that this person thinks it's ok to treat a customer like this, so I decide to leave. Who I the world would want to be treated like this. So I leave and I call the place when I get home to make a complaint and a guy answers the phone which I believe is the one who was at counter... he tried to say I was rude for leaving and he tells me not to call back and hangs up on me! I have family and friends that have been going to this place for years... guess who just lost business

Qf2YXHzznA_feWC2NexhVQ.text: The choriqueso was fire! Wait time was minimal... and customer service was good. Not a cheap place, but the quality of their food makes up for the price.

TUKebD6BOHd1xioeoxlSUg.text: Molcajete was amazing. Could easily feed 3 as it comes with salad, beans and rice as well. Best Mexican seafood in Phoenix!! A little loud bit everyone was happy. Service was fast and attentive.

rJw8vZ2MdKgqoqNX3SW8Pg.text: The child relleno I had was delicious! The Chile was fresh and not from a can. Chips were crisp and tomatillo salsa with avocado was very good. The rice was ok, it could have been made with a little more seasoning. The re fried beans did not taste vary good. Not sure if they were fresh or not. The inside is nice and colorful. The food is fresh and the portions are quite shareable but most importantly it is authentic. The lemonade is fresh squeezed and the salsa happens to be quite delicious as well. Great job! Awesome food!

4bueYNUi8403jAQueFEDcQ.text: Yum!! Everything here is delicious!! 1 star less because it's sadly a little too pricey :/ But you must try the molcajete here!!

n21CQHQYcOhepBvSboNDkw.text: Food very mediocre and service was very slow. Although only few tables were filled, took forever for drinks and food.   Nice environment though.

EUK2DTAaBdxX5Ht0fRkaPw.text: I am really crazy about this place, we are from Pasadena CA but find ourselves in Phoenix about twice a year. Each visit we must go to MPH to enjoy what is the best Mexican seafood in the southwest.   Where to start? Nearly the whole menu is good. Start with shrimp or mixed seafood cocktail and then move onto the seafood platters. Fried Fish, shrimp, abalone, it's very tasty and well done.   If you're not in a seafood mood they're pretty good about that too. We recently tried the "volcano" (sorry the Spanish names fail me) with various meet and seafood cooked in a lava pit of red or green sauce and cheese, and that was delicious.   Wash it all down with Margaritas combined with Beer: literally they serve a Margarita + Beer combo that I order every time and it's the greatest way to accompany the meal.  Service is excellent: the waitresses are skilled, knowledgeable about the menu, and happy to serve you promptly.  The decor, made up of hand-carved and hand-painted Mexican-style wooden furniture, is exquisite and really brightens up the dining area.  Overall it's a wonderful dining experience and well recommended.

TCRlwShlmPTDdXaaNpc7kQ.text: This place had great seafood. I had the mixed cocktail and my husband had the shrimp cocktail. My husband said he had tons of shrimp in his. The place is small and cozy. The neighborhood doesn't look all that great but the food was good. The prices seem to be very reasonable, but then we are used to paying California prices. The parking lot was a little small but we have a large truck. Loved the decor. We were leaving as the mariachis were arriving, too bad. Definitely check this place out if you are near Downtown Phoenix.

ruY5DedYEOHhl8Mfp6ZXfA.text: Warm and inviting atmosphere.Authentic food, best ceviche in phoenix hands down. Friendly staff, family owned restataunt that has earned my repeat business. Very pleasent experience. Thank you MPH!

FRsnithRNDNjEqRp5TO_1w.text: Awesome place. After landing in Phoenix and having a craving for Mexican food, we drove to Mariscos Playa Hermosa. The restaurant was packed, but we had no problem getting a table. There was also a mariachi band that was playing music from 7-8pm, which was a pleasant surprise. I got an horchata to start off, which was amazing! Not too sweet, which a nice, but not overpowering kick of cinnamon. Highly recommend if you're a fan of horchata.  We ordered the Ceviche de Pescado as an appetizer, which was delicious and had a nice flavor from the fresh fish mixing with the cilantro and salsa. The fish was a little rubbery, but all the flavors still melded together well.  For our main courses, we ordered the Camarones culichi and Pescado a la veracruzana. Both came with a side of salad, homemade beans, rice, and fresh corn or flour tortillas. The shrimp was absolutely delicious, and the green sauce had a nice cilantro flavor to it. The only complaint we had was that the portion size was a little small for 3 people, and it was so good that we really wanted more. The fish was lightly breaded and sauteed, and was moist and succulent. The vegetables complemented the dish well too.   If you're in Phoenix and have a craving for Mexican seafood, I highly recommend Mariscos Playa Hermosa!

MeqHZvkR97PLuQEEL4Holw.text: We arrived in Phoenix and needed lunch before heading to Flagstaff, so we found this place on Yelp. What a find! It's located not far from the airport so that is really convenient. It's small and parking is limited, but it was raining (!) and so we were able to grab the last parking spot.   Our food was nothing short of stupendous. They start you out with free ceviche on a mini tostado, and it is delicious. I got the enchilada jaiba (with crab) and it was really good, with red chile sauce. The wife got the camaron (shrimp) culichi with green chile sauce. We each ate about half of our meal and then traded because I love green chile and she loves red chile. I must say, I got the better of the trade! The green chile sauce was nothing short of orgasmic; just fantastically deliciously awe-inspiringly good. I could eat that sauce on a shoe and be happy. The rice and beans were also excellent, way above the typical non-descript flavor, and each meal also came with a salad! What a deal. We were so happy that Yelpers turned us on to this place. Whenever I am in Phoenix for whatever reason, I am heading back to this place!

c6NYwfiLliATNygZqmwQ3Q.text: The environment is close knit and warm , authentic music and the waiters are humble and take care of their customers like their own family.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gyeLmTdpMz7iZNl6TZEpNQ.text: Well worth trying!    Great unique tastes in the heart of Phoenix.   Chips and salsa -- solid Ceviche -- really good Carmarones Culchi -- this is the dish to order.  Sauce is incredible.  Generous portions, reasonable prices.  Nice staff.  Will definitely return when in AZ.

35EZ38AVe1a-2R8fvV11CQ.text: Phenomenal!  Get the molcajete, margaritas and finish with Flan.  Ok it's not in the best neighborhood but that's usually where the best food is.  I found this on YELP!  What a great find.  I love fish.  We ordered the Cerviche as an appetizer.  It was fresh and a great start.  I had a few Margaritas which were a tad weak but it's a great atmosphere with great food.  Again I recommend the Molcajete.  It's beef, pork, chicken and fish in a pot with great sauce.  Order it for 2 if you're hungry.  Otherwise, have fun and enjoy!

NyoIJ5JhajHo4luVW7ge6w.text: It was everything that I wanted. I don't know why I have to write out a long paragraph on this place other than it was fantastic the food was excellent and I'm definitely going back.

C47KzrLzoUYjqHCiNTovvg.text: I've been sick on my little holiday, and while I have a tendency to eat my way through a new city with an unlimited budget, good old affordable mexican sounded just right for post nasal drip and sore throat.  *Be prepared for very, very loud music. *Not a ray of sun shines into this building.   *I wanted to sit in the garden during this summer "cold spell" of 70 degrees - but we were denied.  (Seriously the perfect temp for al fresco dining.) *Top shelf margaritas will run you $10. Is it just me or does that seem like a lot for a hole in the wall in AZ?  Yelpers seem to love this place; we liked it just fine.  We got one fish dish and the carne asada platter with cheese enchilada.  When in doubt, stick with the fish.  The meat was very average in quality and flavor.  The grilled fish was fantastic.  A bit of a miscommunication between my husband and the waitress about being gluten free.  The serving staff and owner were very kind, apologetic, and made immediate strides to whip something else up.  All in all, a respectable time.

9o0jRfuBn9KFga0RNP7Vsg.text: 1st time here, it was great!! My husband had the crap enchiladas, very good!  I had shrimp cooked in a wonderful red sauce, spicy, loved it!!

12_4vqLpMANxvCz_2T9yYw.text: For a Mexican restaurant and the area its located in it seemed really, really expensive. Our check for 2 people was $60. We both had 1 drink and 1 entree and split an appetizer.   The rating is highly influenced by the total price of the experience.  On to the food-- the ceviche was OK at best, it was comprised of 90% pico and 10% shrimp/fish. I've had ceviche from several dozen places and I'd have to rate this ceviche in the bottom 3 : /  The 'Camarones Fantasia' were very dry (over fried a little) and small for an order/the price. It came with 6 medium sized shrimps and should have been at least large or jumbo so as not to become so dry while cooking optimally. Ironically enough, I thought the actual taste was not terrible, but I could not describe them as "succulent" by any means.  The 'Camarones de Ajo' were very good but lacked some flavor that should have been there and that has been present in other Ajo dishes I have sampled throughout the US and Mexico.  The drinks were AWESOME! The micheladas were very great and by far the best part of the meal. However, they were the most expensive I have ever bought (40% more than the most touristy of spots in Mexico, which if you understand, is saying a lot!).   I'm quite confused how they can charge so much for the drinks and dishes here.  The experience was not "bad", but its certainly not a place I will return to anytime soon.  3 stars is the best I can give this place.

V58staJa0zUQMDH7uC9FVA.text: Insanely delicious.  I don't know how else to describe my dinner there.  My husband and I were in Phoenix for a long weekend and wanted some good Mexican food.  (Thank you, fellow Yelpers, for pointing me towards Mariscos Playa Hermosa.)  This adorable little restaurant looks like absolutely nothing from the outside- just a plain looking building with a sign.  The inside, though, is cute and definitely has an authentic Mexican feel.  Upon entering the restaurant, we were warmly greeted and seated. Within a few minutes, we were offered beers and tortilla chips.  We opted for guacamole to compliment our tortillas, the former of which I was suspicious at first because of the seemingly runny consistency.  Boy, was I wrong - the guac was tangy and full of flavor. I would love to have their recipe!      Based on other review, we opted for the molcajete for our main curse.  It. Was. Off. The. Hook.  It arrived in a medium-sized, deep bowl, filled half-way with a delicious spicy cheesy gray.  Along the sides of the bowl are shrimp, chicken, beef and scallops.  We just kind of pushed all the meats into the sauce and then dug in.  And while this dish is meant to serve up to 4 persons, we totally killed it and finished every bite.  (Disclaimer:  I'm a small person and really don't eat that much.... The molcajete was JUST THAT GOOD.)    The next time I'm in Phoenix, I'll make sure to return to Mariscos!

QVUBAGgz0wreDlpfMAf7lw.text: Really like this place for Mariscos. The restaurant isn't in the best part of town, the location is a bit sketchy, however, the the food is very good! Some of my favs are the shrimp cocktail and cerviche. Oysters and Mexican beer...Yum! The restaurant is comfortable, inviting, nice and clean. The staff has always been friendly and it's never been crowded when we've gone. Prices are a tad on the pricier side considering there are a few other restaurants down the street, but this is my first choice.

ER5E02nWvHObTw5QDNqOlA.text: Delicious!  We had margaritas, fish ceviche, fish tacos and crab enchiladas. I would prefer the shrimp, but my grandpa was having shrimp so wanted fish. The verde sauce with the chips is really flavorful.   Fish tacos were great, packed with fish and so were the enchiladas (but with crab meat). The red sauce was a little on the sweet side. Paired with some of their many hot sauces, it was perfect. Large potions and good prices.   We made reservations for 6 on a Saturday and it was picked when we arrived but cleared up shortly after. I love the bright colors and there's a patio.   The service was excellent, staff working together and very friendly. I used the Yelp free cake offer and had the chocolate cake. Really good, giant piece.   If I've ever in town again, I'll come back. May have made a regular of my grandpa!

TdCzxrxByCAw7HihkaKceQ.text: Wow!! Talk about good food and mariachis.  Would recommend and definitely coming back here again

m5fYskcJcV3Tr0pPRdzDjQ.text: Food was good but comparatively expensive - ended up getting the Tierra y Mar tacos (so good) & wish I had added a side. This is a great place to go with people who like to share food.

FPEu9PQgQCqpvrLWsYMuzg.text: Some visiting friends wanted to experience Mexican food that was "above the usual" so after a yelp search, we went to this place. It was just an hour before closing time but the restaurant was still very busy, a good sign. We were immediately seated and were treated to warm tortilla chips and salsa, plus some really good tostadas. My friends ordered margaritas and said those were delicious, especially with tajin instead of the usual salt at the rim of the glasses. We ordered the molcajete caliente, an impressive array of various proteins arranged around a pool of green culichi sauce. It was enjoyable although the carne asada was just a tad on the drier side. I also ordered fish tacos for my friends as they have never had those before; they were a bit doubtful at first if they could finish those because they were already full, but ended gobbling them up and said they were really good. Though this place was a bit pricier than most Mexican restaurants, that is justified by the quality and quantity of the food and the very friendly and efficient service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete Caliente

9Vgj3CGF-vCY4hOl8VUYtw.text: Good food & good ambient Try the tostada embarasada The micheladas are good too They play mariachi on sunday

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1Wu_U_sJsAKLw7rKxubTtQ.text: What a delightful place!  Very authentic Mexican food.  We had one in our group who didn't eat seafood and one who didn't eat meat and there was a bevy of choices for everyone!!   We had no idea what to order and one of the servers came over and gave us some suggestions and everything was spot on delicious!! Generous portions for all! I had the shredded pork with pineapple tacos.... YUMMMM!!  I will definitely order those again! My other guests ordered fish entries and were still talking about how delicious they were the next day!!   If you want real, authentic Mexican food please do not let this pass you by, it is a must stop for all!!

DB39BEIscVKAq-vrjFgEGA.text: OMG!!!  I have had fish tacos all over the country and further.  These were the best ever.  Just happened to pick this place out of a app and so happy I did.  The atmosphere is awesome. Middle of the work day so couldn't try their drinks but now wishing I would have.  Service is awesome too.  We will be back again for sure.  Don't forget to get the guacamole too.  Love the pico.

Q4hg9YxEMHi0fb0LSFJTBA.text: Awesome Mexican sea food joint. The menu will not disappoint! Plenty of different dishes with fish, scallops, shrimp, oysters with all kinds of sauces and sides.   The place itself is small and parking is limited but worse case scenario you could just park out on the small street located next to the restaurant. The seating is tight but the decor is beautiful and clean. The staff is out in the dining area making sure guests have everything they need.   Will be back for sure!

BzZ1oN6HiVp-dK0CJ_bNBg.text: The food was flavorless, cold, seafood tasted like it had been in the fridge for a long time. Oysters where bad already.. overpriced. They had very good costumer service at least

5BQktyLRgTfkaNqQwRClvQ.text: I'm giving it two stars because I had made a reservation 2 weeks prior for the back area for ten people. Called again the week of to confirm the reservation someone answered and said "oh yes the V.IP area confirmed for 10 people" we were on our way the called to confirmed if were still going I told them yes. When we showed up the restaurant manager stopped me and said that our table was in the corner that the back area was for 25 or more I told him it was reserved he proceeded to tell me that they had called earlier that day to make the reservation I told him I had reserved it a week ago. He lied to my face and said NO! When it had been verified multiple times never apologized for his mistake the least he could've done is apologized and said well we got a larger party but instead argued with me about a reservation we've been going here for years! To be treated like this was not necessary the waiter made our experience better she was friendly, attentive and the food is good which is why we like coming here. They sing happy birthday and bring you a slice of cake. The treatment from the manager is why I give it two stars and the reservation they couldn't keep!

Za6tSpwL3ULIu_7KyOcDKA.text: This place was amazing! Our server brought us complimentary ceviche tostadas, and we ordered tacos. Delicious! Highly recommend!

CLr-InNoEEtzu7cedO3L3w.text: Stop gong to your typical Mexican food spot and don't be intimidated to make this your next stop! Went for lunch with a friend per his recommendation. It was so good. 3 of us shared several plates ...one fish ...one stuffed peppers wrapped in bacon ...one shrimp cocktail... it was incredible! I've been back 2x since! Can't wait to Uber there with my wife and get a few of the huge frozen glass drinks from the bar! The staff kept walk by with those drinks on the tray! ....Ole'!

2l1WiltI1mprYwngnoSQBg.text: I loved everything the menu had to offer. The good and the service was all do wonderful! I enjoyed everything I ate! It is not close to where I live but I am so down to making the drive. The micheladas were the only thing that I wasn't sold on. They're okay but not to my liking personally. However, I won't let that hold me back from going back! Loved it!

7FDjcrE3Mf3HpE-WLrGd4g.text: Came here for lunch on Sunday and it was pretty packed. Well deserved though because excellent food and service. Probably one of the best meals I've ever had. There's so many nice touches, the experience is overall awesome.  We tried:  Molcajete Caliente: an incredible dish. Got it with the green sauce. It's so tasty but not spicy. Comes with steak, chicken, fish, and shrimp on the sides, but also octupus in the green sauce.  All the meat was perfectly cooked, but actually I enjoyed the fish the most, it was perfectly seasoned and juicy. Definitely a must try.  Guac: really fresh tasting and perfect with the chips

sj_lC-mJsG2pEIaTN6bMTg.text: So I have been here a few times and the service and food were good, HOWEVER .... I was in the other day during lunch had the worst waitress ever. It took her forever to come and even acknowledge or take a drink order. Once I flagged her down I ordered 6 oysters prepared in which 2 were completely frozen to the shell. She put a really sour taste in my mouth and not sure I'll be back.

hnXlheyY9Mq50GfI2HDC8A.text: So good, MX coke, the pescado frita es  Muy sabroso!! They even gave each person at our table a free ceviche tostada. Will be back A.S.A.P.

WgR6iG4z4FwakQ0Iug5Rtw.text: Love everything. Perfectly authentic and original. Great service, amazing food. This is the real deal. Take someone here from out of town to impress them with authenticity.

F2RC74a-zGAX47iVpgqxww.text: Wow!! Just...wow! This place blew me away. I'm in town for the spring training game and found this place...people in my party were doubting the freshness of the food, being that we are from San Diego and near the coast. Where we wrong and blown away! It was fresher than some of my fave places in SD. Complimentary fish ceviche was very fresh. The Michel Asa's were also fresh! Definitely coming back here again next time I'm in town.

v_kP3qV3bhLk4FBMAsXOtg.text: Incredible presentation of food, flavor out of this world, service that was best experience.  Definitely one to search out. We are from San Diego and have never experienced anything like this. Definitely a 10

I recommend for your first time going to order the molcajete with green sauce and camarones Fantasia shrimp wrapped in bacon! Wash it down with an ice cold Michelada!

xiRTWweG35Uu2DvtGKGfmg.text: Absolutely delicious.  Will reccomend to anyone visiting the area. Had early lunch on Saturday.  Service was great and al pastor tacos did not disappoint.  Had ceviche appetizer to wake me up.

OxFtdDGTbM9sljsf2WCrzw.text: Dine in experience   The place was pretty much dead on a early Monday afternoon so it was much appreciated the devoted attention we received from our server Veronica. We let her know we were out of town and was welcoming and helpful with the menu.   Ordered a Coctel Grande Campechana & a Carne Asada plate.  I can only go into detail regarding the Carne Asada plate seeing how this was my personal plate. The steak was tender and juicy (not dry at all). Beans & rice were good, nothing special but overall good. The Coctel was good according to my wife, not just full of juice like other places but a good amount of seafood in that cup   Friendly staff & good food makes this place a sure place to return to. Thanks to Hector (manager) for making our visit a pleasant one

mK8lwxp-RVO1MSBjiveycQ.text: Whenever a friend or out of towner asks me where they can find the best Mexican food in the valley, my answer is always the same.  The more questionable the neighborhood, the better.  That's by no means an exact science (nor meant to be demeaning to the neighborhoods for which many of these establishments undoubtedly take great pride).  But with apologies to the numerous suburban Mexican food establishments that dot the valley landscape, the working class Hispanic neighborhoods of inner city Phoenix are where I've always found the best Mexican grub.  When I told my Dad I wanted to try this place and where it was, he hesitated a bit thinking we were driving into a death trap.  Fortunately my food adventurist side convinced him to make the trip with me to try this place for the first time.  And oh, what a place.  I first found out about Maria Maldonado's creation on a segment of the wildly popular PBS show Check Please Arizona (you can watch it on YouTube right now).  From the onset, you could tell this wasn't your typical Mexican establishment.  While they have all the usual Mexican staples you'd expect (burritos, tacos, fajitas, etc.), the emphasis here is decidedly on seafood.  But even the meat dishes here are completely unique to the valley (more on that in a bit).  Thanks to the Check Please segment and the fabulous Yelp reviews, we came in the door on a Sunday afternoon.  As I expected (though to the shock of my Dad), the place is a rainbow of colors from the furniture, to the walls, to the numerous photos and keepsakes on the wall.  And yet its small enough that it feels like you've walked into someone's dining room.  We got here just before the dinner rush so we got sat immediately.  My Dad and I first got a couple of Dos Equis Lagers to start.  I mention this because the beers that came out were HUGE.  The beers came in cold gigantic beer mugs to where there was at least 2 bottles worth of beer in each mug.  Did not see that coming, but a GREAT start to the evening.  Next, we (unexpectedly) each got a complementary appetizer of ceviche on a tostada.  Basically a variety of different fishes (I think I picked up octopus, shrimp and tuna) mixed with guacamole and other veggies with a hint of lime juice.  Very refreshing dish.  Then they brought out the chips and salsas (one of which was a green salsa that had a big kick to it).  All of this food and drink before we even ordered our own dishes?  Wow.  My Dad got the grilled shrimp skewers that were seasoned and wrapped in bacon and cheese.  I went with the dish this place is most famous for.  A giant molten bowl of green tomatillo sauce and cheese with shrimp, fish, chicken, and beef lining the rim of the bowl (see my photo).  This my friends is the Molcajete Caliente (even the name sounds intimidating doesn't it?).  Both of our dishes came with a side of beans and rice (though even the rice was different as it was more of a rice pilaf).  While the tomatillo and cheese is bubbling hot (and pretty much stays that way), its actually not spicy at all.  But it coated every piece of meat on the bowl beautifully.  The meats were all grilled and seasoned perfectly and with a coat of that tomatillo and cheese I was in heaven.  My Dad absolutely destroyed his bacon and cheese shrimps he loved them so much.  I was going to use the Yelp check in for the free tres leches cake (which they do honor), but we were both so stuffed full of food and beer we couldn't eat another bite.  Between the great food, festive atmosphere, friendly waitress and stuffed stomaches, our first venture here was a highly successful one.  Total tab for the 2 huge beers, chips and salsa, complimentary ceviche tostadas, main dishes, sides, tax and tip was $75.  The Molcajete is $30 by itself so that's what pushed the price a little higher (they also have a bowl for larger groups that runs around $40).  But trust me, this is $30 worth spending.  It can easily feed two or more people (though I stupidity tried to take it down myself).  I'll happily enjoy the rest for lunch tomorrow.    So like I said, if you're craving good Mexican food, look towards the inner city area.  Even though i was pretty excited about this place, even I was surprised how generous the portions were and by all the freebees.  Its no wonder the place was packed the whole time we were there and why it seemed like every customer was smiling.  The Maldonados originally created this oasis in the desert to help pay for their kids' college education and achieve the American dream for their entire family.  If their cuisine, staff and happy customers are any indication, I'd say the hard work has paid off, many many times over.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Me in awe of the Molcajete Caliente (you will be too)

NE6wt6zLAiUwhXJrMbP0Gg.text: This is by far the BEST mariscos I've had in the states. Nothing compares to Mexico. I've been to plenty of mariscos places and this one is hands down the best ever. You definitely get what you're paying for. Their complimentary chips and salsas are tasty. They also throw in a complimentary tostada de ceviche. Not sure about the $4 side of avocado but besides that I recommend this place!!

TvUcmLv5i0bth72DnQ45jA.text: Service food drinks ambiance ! If you're looking for a seafood place in the area you have to stop here ! I'm super picky with my food and this place exceeded my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious

ShK5DWoab1AKKtuqUFeZxQ.text: First visit here and we will be back! The place is so fun and bright, fast service. Chips and salsas hit the spot and the complimentary toastada got us ready for our main course. The molcajete for two with green sauce was so good we didn't need to add any extra sauce or spices, although if you like it hot I'm sure you could add some picante sauce. There was plenty of picante sauce options to choose from on the table. Fast and friendly service, the waitress helped us select what we ordered and she didn't steer us wrong. Can't wait for our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete for two with green sauce, DELISH!

eJjbhDCfDMSuP4pnN7GCqg.text: Im here on a business trip from California and default to Yelp as hunger savior. I found Mariscos Playa Hermosa based off my location and yelp reviews.   I walked in and there were only 4 other people eating,  then again it was only 6pm. I was greeted by a friendly gal.  I picked my own seat and immediately was offered a drink.  I got agua de  Jamaica which was perfect not too sweet. I was brought chips and salsa a few minutes later. There were 2 salsas, an avocado salsa and a red salsa. The avocado one was perfect,  the red was great but OH EM GEE my mouth was on fire. I love hot sauce, but this for sure was blazing!   I really wanted shrimp and asked for recommendations.  I was recommended the bacon wrapped shrimp but decided not too because I'd feel guilty of it being too fatty. I then was recommended the A ala diabla shrimp. I usually love spicy shrimp, but at this point my mouth was on fire from the salsa.....sooo i got it anyway. Why not?    My plate arrived with about 6 shrimp and tons of sauce with rice beans and sode salad.  The beans and rice were great, but holy moly the shrimp were BLAZING SPICY holy moly. They were still good.  Overall, the service and food was great. I will def come back on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A la diabla shrimp,  so hot!

eF3iRusLhpLk3BhLSdH_dQ.text: This place was so good.  We went on a Friday night and a Mariachi band was playing, so it was crazy busy.  They offered to either seat us immediately on the patio, or let us wait outside for a table inside.  We opted to wait, and we were so glad we did.  The wait was pretty short and we ended up with an awesome table.  Awesome because of its location but also awesome because of the craftsmanship and artistry that went into the hand-carved and hand-painted table.  It was beautiful.  Then came drinks.  Our margs were a bit too sweet, but not too bad.  They need to use lime juice instead of bottled sweet-n-sour.  If they would have, we'd of ordered more drinks.  After drinks came the seafood ceviche.  SUPER GOOD.  We then got our shrimp fajitas, and those were amazing.  I think we'd go back, but we'd probably get margaritas elsewhere first.

AHcB3tj6idvlCqB4uxho5Q.text: We had a party of nine everyone order was done right . I order the whole red snapper fried it was very good . The carrot cake was good . Just needs more selection of teas and punches . I was also looking for the menudos soup , they didn't care it they carry seafood soup I get that at home .

kAtL3DRGmxKNnTSqFYrRww.text: Went for lunch with family and no one complained. Everyone loved what they had. They make great Margaritas, the house Margarita is wonderful and the strawberry is made with fresh fruit. They brought us a complimentary ceviche tostada, the fish so so fresh and delicious the citrus flavors were amazing. The chips are freshly baked and the salsa's are wonderful, the green is mild not sure how it is made and the red is spicier but still has manageable for someone like me that isn't into spicy and great for someone who loves spicy like my husband; wonderful flavors. My mother loved the fried shrimp said it was one of the best fried shrimp she had in a long time. My husband and I along with my father-in-law shared the earthen pot filled with steak, seafood and chicken that came with an amazing green sauce ( we choose the mild for me). Along with it is your choice, or you can get both, homemade flour or corn  tortillas. The sides of rice and beans are even very good. For dessert we had the flan and the coconut cake both were excellent but wish they would bring back the tres leche cake that I had the last time we were there which was to die for. We will definitely return and a lot sooner this time.

pkR8zHHmsD08z_e7OtUFkg.text: I love all their seafood and other choices. Free cake with yelp deal. I would definitely recommend this place in Phoenix. Best Mexican food I ever had,  even in Mexico.

oyHM1mcB7rmUUprERrBYEg.text: I was working in the area and was hungry for a traditional ceviche. Found this place on yelp and did not look like anything special from the outside, but WOW! Amazing ceviche, great service and great prices!! Nice and clean on the inside as well. I will make sure to come back next time I am in the area. Todo muy rico!!!

piCYkAInwGG2H3Nd26A4LQ.text: This place is a hidden gem!  Please don't let the surrounding area deter you from this fine establishment!   Staff: unbelievably friendly from beginning to end! Hector, our waiter, was patient throughout the many questions we had and even have us a complimentary ceviche dish to start!   Food: O.M.G! In order of our favorites: 1) molcajete. GET THIS!!! It is basically a volcano of saucy lava that is erupting with steak, chicken, shrimp, and fish. It is served with rice, beans, and tortillas and is made for two or three people to share. It is made in either a green tomatillo (mild) sauce or a red diablo (spicy) sauce. I liked the diablo more bc it had such amazing flavor.  2) guacamole: best ive ever had!! 3) Shrimp in cream sauce: yummmm. Great flavor! 4) Shrimp and octopus in garlic sauce - also good 5) shrimp tacos - just okay. Would choose the above over these  Finally, don't forget to check in on yelp!! Show your waiter and you get a big free slice of cake!!

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House marg
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Surprise ceviche appetizer!

S_TQVl9_fkPnaJ1fy7dv4Q.text: My favorite in Phoenix, the food is fresh and tasty. My husband and I like to treat ourselves and indulge here and there and when my friend told me about this place, i had to go try it out for myself.  We started out with the ceviche yum, they have shrimp and fish, but we went with the order of fish ceviche since my husband is allergic to shrimp. We loved every bite, it comes with tostadas on the side and you can make your own.  We shared the Molcajete, holy smokes! was sooo good. it had alittle bit of everything. You can choose to have a spicy sauce or a mild green sauce we went the the mild green sauce and my husband loved it so much he took the remaining sauce to go.   We're not big drinkers but they have several special drinks i saw walking by that looked very appetizing, I think i will take have to come back with my girlfriends for happy hour. If you're still hungry, ask for the flan, the waitress let us know they make it in house, so I had to taste it out. You can tell its home made. I might even go back to take some to go next time. We're excited to find this place and look forward to try the rest of plates.

h3fhkobBoL2x89p1zcZEMw.text: Great find on my way to airport.  Outdoor patio is beautiful, service was great, fish tacos and a corona made it a perfect early lunch.  Great homemade chips and salsa to start, with 5 hot sauces in each table to choose from.  Bonus is a friendly cat hanging around the patio.

MBuWokLlDUDPEg99D4Wj-A.text: The barbacoa enchiladas in red sauce were outstanding. Probably the best I've ever had. The guacamole, as a side, was unique, yet delicious in its own right. Neat atmosphere. Nice people. Easily a five star place for authentic Mexican food.

nJw_Ss16D7hy6OtJqw6BLw.text: Today was the third time I come to this place and the first review I make. I am giving it 4 stars for the overall experience.  However,  being here 3 times now I can say that some of the reviews are correct, service is a hit and miss, the food depending on what you order will vary as well. We had the "Molcajete" which is a must order serves 2-4 depending on how hungry you are. And we had the "Mojara Frita" whole fried fish. Both come with rice, beans, and a little salad. It was all good and filling.   If you are in a hurry don't come here, this is one of those places that is meant to be enjoyed at a slow pace. Order,  eat chips and salsa, have a drink, chit chat and wait for your food. Atmosphere is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Whole fried fish. I asked for them not to fry it too much and it came out perfect.

FkYk7qZu6w__-U0pfUrx2A.text: Excellent taste and service. Was craving Mexican style seafood and found this place.  Their menu is extensive, however they also have it sectioned out, in case someone in your party wants something other than seafood.  We ordered the shrimp ceviche and the aguachiles. They tasted fresh and spicy. My hubby ordered the chicken enchiladas and they were really good.  The price for the food portion is a little on the steep side, but will definitely visit again.

S4PoeRPXwcH-fVaavG2ODw.text: I came here for lunch and was so surprised it wasn't packed, based on all the great reviews on here.  But, it was a rainy day so that may have deterred some people from going out.  The prices here are a bit higher than you'd typically expect at a regular Mexican restaurant, but you have to keep in mind that you're ordering seafood and seafood in the desert ain't cheap.  (well, it's probably cheap at some places but it's also probably really gross at those places).  for the non-seafood entrees the prices were lower and more what you'd expect.  I ordered a fish taco entree that came with 3 tacos and beans and rice for only $8.99, so that's not bad at all.  The fish was fresh and tender and I really enjoyed the tacos.  However, I did not care for the complimentary fish ceviche tostada thing they served - the fish there tasted a little "off" to me.  I would definitely come here again!

vKnrKWEICcN2RO8M0YD06Q.text: The best Mexican sea food in Arizona! The food was 100% cooked to perfection the quality in all the flavor and salsas they offered were outstanding. The service was fast and instant very friendly staff and the bar will get you tippsy because they make the best drinks I've ever had at a restaurant..

xd1or6suRQJnt1OrYtA2Eg.text: We are visiting from SF.  This was one of the best Mexican food we ever had. Chicken fajita and grilled fish was the best along with fish ceviche. Margarita are amazing.

_BK-V507lCexRKX8l16uYw.text: This place is very authentic and SO GOOD! I have gone twice now, and the food was very tasty both times. If you are in a big group, I recommend the Fiesta Taco platter, it comes with 16 filling tacos!

JLN0bvh8l6TDkS8Bt9rbyQ.text: WOW.... Order the crazy shrimps and the seafood ceviche... Perfection... Clean colorful place.

QO9cCq66RUx-5sjziaaazg.text: This was the most authentic Mexican Restaurant I have been in outside of Mexico.  The Guacamole was out of this world!  I sat at the bar and the bartender (Bella) recommended a "Mexican Mule" made with Ginger beer and Tequila which really went well with the Shrimp dish (Camarones Rancheros) that I ordered.  I liked it so much that I am going back tonight for more.  They even had a real Mariachi band that was awesome!  Don't be surprised by the meager look from the outside of this place!  It is truly remarkable.

sX9DD9-fP4anrgG9H4yFAA.text: Fantastic service and food! We ordered tostadas, tacos, margaritas and micheladas, and were not disappointed. Fish tasted fresh and Barbados flavorful. Place was also very baby-/family-friendly. Our new favorite spot!

Loved everything: Ceviche--crisp, fresh, delicious; stuffed peppers with shrimp--incredible; and for my entree I got the divorced fish--SO GOOD! Really great find that I'm thankful for. BqtwLln0v1z-zwIbVFQuzA.text: Everything was authentic and hit the spot. My fiance ordered the shrimp culichi and I ordered shrimp cocktail. Shrimp culichi is really a curry shrimp. bPmoGfbgL40VcEao8MY6vA.text: Best Micheladas ever !!! They provide chips, salsa and fish tostada as an appetizer  yumny in my tummy... I have had the culichi shrimp  ( favorite) it's amazing... they have good hot seafood plates.. Once I ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp and it was yucky, raw.. but everything else great !

0BsONsf3SestGNMXH5raZw.text: What a fantastic meal I had.  I've been desiring amazing Mexican restaurants in Arizona.  Since I moved here, I've been to several places that were underwhelming, at best, and generally just not good to me.  So, I'd given up on Mexican Food in AZ and I just didn't eat any.  Well, a conversation in Yelp Talk about Mexican Food inspired me to check out some different places and this one turned up in my searches on Yelp and other websites.  I'm happy to say that I was so thrilled and enjoyed my meal very much at Mariscos Playa Hermosa.  Again, another hole-in-the-wall, but still quite the find.  Mariscos is located in a pretty seedy part of town, so don't get nervous going there.  They close early, so you'd better arrive early.  You will find that there is a full bar inside this colorfully decorated resto.  Don't eat at the bar.  That things not suitable for anything except decoration as the bar itself doesn't extend out far enough to make it comfortable to sit there.  (this is a tip from a person who opted to sit at the bar)  I tasted a few items off the menu.  The shrimp in diablo sauce was my favorite.  I ordered extra diablo sauce on the side.   The sauce has a smokey taste with the heat of the peppers.  Perfect for my heat seeking taste buds.  They prepare the sauce "fresh to order".So there is a charge for $3 for the extra sauce on the side to go.  I used that sauce to make more shrimp diablo at home later that week.    I also enjoyed the camarones culichi... shrimp in green sauce.  Culichi is a tomatillio sauce made with some dairy product and cilantro and of course the poblano or tomatillio peppers.  The sauce is simply to die for.  I left there satisfied and happy!    I will return and take a friend for the Molcajete Caliente with verde sauce.  Can't wait.  I'm sure it will please.  They have a check-in offer too, so be sure to check-in.  Oh, that parking lot is TINY.  Be aware of that when you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AaMaPiCAuZUUk0J1m1sWhA.text: Service-5 Food-5 Decor-4 Atmosphere-4 Value-4  Food was wonderful service was great. There is nothing that I would change about my experience. I had the stuffed fished. (Shrimp and octopus) I forget the exact name but I will definitely be ordering it again. Their appetizer was wonderful. You can really taste the freshness in the ingredients. No complaints, even the house margaritas were some of the best I have ever had. Yelp had a check in offer for a free slice of cake. Our waitress was so sweet that since we weren't able to decided on coconut or chocolate she gave us a small slice of each. These cakes were moist and delightful. The thing that kept me from devouring the whole thing was fact I was pretty full from my app & main course. Will definitely be back. Will definitely recommend.

jeuV8Kqje7vqCnvuU4gcwg.text: This place is a must try!! The Best service and Best Mariscos in town! We just relocated to AZ from South San Diego and its hard to find a decent place for mexican food/mariscos and we got lucky to find this awesome place. Ingrid is the best waitress but everyone is friendly and knowledgeable. Whatever dish or drink you order I'm sure you won't be disappointed as its all so amazing!

CgcFI3xb7fkvv3skwUT18A.text: Amazing food, the place is beautiful and colorful. Workers doing a good job always checking up on you. Not a big fan of sea food but now I'm liking it :)  Will return!!

3sdTZSzpqmvriZ5K4K2zhQ.text: Easily 4.5 stars but I'm rounding it up to 5 just necause of the Micheladas that are pretty bland. ...but the food? A perfect 10. jgNe-2zSMSPDgJjqeMrpbA.text: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. My dad was craving ceviche, so I decided to take them to Mariscos Playa Hermosa. There is a reason the reviews for this restaurant is so high - it has great food, great service, and beautiful furniture/ decorations.   Before we received our order, we were given chips + salsa/guac. The chips were very oily and I wasn't a big fan, but that initial impression was soon overcome with the best tasting ceviche on top of a crispy corn tortilla. My mom, who isn't a fan of cilantro, said that it was the highlight of her meal.   My dad and I decided to share the House Special/ Molcajete ($30 for two people), which consisted of shrimps, two tilapila pieces, two chicken slices, and two beef slices in green sauce. It came with corn tortillas, rice, beans, and salad. None of my family members can eat spicy foods, but there is also an option for the "Diablo" sauce, which I heard is pretty spicy. We were definitely not let down - it was just the right taste and the right temperature. My mom got the garlic shrimp (I think it was $13?) and the portion for the main piece was relatively small-medium in size, but it also came with rice, beans, and salad. She liked the clean taste.  The service was great; our waitress constantly checked in to see if we needed anything. The noise level was loud because there were constantly people coming in and out of the restaurant, but that signifies just how many people are fans of this restaurant. Also, for anyone who's curious, there are TVs (might be good for game-days).  At the end of our meal, we got a free coconut cake by checking in to Yelp, and the cream on the cake was delicious; the icing tasted like a sweeter version of coconut ice cream. When we were finished, we were way too stuffed. Dad said that we should come back again with the aunts - that's one of the rare times I've ever heard him say, "let's come back again".   Highly recommended! If you like seafood + Mexican food, go here.

N7Kr82crYOB-5bNRjmJpdQ.text: This restaurant provides excellent service, a live Mexican mariachi, and authentic food. You can't beat that!

oaGg_pEtusDODLSvdXGQVA.text: This review is long overdue.  While visiting Phoenix for Spring Training  we yelped Mexican restaurants near our AirBnB and based on reviews we tried Mariscos Playa Hermosa. We hit the food lottery! I'm not going to be arrogant and call myself a Mexican food expert but I have lived in the southwest for 40 years and long ago married into a Mexican family for 12 years. I don't care for franchises. Everything was great starting with the drinks, chips&salsa, complimentary fish cerveche and main dishes. The service was above and beyond almost any restaurant  my wife and I have ever been to. We will visit on every trip to Arizona.

QRHTglySV00nMFE_Es9CfQ.text: Awesome ceviche. So happy we came across this spot. Close to the airport so you can hit before or after a flight.

XH2hETVBvz3-XEdviYEyug.text: Best seafood Mexican restaurant in the valley and its not even close!  I enjoy coming here on the weekends to see the like Mariachi band play and enjoy fresh seafood.  This place never disappoints.  It gets pretty busy during the weekend, but just like all great places, its well worth the wait.  I can see they were extremely busy on Saturday and even the manager came over and check in on us.  Her name was Yesica and she was very attentive and took great care of us.  I highly recommend this place!

JKrA1bnXvw5XnTc6uajjuw.text: We have a lot of cheap Mexican food options in the valley, but this place is legit.   A clean little hole in the wall joint with outstanding service, killer food and all the details done right.   When I want real authentic Mexican food, I don't want to eat it out of a strip mall.   I want the whole experience.    The carne asada came with sauteed onions and home made tortillas.  The crab in my wifes seafood enchilada had real crab in it (most places uses imitation crab).   The chips and salsa had home made chips, and the salsa had a couple of options, and was hot and flavorful.   The chicken tacos were fresh and the whole deal was 100% on point.   I can't speak spanish, but I know home made food when I see it.     Even the decorations:   The chairs themselves were full of color and straight from Mexico.     We ate, enjoyed each others company and the waitress even comped us with some kind of free salmon corn tostada things for what clearly appeared to be for their new gringo customers.   They were delicious.   The food, the service, the everything:  I think I love you guys.  Hell yes... Ill be back.

Jose was our server and was great. Today was my husbands birthday and he made sure everything was perfect and they sang and brought him Cake after with his name on it. When we walked in someone greeted us right away and walked us to the patio. It was about a 15-20 min wait. Our server was amazing. He was super attentive and on his "server game". I just loved how professional, friendly and the sense of urgency! Which is key! They food was bomb! Just what I expected! Best Value for your buck! I strongly recommend this place!

meyUaMMBPpm9YXrFgS4B3g.text: This is my favorite marisco spot in Phoenix! Their menu has a wide selection of cooked and raw seafood, my favorites are the Tostada Embarazada and El Huachorizo. Their drink menu is just as amazing, I recommend the Mango Diablo, the best way to describe it is an adult mangonada, yummy! I've been here with groups of friends and family and they all loved it. One of those visits was with a group of about 15 people and they were able to accommodate the big group into a private area with plenty of space. The service is always amazing and the servers are always enthusiastic and ready to provide a great experience. On top of that, the decor is bright and fun, giving the place an authentic Latin touch. They also play great music and have a mariachi band on Sundays. I do have to warn you they are pretty busy during the weekends but the 20-25 minute wait is well worth it.
