Om_FLPdvHRUGta1Qap-8FQ.text: Great service from Estrella!  Place was packed on a Sunday afternoon but the wait wasn't too long.  First of allI have to say that the freshness of the fish was amazing.  We had the molcajete caliente for two.  It was excellent.  The only letdown was the carne asada in this dish that features shrimp, fish, chicken as well.  It was a bit dry and not as top notch as the other ingredients.  These are served with an AMAZING green sauce in a hot pot.  We also had both chicken and shrimp tacos. The shrimp tacos were "crave worthy".  They came with rice, beans and a small salad.   The beans were super good.  Guacamole was fresh made and delicious.  As others have stated it is no cheap date but a good value based on the portions, flavors and freshness of the seafood!  Not to mention the friendly service!

Ev8JEo4_ZLLWOJa76q-SHw.text: Very good, authentic Mexican food! We had the enchiladas, pork tacos and the queso dip. The only thing we weren't a big fan on was the salsas. The chips were amazing though! I would highly recommend and can't wait to come back next time I am in the area.

flhE7syVkN5HbM9f-JT6Ag.text: This place has the best food and the best service!!! The super parillada is the best!!! The atmosphere is great. I would definitely recommend this place for Mexican food and seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super Parillada!

vlw1iBmmbKJd3HZS8mnY5g.text: Best Mexican Seafood place in the entire Phoenix area.  Very fresh food, lots of variety, reasonable prices.  This is a smaller restaurant with mostly families or people coming to have a special meal.  Always fairly full but we have never had to wait for a table.  There are some servers that speak English if you do not speak Spanish, the menu is in Spanish and English.  We come here often, whenever we are in this area of town.  However, we also often make the drive here because it is worth it.  We have eaten at several other Mexican Seafood places in the area, some are worth going back to but none are quite as good as Mariscos Playa Hemosa.

fElywkzJLwb1ucHw2ADMWQ.text: Came here with a friend during the week and it was a nice surprise. The service was excellent and we had margaritas made to order. I had the tacos gobernador (shrimp and cheese) and they were excellent.

8fu3eHLOLvnIwayVG7qoqQ.text: The decor and seating are by far the most interesting I've seen, hand carved tables and chairs!  The food was delicious, the margaritas were humungous, everything was simply splendid! We arrived and we had a private party table in the back room for a graduation, the decor is something to note.  It's like being in Mexico (not that we are too far away), I was thoroughly impressed with the hand crafted chairs and tables.  How did they fit them inside those tiny little rooms?  Did they build them in there?  How can I get these for my house?!  Anyways, food was great, service was at par, and the drinks were delicious.  The graduate said she went there all the time so, with fair pricing and good food.  This seems like a great place for a casual meal. Beware: Parking lot is super small, may be best to park on the street if you can't physically see parking as you pull up.  Also, make a reservation if possible, place was packed at 5:00pm on a Tuesday!

YUa_12BD9BNfM2AJQgNckQ.text: Have you ever experienced molcajete? HAVE YOU?!  This is THE place to have that experience. I say "experience" because molcajete is more like a witch's bubbling brew than a meal. Mariscos is a cozy little restaurant in an area a lot of people won't flock to, but it stays busy. All the good stuff applies here... friendly service, great food, Mexican beers, Mariachis (on Fridays, I believe). It's just a great place. And, now that the formalities are out of the way, I can talk about the molcajete.   Molcajete is actually the name of the stone bowl that is used more traditionally as a mortar for salsas and such. As a dish though, it's a beautiful mixture of spicy/tangy sauce, grilled meats, grilled veggies, and cheese. It's one of my favorite Mexican dishes, period. Mariscos serves theirs with tons of fixins (beans, tortillas, salsas, etc.) that could probably fill two people up on their own, but their generous serving is much appreciated when ordering this dish for a small group. It's definitely one of those meals that'll impress people when it gets served. Order one for the table, and you're going to have a good time.  I could spout on all day about molcajete... But, would ya look at that, I have a decent size review already, and I haven't even talked about the restaurant's specialty, seafood. Well, I'll let you read some other reviews for that. I'll just say that I love their tostadas de ceviche de camaron!   Go to Mariscos Playa Hermosa, and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s delicious!

FoaEiaJrturdq_OqNSdzRw.text: On a recent vacation to Mexico, my mom asked Jared and I where the best Mexican food in Phoenix was... This place immediately came to mind for us both!  When you walk into the door of Mariscos Playa Hermosa, you feel like you very well may be in Mexico.  It feels extremely authentic, with a festive atmosphere, a staff that doesn't speak too much English, and food that is delicioso!  It's nothing like the Americanized Mexican / Latin places  you've been to before.   Don't load up on the chips and salsa as the portions are big and you'll want to save room for what is to come.  Their house iced tea is very good if you want something other than a cold cerveza.  As Annie D said in her review, I highly recommend going with the Molcajete Caliente with verde sauce. You can't go wrong with that!  I ordered something else and ate off of Jared's Molcajete Caliente along with my own.  That sauce is incredible!  Note that this place closes early during the week.  We met some friends there at 7pm and at 8:20 we were the last ones in there and we could tell the staff was ready to go home.    I can't wait to return to this local gem of a restauran for another memorable meal very soon.

1WuZ2ELOtbdYgurLGJhKCg.text: I've been trying out variety of seafood places, this location is cozy, clean. We had oisters "preparados" which means they add a slice of avocado and a large raw shrimp and thin slice of purple onion. We also tried the shrimp and cucumber appetizer with a special sauce that tasted good with a hint of soy sauce. The garlic shrimp came with a decent portion of shrimp and rice and beans on the side. The shrimp was swimming in garlic butter,bell pepper, onion and seasoning. The ceviche tostada was tasty and the micheladas were ok, I prefer to have them with lots of lime chili seasoning and plenty of Clamato. The salsa and chips are good the beans and rice we're great. I love the variety of options they have available and I would definitely come for more.

76reeum0ywMSiTfX0uDXrw.text: The best Mexican seafood in Phoenix. Everything on the menu is delicious and well worth the price. If you're a first-timer fry the fish tacos w/cheese, you won't be disappointed.

jBOYkev4Kp3FthpSbi9Hyg.text: Best tortillas I have ever had! I can go to this place and just order tortillas lol. They also have the nicest waiters, always checking on us even though it was crowded. First time visiting AZ, I had high expectations on their Mexican food, they did not disappoint! Their prices a bit higher than what I'm use to but nevertheless the food was good.

CO39qeDMbKGLlh0nm5mXxg.text: Simply amazing! $4.00 24oz draft beers and delicious desserts rounded out an absolutely fantastic meal. We had shrimp ceviche. shrimp and fish tacos, and the Shrimp Culiche.  The shrimp ceviche had delicious spices, wonderful chunks of delicious goodness, and was definitely a 5 star dish.  My only kvetch would be that it needed about three more slices of avocado.  The shrimp tacos were good. Not 5 star--maybe 3 and a half since the shrimp tasted faintly (VERY faintly) of iodine, and I would have liked some freshness added into the taco--like shredded lettuce, or cabbage, or tomatoes, or something.  Fish tacos were bomb!  4 and a half stars.  They just miss being 5 star because they really were too salty.  HOWEVER, even with too much salt, I will order them again.  They were yummy.  The Shrimp Culiche, wow.  Amazing flavor.  My suggestion, soak up the crazy good sauce with maybe the rice, or dip your tortillas in it, but don't waste it!!!  Oh, and the restaurant is cute inside too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mom&#39;s birthday dinner
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ogVWT3siiLsjO0_uOa5uWw.text: Excellent food!  Complimentary ceviche was fantastic and so were the shrimp tacos!!!  Will definitely go back.

Ssn-7Dx8UzR02cLxMgkQ7Q.text: Why doesn't this restaurant come up when you search for Mexican Seafood or restaurants near Sky Harbor? Don't they pay Yelp enough graft? Anyway that's beside the point. Bottom line is this place is very clean and has very friendly service, but the food is boring and unimpressive.  Even the chips and salsa are lacking. Chips should be thin and crispy, but their chips appear baked and puffy!

DVYLEfHw8Lm57ss9rEMbwQ.text: Very Good Family owned Sinaloan Style Mexican SEAFOOD Restaurant that's open everyday for lunch and dinner. Prices are reasonable I'd say the average plate price runs about $13.00. Most of the menu is seafood so plan on having seafood if you come here.   I've been here several times over the years and I'd say most of the time but not always they start you off with a complimentary mini fish tostada that delicious with your chips and salsas.  I can vouch for the Fish Veracruzana and the Fish Poblano plates because I had them before and the fish was light ,fresh tasting and flaky. The sauce and toppings  is really what made these dishes good to me. They come with your usual rice and beans and tortillas. They have many choices in this kind of dish.  Last time I was here the place was packed and we were the only table in the place that didn't order the Molcajete so I wanted to order it this time.  The Molcajete is a boiling hot caldron filled with your choice of Diablo Hot Chipotle sauce or Tomatillo Sauce. The menu that we had reads Fish, Shrimp, and Beef. But what we received was Battered Fish, Shrimp, Beef, Chicken and Octopus. The Diablo sauce is very hot and spicy but also very tasty and I found myself adding it everything I ate. Over all I thought it was good and fun to share. It cost $22.00 and feeds at least two people. It also comes with rice , beans and tortillas. If you get the Molcajete you should eat the shrimp first because they get over cooked just sitting on the hot Molcajete as ours did. I'm not a beef person but I thought the beef came out prepared the best in this dish.  I do note you should view the photo of the building so you know what the outside looks like before you give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Complimentary Fish Tostada
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete Diablo - Battered Fish, Shrimp, Beef, Chicken, Octopus in Hot Chipotle Sauce

CIFT9RXninPx6E1hyERrbA.text: Found references on Yelp and gave it a try. I gound a wonderful, colorful, small family restaurant close to Sky Harbor. It was packed with young local families. Service was pleasant and efficient. The shrimp with tomatilla, cheese and cilantro was superb. I'd heartily recommend. I will go back whenever I get the opportunity.

7RujT9vlmdnTZdFRQyhOrg.text: Hidden Gem.. Scary Exterior (especially IF you aren't from the area). So we found this place on Yelp.. drove around a few times and then when we found it, we couldn't believe this place was actually where we were thinking about having dinner. The area is less than inviting and at night it feels destitute.  We decide to take a chance and the interior is warm and bright. Patrons are enjoying themselves and we are greeted with big smiles by the waitress.  We were seated and served this pretty tasty ceviche tosta on the house. We also ordered a separate order of ceviche, that wasn't as good and took forever to come out. But skipping on to the entrees, people were pleasantly surprised.. ranging from my vegan co-worker to my meat head only co-worker. I had the fish in red sauce with rice and beans which was awesome. My vegan friend had the enchiladas with green sauce which was also tasty. I did hear the drinks were not that tasty.. so be wary of the margaritas.  Good food, reasonable price. I'd give it a 2nd go.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

cF0MyZ5TJHdt-klJVCDzpQ.text: Good food but terrible waitresses. I had to get up two times to ask for more drinks and tortillas. I know it was a busy Sunday but that doesn't excuse the terrible customer service.  It ruined my entire meal with the family.  I don't think I'll be back.  Buena comida, pero muy mal meseras. Me tuve que levantar dos veces para pedir mas bebidas y tortillas.Tengo en cuenta que era un domingo ocupado pero eso no es una excusa para un servicio al cliente tan terrible. No vuelvo a regresar a este lugar.  Owners of this place please hire more competent waitresses. I think you need it.

AX82kv6XKaznnt7GAplaJA.text: Earlier in the day we were vastly disappointed at another restaurant, but didn't want to just chuck it in so we came for drinks - and left stunned how appetizing the food coming out of the kitchen was.  Our server was attentive and answered our many questions about the food that was coming out.  I had the mango margarita and it was A REAL MANGO not the flavoring and ice that some places do.    The parking is on the more difficult side, but that isn't stopping us from coming back.  We plan on inviting my roommate to give it go.  I'm working downtown so I will be popping in to enjoy it soon.   Loved the interior.

7fAFT-DKfcgUWxD3Y4CWUA.text: Pinch me I have died an gone to heaven...!!! Going to the Circus found  this treasure on yelp and I'm a better person for it...!! Cant wait to come back...

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh yea we r rockin it ...Baby!!!

5f2yJiYdfl_iPMG72tOASw.text: Excellent service!! Quick and tasty, one of the best places in Phoenix. Came on a busy Sunday afternoon and offered a complimentary tostada de ceviche which was delicious! Two thimbs up

b95AjGbblmVXQaTy88PF7A.text: I love this restaurant.  I moved to Phoenix from Tucson recently and have been looking for a high-quality Mariscos (Tucson has a ton of these restaurants).  The food was absolutely delicious.  My partner and I enjoyed the seafood soup as well as the abalone cocktail.  We also each had a michelada.  The food was exceptional and the micheladas were not as spicy as I've had, but I prefer them less spicy anyway.  I'm sure they would spice it up more if you asked for it.  The place is really cute too--super funky tables and chairs and lots of color.  I will be back!

IgQFK_rkHGJ6RzHRTnQ5Dw.text: Worst place ever, orchatas my friends and I ordered were warm, the mariscos were also warm and watered down. Terrible servers. As soon as we got our food they brought out the bill.  Never coming here again.

-bdN8lqnKAT0iNL6c3P-wg.text: Yummy!!!! Great food and awesome service!!! You must eat here ... The prices are great for fresh sea food.

TbiX0dz15X71a5hwYy8mxQ.text: Super good food, the al pastor tacos were phenomenal. On top of that, our waiter Hassen was the nicest waiter I think I have ever had. Super polite and attentive, made sure we had everything we needed even though they were super busy. Definitely coming back the next time I am in the area.

yLyMCHcMK-uZbu1vysM-Bw.text: GREAT food and service from Brenda!  Tried this for the first time with my visiting family and it was a great experience.  Sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the music even though we had every intention of sitting inside and listen to the mariachi band.  Definitely will be going back

7qfRNuXwkZq0uWvVqcGcaw.text: Everything about this place is authentic. From the hospitality of the staff to the amazing food, you really feel like you have the warmth of Mexico right here in Phoenix. I was skeptical of the other reviews but once I sat down, I believed it. I highly recommend enjoying this little jewel of a restaurant!!!

AFBUemtZHpnJjUhNv1S0xQ.text: Been there twice with the wife... I love the look inside, feels like you are actually in Mexico, very colorful, this is a very unique place we have here in the hood.  The service is great and the food is great.

1uKtKO1a8fS4GckoHg2wdQ.text: The best oysters,  we love the red snapper covered in salsa,  the drinks are always amazing and mariachis on Friday are the best.

lTGr4b0yDijH3imlH6HUwg.text: I've been here twice and just recently we went to celebrate my parents 25 year anniversary . I ordered the molcajete salsa de Diablo which was super amazing ! We couldn't finish it though lol , it was too much for us . And I ordered a mango smoothie type drink with patron shots . All in all it was delicious ! The mariachi was there and they played a few songs for us which was cool and very loud lol . I will be back

k2fQs-SQVKxTmjbY2wtRYw.text: This is one of my favorite mariscos in Phoenix. The shrimp culichi is amazing. Service is usually good. They are usually very busy and waitresses are friendly.

QPxGMGEaPZ7HhZ-mZFUC2A.text: Nice place and amazing food, bring your friends and family. If they are busy, bring your co-workers!!!!!

I ordered the molcajete caliente and I can't explain how good the green sauce was! Spicy but with flavor and the chicken was well cooked and seasoned! Service could be better though.

1IHLjKZARsrB9q37oAhh8A.text: Truly authentic Mexican dishes and well prepared. I got the enchiladas rojas and the barbacoa was juicy and the salsa on point. Overall this restaurant defines a five star joint

owJglKhpxsxr6u9fCHubIA.text: This is definitely your place for Micheladas and Mariscos   The food is great! You will not be disappointed with their food or drinks.    The reason for the 3 star review is the service is very hit or miss.  I still go a couple times a month for my fix.

XYvJOWAtVZxQrVT4gHwzag.text: Were here now.  Wife ordered the fryed fish.. I ordered the fried shrimp plate. There's a couple next to us,I guess on there lunch break. The lady next to me is losing it.   Lol  As soon as she left.. Her date.  Is like. Plz.   Just shut up!!!! Lol.  The food is good.  But still the best tasting Mariscos in phx.  Is still Mariscos Sinaloa off bell on cave creek.. Across McDonalds.

z-LpkENt3yI8Bdr2TaQqgg.text: This place is so consistently fantastic.  The Molcajete for 2 or 3 is the only thing i have ever been able to order because it is that good.  I can't recommend this place enough

3shomwM4VoeRQ09OgN_Tbg.text: Delicious and authentic!! Great service and would definitely go here again. We had a ceviche that included octopus calamari clams oysters and other fish. It was delicious and served with lots of little of fun garnishes.  If you are craving ceviche this is totally the place to go. They also have a really fun list of drinks to try out. Great place! Can't wait to go back

N8FQDvPyRqdl-Kx5WMNLfg.text: Here in town from Los Angeles. We yelped a seafood restaurant. Wow far beyond what we expected. Service was amazing and food was delicious. Our waitress Karen was absolutely amazing. She was so attentive . If ever visiting again we definitely will be back! A+ all the way around!

XZFiTQSHnJyjxwR-BNQ9vw.text: Went here for dinner with my AZ family. I'm from San Diego and know what really good Mexican food is. This place was amazing! I had these delicious shrimp stuffed, bacon wrapped yellow peppers!

0HFMXsc5yIameukgoETf-Q.text: This place is a hidden gem! I got the taco trio with chicken, shrimp and carne asada. So delicious and the brought out a free ceviche. It definitely is worth trying out if you are into seafood

h0QvvFvdo-WCUDdTKmL-vw.text: I was kinda disappointed after reading all the great yelping on this restaurant.  We were in two weeks ago on a Sunday.  The inside is nice with a comfortable ambiance.  I ordered the Camarones al Mojo de ajo...sad to say, nothing special nor did a I get that great garlicy flavor.  If anything there was mostly bell pepper as filler, I didn't dam order fajita style so what's with so much bell pepper and onion???  Rice and beans were good, but just a doppling of both, really??!!  I also ordered the shrimp ceviche as an appetizer, again it was just meh.  Nothing really stood out, other than the limey juice and again, it was more of pico de gallo all mixed in that was another filler.  Maybe it was just an off day, but nothing special.  I still love San Carlos Bay on McDowell Road.  I have been going there since the early 90's and the have the best tasting seafood dishes.  Only down side is that they are cash only.  My daughter ordered a shrimp cocktail, hoping it would taste similar to those in Rocky Point, she told me that it was nothing special.  My niece ordered chicken enchiladas and nothing seafood, but said they were the best enchiladas she's had.  Go figure!!

bKkzRdQYhuFuf365TdZvaw.text: The margarita was delicious, the complimentary ceviche top shelf, the camarones (shrimp) culichi was rich and almost creamy, so good I could not stop sopping it up with the tortillas until it was gone.  The sauce is complex, but I am unable to break it down by ingredients. I will take this oportunity to bash Pete's Fish and Chips once again.  You could not get any further from Pete's than by visiting Playa.  Playa Hermosa is not kidding when they claim to bring the ocean to the desert.  I had several fat shrimp that had been "cooked" in lemon juice.  They sat there on  cucumber slices, glossy gray and white, splayed open and bathing in the juice with wedges of avocado. They were so fresh, they looked like they had just been hauled up and dumped on the deck.  This is a mouthful of ocean, there is no mistaking that you are eating seafood!  Food like this touches parts of your brain in a powerful way.  If you were not reared on fresh seafood and the thought of sashimi makes you queasy, then I suggest you not jump in with both feet, maybe work your way up with small portions of ceviche.  The service was very attentive and professional, the feel is genuinely festive. Though Playa Hermosa is a family oriented restaurant I have never noticed any children acting out.  I've found this to be the case generally downtown, the children are well behaved in public, whereas in Chandler, Scottsdale and Mesa I have witnessed children in restaurants behaving more like pro wrestlers than diners.  I live about a mile and a half from Playa and I keep asking myself why I'm not down there more often.

SuiygQhIl6w2f_XCAar99g.text: We have eaten at dozens of Mexican places in the Phoenix area, and Playa Hermosa has to be one of the best, particularly for seafood. Their Camarones Culichi  - shrimp in a ciltantro/tomatillo sauce is to die for - possibly one of the best dishes in all of Phoenix.  Only downside is they close rather early - but well worth the trip - I regularly drive out from Tempe.

wy1C0MUF1gK9dY0Km9KgbQ.text: Ditto to all the positive reviews out there.  This place rocks.  The outside actually isn't THAT bad, but yes, I would hesitate to go in if it weren't for all the fantastic reviews on yelp.  Once inside, it is just as all the pretty yelp pictures depict: a clean and bright dining room with colorful tables and chairs.  My friend and I ordered the mixed seafood cocktail and the shrimp culichi.  Both were super tasty, as were the complimentary ceviche tostadas.  The culichi sauce was so good that I had to stop myself from drinking it.  The seafood cocktail was very refreshing - just what is needed during the Phoenix summer.  It had shrimp, oysters, clams, abalone, calamari, and octopus.  Almost all the seafood was fresh and sweet, and the dish was huge.  The only critique is I can do without the clams.  They are the tiny canned ones instead of the fresh ones like I had in the cocktails in Mexico.  Service was really good as well.  Overall, this was a very pleasant experience.  I will be back and I am telling everyone I know about this new find.

mpRLq3Dij3oyK0rLR4I7oA.text: Food was great we also received a free slice of chocolate cake upon check in. Kid menu was small. Didn't care for the salsa they served with this chips. Atmosphere was intresting. The waitresses about 4 or 5 at a time were seated at a table wrapping silverware I thought that looked tacky and should have been done in the back of the house. Prices were fair. 13.9o to 16.99 for an entree. 3 stars

3tRPHI6bAIUrRJzwmK8yMQ.text: Authentic Mexican restaurant. The warm chips & quac were good. I had the breaded shrimp platter, my partner had the whole fish. The said it was talapia but it was kinda hard to tell! The fish was very good, however. My shrimp platter was just average.

wjYgNnxU7fiODLaspI19SA.text: Love this place!!! My husband and I always leave satisfied! I always order the agua chile appetizer and my husband picks different things every time, but he has loved everything he has tried! They have these micheladas that are amazing! Beers on tap! Try it you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bomb.com.
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. By the time I remembered to take a pic I was almost halfway in. I crave it every day!

F3tvNeJ5x9BJ5-i1__vpGg.text: Love this place! Molcajete was outstanding although I wish they put a little more squid in the green sauce. Great chips, solid ceviche, amazing horchata! Authentic interior with bright colors, festive chairs and tables, and several televisions for watching sports or whatever.

92B_Qe3LstAOhddjpnBPIw.text: Disclaimer: My margarita was perfect and I can't say for sure if that influenced my review of the food :)  Saw this place on "Check Please, Arizona" on channel 8 and was so excited to try it.  And wow, we were not disappointed at all!  In fact, the food far exceeded our expectations!    We had the molcajete with green sauce.  It's basically a giant hot lava bowl full of deliciousness and even though 3 of us couldn't finish all of it, I was still sad when I couldn't cram any more of it in my face.  We also shared a fish fillet with octopus and shrimp in a mushroom cream sauce.  It was also very good, but the star of the show was definitely the green sauce in that molcajete.  We are going back next weekend and looking forward to it!

RIAKhkDe1r3BFFD7n5UVyA.text: Amazing and authentic food. The octopus is something I will dream about for days!! Great atmosphere and fun decor to enjoy. So busy we couldn't find parking!

Vi9udXahDMVDkbEuyhlMqg.text: Was back again on business trip to Phoenix. Disappointed on reservation/wait time.  Ordered same entree as before ...not as good.  Disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6tHEKIDNHv9DrL1Y4LYLrQ.text: OH man, you can't go wrong here. The food is always so good, fresh and served hot. The service is delightful. My favorites are the crab enchiladas (that red sauce is bananas good, almost as good as my mom makes it) and the shrimp culichi. This place is an institution for a reason!

NaqQhuU38lNY5_w_zZUCpQ.text: I was excited to try this place based on all the positive reviews.  I thought this Mexican seafood restaurant would bring me back to my favorite seafood restaurant in Playa del Carmen.  Unfortunately, this is just bad seafood, not matter the type.  I ordered the seafood ceviche and it was not fresh at all. Several of the seafood items  were soft from spoilage (as opposed to tender) and smelled fishy.  I decided to stop after a few bites because I didn't want risk getting sick since I was about to get on a plane.  I may have been fine finishing the dish but I didn't see the need to play seafood roulette.

wx9nGvYC9jIrIxTJpREHUg.text: The decor here is very "interesting". I would say it could be classified as Hollywood Mexican meet kitsch. But who really cares about that what is important is that the food is solid. I had shrimp  fajitas and they were delicious. I also drank the Jamaica , which is hibiscus tea, and it was really tasty. I can't really say anything bad about this place and I don't think that the two colleagues visiting with me could either unless you're offended by kitschy decor. Do understand that this is not a high-end surf and turf type of fish restaurant, it is a fairly authentic Mexican seafood place

pNJPpdZagdZzspNgJ1uJNQ.text: Food wasn't the greatest. I ordered "ceviche de camaron" and I got was a bowl full of veggies and some shrimp.), which cost me $11.00. The green Chile beef burrito was overcooked shreaded meat, no flavor. I won't be going back.

9wbNBOzbQmojx2eCWaBIew.text: This is my favorite marisco place in town. The staff is friendly and always warm and welcoming. The molcajetete a la diabla  is my favorite, nice and spicy. And of course I cannot miss my Cardinals so I love that I can watch the game from almost every seat in the house!  Only one downside, the exhaust system may not be the best because you will smell like the spices and cooking aromas of what is cooked there. So have the Febreeze ready for your clothes!

FNnK5DR23Y0dUgRqZCnpWw.text: My first International Supper Club! I think we overwhelmed the kitchen - everything was just a bit off.  Granted - it's not a huge restaurant - and I think having a group of 20 something people arrive and order at once would throw any small, independent restaurant off.   Service was as friendly as could be - but it is difficult for 2 servers to handle 20 hungry and thirsty patrons. Arrival of dinners was poorly spaced - by the time the last person got her plate, the first people were done. Sides and tortillas came very late. The food itself was somewhere between decent and good. I have no complaints, but wasn't really wowed by anything I tried.  I can see the diamond in the rough quality here - and I have friends that love it - so I will be back with just a small group (4 tops) to see what a "normal" dinner is like.

VvLD3752DrNQwEMGPRW51w.text: This place is cute.  Cute!  Tables and chairs are festively colorful and it really brings out the cheer.  You won't need to order appetizers because you'll get yummy chips and salsas (red and green) and a small tortilla with ceviche.  Can't remember what fish platter we had because the menu is plentiful long, but it was a white fish served with veggies mixed in with rice.  Very delicate and pleasing.    And how, the molcajete!  Requested the waiter if we could have it served without red meat or poultry, so he brought one with seafood only.  Sizzling hot, tasty, filling.  Took home leftovers and ordered a whole fried fish to go as well.

gh_WHfaFjh1ndRunaUZQtg.text: I love their ceviche tostada! It's so fresh and flavorful. This place is as authentic as it can get. Our server was so friendly and sweet. Thumbs up to the first restaurant we chose in Phoenix while visiting from Austin, TX!

Ii3yIB-R-DUoxFZp16np3Q.text: The best restaurant in phx! We landed in airport, we were not sure where to go so we decided to choose this one and wow the waiter was so friendly especially with communication method. We use sign language. She's learning as she is serving us! Brenda, the waiter, had made our day already! The food was beyond delicious! Just like my mom's homemade Mexican food.

YW8gKOLCcjU7R1lrc4sUkg.text: The best meal (camarones veracruzanos) I've ever had at a Mexican restaurant. And I've had plenty. Also the camarones diablos were devilishly spicy. Great sauces, salsas, guacamole, and margaritas.  Highly recommend. Great service too.

oD2x3fmhASpGeI_GsXdwTg.text: I really hate having to write this because I really was hoping that I was going to have this delicious mouth watering experience after reading the reviews.     Unfortunately this was not the case, as I stepped into the restaurant the decor was something I pictured a Mariscos restaurant would look so colorful and beautiful and my server was friendly and that is were it ends.    I ordered a water of jamica w/o ice as I took a sip to my disappointment it was warm. Now I ask myself shouldn't fresh fruit water drinks be placed in ice or the refrigerator to avoid contamination? So for my meal I had the shrimp ceviche plate and as I took a bite of my tostada all I could taste is the staleness of the tostada and saltiness of the civiche and I am one who LOVES salt. The shrimp definitely was not fresh (I wonder if it may have been canned?). So I brought it to the waitress attention that the saltine crackers and tostadas were stale. She informed me that the restaurant was aware of this. Now why would a 4 1/2 star restaurant serve stale food to their customers?    Mariscos Playa Hermosa I wish I could say my food made my taste buds dance but it did not.

llwkFypFIXS-mS2cLkRRAA.text: We've visited this place several times and it's always a great experience. Very festive vibe, friendly staff, draft beer is served super cold with lots of limes..and the food is excellent. We've never had a bad dish, but some are just outstanding. The Camaron Culichi is ridiculous how good it is, as is the Camaron Cocktail and the various enchiladas. We bring our East coast family here to get a taste of what a nice cantina in Mexico would be like without leaving the city. Always a hit.

PNhfIQ3OC4K4PweXvEj7yQ.text: The ceviche is the best I've tried in phoenix. Draft Mexican beer selection is great. Fair pricing on drinks and food. Have not tried anything here that's disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 24oz drafts all day everyday.

S4phjX6R-kYfG-1IoB78Cw.text: Stopped by after being let out early from a training class (I live in Tucson), based on yelp reviews. I have to agree with most of the posters. The place is small and practically hidden away, but it's clean and the staff is attentive. I ordered the shrimp fantasia which is bacon wrapped shrimp. I am not a fan of cheese on top, only because my doctor will probably have it out with me due to bacon alone, so I simply wiped it off. I must say, it was really good. Nice sized shrimp, appropriate amounts of filling and well cooked bacon. The rice and beans were typical, but I came here for the seafood and didn't leave disappointed.

YA492Wz1KMxtKHHEBpVTmA.text: I love this place. It gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait if so since it is small but we have been there at least 5 times in the past 2 yrs and have had a great experience every time. I love love their ceviche very flavorful. Everythong we have tasted has been good.

592Xn-_Pg-T5vinJS_hQZw.text: To start off "best in town" that is definitely a big statement to back up.. "Best of Phoenix" is an even bigger one.  Typically yelpers are not from the Hispanic community.   Because of my Hispanic palette I would say that this place has very bland food.  Watered down shrimp cocktail, and al pastor tacos that were really not flavorful.  The restaurant itself is nice and cozy. Decorated very well and Mexico City looking with lots of color..  Staff is very nice.  But there are definitely better Mexican sea food places.

jUtGQ8TB05KMzHEnRHjwgA.text: I have never taken the time to write a review until now. I consider myself a strong critic of Mexican food, because I'm from California, and have eaten at many authentic "hole in the walls" This place is truly a hidden gem!  My family and I had several dishes including the whole red snapper, shrimp culuchi I and carne asada all where excellent.  This will surely be a stop of mine every time I visit Phoenix.

Ied8OL4K-youmMgSyl4Z3Q.text: Oh my goodness, this place was absolutely delish! The fish came succulent yet fried crisp on the outside... A very hard task indeed! And the poblano sauce was phenomenal over the top. The shrimp was great. It's on the lighter side if you have a smaller appetite compared to the dishes ur still generous. The seasoning is on the saltier end of the spectrum but it tasted perfect to me for this kind of cuisine. Mmmmmm! My only regret is not having a place like this in NYC.

6-uqL-0BxA-_j919GBZ95A.text: Micheladas with Dos X on tap with a dozen oysters on the side? GAME OVER! This place is the best of the best when it comes up to mariscos.

sbwKKGeFrJ99vLfvYmzfZQ.text: If you live in Phoenix and you have never been to this place, shame on you.  You have been missing out.  My husband and I were in PHX for a short vacay and after standing in the Hertz rental car line for 40 freaking minutes, I told him we are not going to Chino Bandido but the closest Mexican restaurant we can find on Yelp with the highest ratings.  Lo' and behold, it was Mariscos Playa Hermosa!  Literally 2 miles from the airport and easy to find.    We are so glad that we were able to find the best Mexican food we've ever had while in PHX, but it was hard having this as our first meal of the trip.  Every meal after this was just not cutting it.  Therefore, we planned the last day of our trip around the fact that Mariscos Playa Hermosa closed at 8pm on Sundays.   You really can't go wrong with the menu.  The first time, I ordered Fish Enchiladas and my husband ordered the Garlic Fish platter.  Both were amazing.  Their complimentary ceviche tostada was also delicious, as well as their salsas.   The 2nd time we went, I ordered the Camarones Culichi and my husband ordered another fish dish w/ vegetables.  Both were amazing again.  However, if you go here I would highly recommend the Camarones Culichi.....just because it's not something you find  at any mexican restaurant.  It was so delicious that I licked the plate of sauce clean after eating all of the shrimp, and I don't care how uncouth that might have looked because you will probably end up doing the same.  (Now, if you cannot handle spicy foods, you may want to be very cautious.  Maybe order an Horchata drink to go with the meal, or a side of sour cream to buffer the spiciness.)  Anyway, I don't want to hype it up too much or you might be disappointed.

fBf0PTrM20JgznrMuVu8bA.text: The reviews are spot on.  My husband and I went to this place for an early dinner.  Yes, the area looks a little rough but it was pretty early.  I followed the recommendation of other yelpers and ordered the shrimp culichi, very good choice.  My husband had the Torito de camaron, a yellow chili filled with shrimp, even better choice than mine.  The salsas were so good, the tomatillo one had enough spice for me.  I can handle spice, the red one was great too, however a bit too spicy for me this week.  Maybe another time I might enjoy it more.  My husband loved it.  We also had the shrimp meatball soup, very well seasoned and delicious. BTW I loved their corn tortillas and they told me they get them at the Sonorense.  They were fresh and cooked to perfection.  I dipped them in the green salsa, YUM. The margaritas are ok, but I was really here for the food.

16_SjFpkkeHHeMx9u-gXUg.text: Expected a lot with all the hype. Was good, but probably won't go back.  Parking very limited.  Margaritas all ice! Food was tasty but not anything that made us say wow. Good service and friendly staff.

qE3LHgzeXhY8p-0jkjlGRg.text: We were surprised of how clean and nicely decorated this place was after seeing the neighborhood it's in. The food is delish, tastes homemade but a little too salty, so only 4 stars. Service was great and very affordable. The menu has dinner prices so lunch was about 60% of the dinner cost.   We found this place for lunch after arriving at Phoenix airport.

2iA60cmoKog2zeYV-zmv_Q.text: Going to Mariscos Playa Hermosa is like taking a quick vacation to Rocky Point. The seafood was fresh, the service friendly and the atmosphere authentic. I went with the advice of a previous yelper and ordered the molcajete. And she was right, it truly was a volcano of food. Chicken, steak, fish and shrimp all surrounding a bubbling green sauce that's so good you want to drink it. Beans, rice, salads and fresh tortillas were served on the side, perfect for making your own little burritos. The complimentary ceviche tostadas were a nice touch and the green salsa was BUENO. The margaritas were really good too, although they were pretty small. All in all, it was well worth the drive and I can't wait to go back.   Note to late diners: they close at 8:00 :(

moh1CMVK7PLpfSw55dPZAw.text: This place is INCREDIBLE! I stumbled upon this restaurant through Yelp and it's raving reviews - well everything the hundreds have said before me is True...you MUST try this place out!

sKBKct7zK-4gBNPjNfrZkQ.text: A hole-in-the-wall on Calle 16, best known for an entirely different class of south-of-the-border fare at Barrio Cafe, Mariscos Playa Hermosa does Mexican-style seafood better than anyone in the Valley. Each meal starts with not only the customary chips and salsa, but an outstanding complimentary ceviche tostada. Favorites include Seven Seas Soup, Camarones Culichi, and of course their ceviche, which comes in several varieties. Most dishes come with beans and rice, but these are not the typical refried pintos and tomato-heavy rice typical of Mexican restaurants. Lovers of scorch-your-mouth spices should try the guacamole, which is heavy on the jalapeno. Portions are huge and service is outstanding.

s7OqjWKCcmQ8wewHzDGBPA.text: Good place. Ceviche was okay.. The last time I had ceviche was at senior frog .. This did not come upto those levels.. Passable in any case.. The whole fish dish was  good...

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nCIUGyzi2LOVd8XfVe8wSA.text: Great service, delicious food......a great  place to go with the family and friends....not a doubt they have the best molcajete in town!!!!

Qd_VHMx4g5HI8Q1NZf2odA.text: Its Decorated very cute.  Michelada was excellent,  salsa was very good.  They have a lot of seafood options.  Food was good will go back.

gA6DEZuF5BpmghthiDeAww.text: First, let me say, this is the first real authentic Mexican restaurant I've experienced since I've moved to Phoenix.  The only reason I'm giving a 4 is because I didn't love the salsas but everything else was amazing!  we ordered the shrimp ceviche to start (fresh and very tasty) and chorizo queso.   Came out still bubbling from kitchen on a cast iron grill...soooo good with their tortilla chips!  Because we ordered 2 apps, we split an entree (didn't want to leave with leftovers as we were going shopping for a few hours after).  We ordered the shrimp caramon culichi with a mix of corn and flour tortillas.  I usually don't order flour tortillas but glad I did (based on another yelper rec), soft and not too thick or doughy.  Everything was fresh and came out super fast!!  We also received a free coconut cake slice for checking in on Yelp....Their cake is probably the best white cake I've ever had!! It ended the meal perfectly and was a good size portion to split! I will definitely be back! Thanks so much for an amazing, authentic Mexican meal! Keep up the good work!!

Ee7MtQIAUDbp2ckS_Qa7QA.text: This is definitely authentic Mexican seafood. Everything was delicious! Try the "tostada de Marlin" and "ceviche de camaron" they rock! And trust me on this one, this review is coming from a Mexican

-kvL3SUGw-6DHu_Qp1jtgQ.text: A fun place to eat! We had so much fun dining her on a Friday night. Live Marachi music, friendly staff and great seafood. The Pulpo with Ranchero sauce is a killer. The seafood cocktail is a Soup of wonderful ingredients. Definitely worth a rerun!

sv4n8ViVf6xLf6Q175ZzFA.text: Back for more and this place consistently serves wonderful Baja Mexican Seafood at a great price. Love it. Bonus free cake with my Yelp Check-in offer. Sweet!

C4RQyhiI7v0_vnp7HA68HQ.text: They sang me happy birthday, so this place is definitely getting high marks.  The ceviche appetizer was really good and a great way to kick off our meal. Their beers are huge, so prepare yourself! I ordered the fried fish filet and it made me nervous that perhaps my eyes were bigger than my stomach. But I finished every bit off. Delicious!   On another day, we probably would have gotten mariachis, so we're definitely coming back for a second round, along with a much needed molcajete.

VXzYTZuzi_7ZJ0xPqeE1pQ.text: EX-CEP-TION-AL! This place was absolutely fantastic!!! Food was delicious, atmosphere was great. Service was top-notch!!  I think we ordered just about everything on the menu. They accommodated a 16 person group for my boyfriend's birthday and truly made us all feel like royalty. It's an awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 35 taco flight.
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood tower

ZJSbqpvOYAWdaJcXbwjJDw.text: This place was amazing ! The service was Amazing ! Perla was our server and she was very attentive, very polite . She was quick With our drinks and refills.  The food was perfection   ! Not one bad remark from anyone !   Highly recommend !

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gs4JS8WX-Ix2Jj0g2t-rLA.text: Short n Sweet....authentic Mexican Food!!!!!! And I have to travel to Phoenix from Houston to get it!!!!

A86YD-ZU_Xd-PA9EZlAZrA.text: Great place for Mariscos! May be the best I've had yet. You sometimes get a free ceviche tostada. I still haven't figured out what triggers this.  If anyone else knows, please fill me in.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The red sauce is actually hot...
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crevice Tostada!

GzSIVcwHevP3lF0koxqFSw.text: Unless your at nanas house, it doesn't get better than this. The food is amazing and the service was very impressive. Even on a packed weekend night you're never left with an empty glass. I would suggest making a reservation for the weekend, we waited an hour to be seated without one which we didn't mind because the food is incredible. I highly recommend the fried snapper! The atmosphere is colorful and energetic with a great Latin playlist. I can't wait to come back here for my birthday!
