R4L92ohP9yj1QJ7r11CYLw.text: Can't remember what this was called, but there's a matching picture of it on the menu. Got the 3-person version for 2 people so we could get extra meat. A little pricey, but very delicious. The 3-person came with 3 pieces of chicken, fish, and steak, and 4 shrimp.  Delicious food! Loses a star on the price for me, but I would return. Service was great and there are great Mexican drink options.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VQRHdq8jzcikiRzKdx1TsQ.text: This is my second time here at #MPH and it was a wonderful experience. The girls here are very friendly and greeted me right away. They had my food order ready, everything I requested was in the bag, and she even asked if I needed anything else. I would have loved a margarita to go but we all know that's not possible. haha.   I know I said, "I wanted to try something new" but I had to get the ceviche again. The shrimp was fresh, the veggies were just right and overall it was delightful. I'm a huge fan of this place and I recommend others to come here and pay them a visit. KUDDOS! I'll be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UjBz0Bs7tc1SUw9DW0V-tw.text: The food was delicious, the staff was courteous, and the live mariachi music was a plus

D50lPaj_PmEzWLyDzaFNbw.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I've ever eaten. And I'm from Arizona!! Great food and great mariachi music. I took my brother here for his birthday. Everyone was so satisfied!! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16 tacos! The 4 of us couldn&#39;t eat it all!!

yg26DPxPTa1ZTiv_cKJz1A.text: Wish I could give this place 1,000 stars. Hands down most authentic and delicious Mexican food we've had in Phoenix. They also gave each of us (X4) a complimentary pescado y camerones ceviche tostada, . Delicious!!  We had the oysters, ceviche, camerones fantisima, and the Mar y Tierra and Barbacoa Enchiladas.... ALL AMAZING! In addition, we tried the Mexican Mule, Stawberry Margarita and house margarita, also delicious. Service was fast, fresh and wonderful. The portions are large and filling.  This is our new favorite place, so we will be back often.

ivQbV5HcMoaFchnYptp92g.text: Fine Mexican seafood cuisine! Try the molcajete with Diabla (red sauce). It's very spicy and hot. Caution! It's is not for the faint of heart. The molcajete is served piping hot and comes with carne asada, chicken asada, shrimp, sea bass, side of white fluffy rice, beans and salad.  We go often so it's nice to be greeted by senor Hector each time we visit. The ambience is quite festive, decorated in bright traditional Mexican style and it's a pretty loud environment so you may occasionally find yourself yelling at each other while trying to have a casual conversation. The environment wouldn't be Mexican if people weren't yelling across the tables. Lol!  I have never had bad service in this place and I've never been told no when I modify my order.  If I don't want rice and beans but instead ask for the plate to be full of salad they gladly oblige. You won't be disappointed with the food and service here.  I really want to try something else off their menu but I always end up ordering the same thing.   Maybe next time I'll venture off and order another dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete In diabla sauce.  Chicken asada, carne (beef) asada, sea bass and shrimp. The sauce is fire! Not for the faint at heart.

GCKtvw7W0NhzB5rldmbLGg.text: I have been here a couple of times and the food is wonderful. My most recent visit was for a birthday get together with a party of 16 ranging in age from 1 year old to senior citizens. They had no trouble accommodating out late request and provided exceptional service. The staff was very attentive and food was wonderful as always. I would highly recommend this establishment for get-togethers.  Parking in front is limited, but there is a reserve lot just a few steps away. Overall, this is a great place to stay local and break away from chain restaurants.

TNJ_2diStTQNKwIUnl8Yqw.text: When you walk in, you immediately feel like you've been transported to an underwater coral reef paradise. The colors in this place are having their own colors. Colors on colors - a mantis shrimp's hay day. Amazing food with over the top ostentatious presentation. Would make all the gays go wild. Speaking of wild, Carla our server was wildly sweet and helpful. Good job gurl! Oh and don't touch the scolding hot clay bowls. They will leave a mark. Ouch!

xd874ogP1KEu6DW6BrGpsQ.text: I've been here too many times to call to request an order the phone for pickup it's 1 whole hour until you close, I asked when was the cut off time and she hung up on me

J0s8890dJGCzJDLe4N0GPg.text: Customer service was alright,  the food was terrible I got the molcajete and the whole thing didn't have any flavor nor salt at all .... I must say the interior design of this place is very cultural and colorful ..

BbaiiIkkbHIH8dnz-WIROg.text: Talk about YUMMM! Great micheladas just wish they didn't put ice in it! The red chile molcajete was delicious as well! Service was kind of slow but they were extremely busy. In an iffy neighborhood but don't let that deter you! This is probably the best mariscos spot you'll find in the valley

smZJsh8bypR-okc9NKxZsg.text: Such a cute sea food place. I love their outdoors area. The shrimp on the michelada are delicious!!! The seasoning on them is perfect.  I think it's called chingadaso or something like that. Definitely worth giving it a try, I'll be back to try other dishes

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vKle4g0uCdGqlvAJex5mug.text: If you're looking for an extraordinary authentic restaurant that specializes in seafood Mexican style this is your place. My wife and I went and enjoyed all the dishes that we had. It was well worth the wait. The staff was very helpful they all speak English but we speak Spanish. Would definitely make sure that you do try this place! We had live music which was another great experience to have United States. They unique...  Will be going back shortly

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VCpqlu0KRYB7pNftKEedZQ.text: Food was average at best. I had the shrimp ceviche and my wife has the fish ceviche. My wife got severe food poisoning and was sick for 4 days. We both ordered margaritas and there was a very cheap tequila used. Sorry to say, we won't be back. The service was about the only thing that was great. The mariachi was way too loud and it hurt my ears. We couldn't talk without shouting. Not a cool place.

ObzfR0e4fGKBvHKpC1AeSA.text: Over hyped and mediocre food at best, slow service on a slow night along with high prices, probably will not return. *the only high notes, the house margarita and the check.

vCNSYD7ySEKLKfDD5uxffg.text: Anytime I'm in Phoenix I try to make a trip to MPH. I've brought friends and relatives who in turn have brought other friends. No one has ever had anything but good things to say about their meals.  The food here is the real deal and made with a lot of love. Where else do you get peas, carrots and green beans in your rice (unless your Mom made it). You get plenty of chips, fresh made salsa and complimentary ceviche tostada with your entree. My sister who will not eat Sushi even enjoyed her ceviche. I've ordered it to go many times.    My favorite is the Pescado Ala Talla (pronounced Taiya). If you're on a diet, skip it. But if you love fresh, lightly fried fish with a wonderful white sauce that has mushrooms, shrimp and octopus, then this dish is for you! Portions are very generous. The octopus is tender and cooked to perfection, never rubbery. Sorry, I was hungry and forgot to take a photo. You will have to try for yourself.  I keep meaning to try the shrimp cocktail which looks like a Bloody Mary with shrimp but never have room for it. Next time...  The moon and stars would have to be out of alignment for you to have a bad experience at MPH. Wait staff is very friendly and accommodating every single visit. Often times I come alone and never treated any different than a larger party. They know how to run a restaurant!  Even tho I was stuffed I had a bite of the carrot cake. Delish!!!

bEPpBCr45vkUNiiaogRjLQ.text: There is no complaining. Parking..Just find a spot even if it's on the street. Seating..Pick a color and your table will await. Staff is friendly and happy to make you happy. The food here is joyous! If you want good seafood melded in authentic Mexican flavors, just come and explore. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A must try! Split it!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche Tostada! Delicious

HGmc2o6vRyYfmINuJJ0m5A.text: Just a fabulous unpredicted discovery! The ceviche tower is a must! Yummy substantial tacos and killer fish entrees!

S9PFpDDLFLz19gF-LpfBtg.text: Word to the wise, do not sit at the bar area. You can tell they're not used to having people sit there. It was messy and cluttered when we got up there and the servers had to clear it all out when we got up there. They didn't know how to ring up our order, since I mentioned earlier that they really don't seem to get a lot of people sitting at the bar. But overall the food had good flavor. A little skimpy on the seafood though. I ordered a Cameron y pulpo tostada and it was rather tiny.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Machaca burrito enchilada style

26a4pHJz1Ut5DrA8UUi2jg.text: The House Specialty is absolutely amazing. Don't let the spice keep you from ordering it! This spice is super favorable, with the perfect amount of hotness! It is served piping hot and along with a side of rice, beans and tortillas, which helps with the toning down of the spice.   We come here just for this dish, not that the thought hasn't crossed our minds of changing it up, we just keep coming back to the malcajete caliente! This Diablo sauce is addicting.   The service is always great, staff is friendly and love the Mexican music, really puts the authenticity to the whole experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Specialty &#34;Malcajete Caliente&#34;
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Malcajete Caliente is a must!

aMU5e4Y4bwC4h8zFznfM8g.text: Great little authentic Mexican restaurant. The waitstaff are friendly and pleasant. The food was great- we started with the shrimp cocktail (so fresh and delicious) then we shared the mocajete diablo (holy hot!) featuring fish, shrimp, chicken and beef in a sizzling red sauce with an abundance of melty, gooey cheese (the cheese pull was epic). Rice and side salad weren't great (but that's coming from someone who rarely eats Mexican rice- just not enough flavor and too many carbs). The Cadillac margarita was tasty too. And, did I say it was little? Well I meant it- the interior dining room is tiny. Just something to note if you have a large party. Looking forward to dining here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mocajete

oLzxJ8DT5YakfrlbTlyMgw.text: If you want to be around some amazing art, good music (Mexican and American) and great food this is where you want to go. The shrimp is soooooo good and so is the chicken. I've been here a couple of times and every time is a perfect experience! The staff is very educated and they come check up on you so that you aren't running low on drinks. You should try it !!! You won't regret it !

0J-p9Avr_f1vH752UwZC6Q.text: Decor is amazing in this hidden joint! My review is based only on 3 tacos and the nachos... Chicken taco, fish taco and barbacoa taco. All were very good and the nachos with green chile avocado salsa is absolutely delicious!!! Our waiter had to keep refilling our bowl - it was that good.   I will be back to try the seafood at this little gem especially the volcano (I think that was the name) which was sizzling next to us. It entailed fish, shrimp and steak - mmmmmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great ambiance!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Testing the margaritas

ja-2ytVKMqWTwnKHNqs6qQ.text: It's like Jesus himself came down from heaven and brought the freshest sea food he could find. The shrimp, crab, pulpo and the carne asada are Aaaaamazing!   My favs: Mar y Tierra, Carne Asada burrito in red enchilada sauce.   The wife favs: Crab enchilada with red sauce

PN-QGcmvq-Nxjgpyh0YNGg.text: I love this place. Great vibe and decor, the food is to die for. I approve.  The molcajete is a must with chicken and steak and shrimp in a delicious melted cheese dip.  All the while you have great drinks and mariachi.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Favorite molcajete and mariachi restaurant in all of Phoenix

wfemaO-f33n2Dv-nv1Kksg.text: Had the red mocajete. Came with strips of fish, beef, chicken as well as shrimp. It was incredibly hot which I prefer.  One of the best dishes I have ever had!

pwi57IDlgxnGoZjrRVX57g.text: 5 stars for food!  but minus 2 stars for the unnecessary note on the check.. booooo  Came here w/ my inlaws and their friends. Total 5 people.  I'm in my 30s and the other folks in their 60s retired.  I did most of the ordering and talking w/ the server and I handed the card to the server even before I got the check to show the staff that I am taking care of the bill.  However, once I got the final bill for about $160 (which was fine by me), written In big words and highlighted, they wrote:  TIP IS NOT INCLUDED - and highlighted the suggested amounts.  I find this rather offensive to write this.  I am already picking up the tab for the entire party and it was not necessary to write that on the check.  I always tip at least 20% even as high as 35%.  Nevertheless, I still tipped a little over 20%, but why they needed to highlight tip is not included is beyond me.  Maybe its because we are asian and my group consisted of seniors - but I hate to throw the race card in this review.. Oh wait.. I just did! haha!  Food is great and even the server was great  but this note on bill ruined the experience.    I just hope this does not happen to any other diner... I care about the people!

afu_e6e8IB77qA8FZxQGvw.text: Excellent food and service is very good. I always ask for Margarita. We always bring friends from California to enjoy the great food

1P-XusCE15sBimBxP1vkZA.text: We were looking for a good authentic Mexican meal before we left Phoenix and we weren't disappointed. Staff was attentive and courteous. We ordered the camerones rancheros and the baked salmon. Both of us were completely satisfied. The waitress brought out a pair of ceveche tostadas to start ant they were delicious, light and fresh. Stop by on a warm afternoon and enjoy their patio with a few friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View through the dining area.

s93DGwV76GvivuHyWpNIPg.text: Best Mexican food I have had in a while!  The service was excellent and the mariachis definitely added to the experience.

0HM09e5VGJVKa3whBVrRWQ.text: Great place , delicious food, good music and friendly staff. I had the 7 seafood soup and its great for seafood lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 7 seafood soup

BqULx502C5eaIQDGCbhMeg.text: Mariscos Playa Hermosa, or I like to call MPH, hands down the best authentic Mexican seafood restaurant in the Valley!  I have written couple of reviews on this place and every time I come here, I walk away extremely happy!  It really doesn't get better than this.  They recently remodeled their restaurant, they now have more seating, re-did the bathrooms, and they now include a full bar!  This place is awesome!  Ambiance-  Once you walk into this restaurant you are taken away by the bright colors, vibrant atmosphere and the great smelling food!  You will notice how clean the place is and how friendly the staff is.  This place is a family owned restaurant and the owners are some of the nicest people you'll ever meet.  Jose and Maria are wonderful people and will always welcome you.  Food-  This is what it's all about right?  The food is the main attraction and they have some of the most delicious food I've ever tasted.  I am a huge fan of seafood and this place has some of the best!  I have sampled many dishes here, but what has me always coming back is the fresh oysters, fried fish, ceviche, and their amazing sauces that they make.  Give this place a try if come to Phoenix, cause trust me, this is where all the locals go to eat.  Hands down, one of the best establishments I've been to!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche! Fresh and amazing!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Whole fish red snapper. My favorite

bI_GbSxm9bduRVwqFN0O4g.text: Went today for the first time. I was craving pescado frito and I was not disappointed. It was delicious, the best I've had in a while (: our waitress was so nice and attentive , the food came out quickly. I have nothing but nice things to say about this place. My family and I are always looking for a really good seafood place so I would definitely go back and recommend it to family and friends.

Mb0rPtTtGRzLjBKEk_5-7A.text: I can finally say I have had some great seafood in Phoenix, AZ. The seafood was fresh and really good. They where so excited to it was our first time there. The waitress Brenda was Awesome she was so helpful and friendly. She check on us several time to see if everything was good and if we needed anything.   I recommend this place to anyone in Arizona who lives or visiting Arizona and you want some good seafood come here.

Kpyb3xKnctuaFRefXpf4Gw.text: Went here today based on great reviews. Ordered the fish tacos - the fish meat had a lot of grey pieces which I tried to pull out of each taco. I began feeling sick within an hour after leaving. I will not be visiting this restaurant again any time soon.

2pLsm1gZTHC9zWpvMsfrOg.text: Three trips has not disappointed yet.  the interior atmosphere is spot on to a number of places I have been to in Central America.  The decor, the service, the atmosphere.  I have had very attentive waitresses each time.    The chips and salsas are very nice(ok one humid weekend I thought the chips were a bit stale).  One dip is a darker red salsa (smoked chillis?)  the second one is my favorite it is green cilantro and avocado dip.  It is so good I have purchased some to take home for later (ask the waitress - even comes iwth chips).  The first two times I ordered a whole fried fish ajillo, covered in sauteed garlic, peppers and onions.  It was very authentic just as I had eaten many times down south.  The rice and beans are as expected, not fantastic not dry and tasteless like other places.  Note - I did not come for rice and beans ;-).  Once my wife ordered the Camarones Culichi Shrimps In A Green Sauce, Tomatill & Cilantro, which was excellent.  The waitress recommended it and she was right.  The sauce seems to have some cheese mixed/melted in that made it sinfully savory.  Another time I ordered tacos al pastor.  OK, I know it is a seafood shop but after the nice ceviche I was ready for some flesh.  The tacos were very good. I liked how their al pastor was crispier than some.  Maybe a personal preference, but they were good.  Key note for me - they offer a variety of margaritas.  I prefer the upcharged one where they mix it themselve, not the premix bottled one. (they sell both)  for me it is less sweet and has a cleaner appeal.    I am planning on going back again next week when more family come to visit.  Last note:  The neighborhood is not the greatest.  I come from a tougher city so it was no big deal to me, but some others might appreciate being warned.

bZbg0EtZkLB5QaOGS6VUwQ.text: Great small and authentic place!  Yeah, as others have said, maybe not the "best" neighborhood, but we had no issues.  The place is small, so plan to wait if you come in the busy time.  QUALITY food for sure and mainly seafood based but thankfully for me they have non-seafood items for folks like me who don't care for seafood. Everyone at the table loved what we got and would certainly come back again!

LBVeibWOKoYrcfQXjgQTNg.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place!!  I've been here so many times, you know I love my mariscos.  Playa Hermosa has never disappointed me.  There quality is very consistent and I would be soooo sad if they ever stop their business.  Let me give them 10 stars out of 5.  They are that good!  Please don't be discouraged because of the area it's in.  I know some people would never come to this part of town...they are missing out!    I love walking into the restaurant to their colorful decors.  Once you are seated, you will get a generous portion of freshly made warm tortilla chips with a red and a green salsa, no questions asked.  They don't care if you're going to order later on...here, have some chips and salsa!  They have a full bar and a TV with sports playing all the time.  Now you can have some drinks with free chips and salsa while watching a game.  Once you order, they will bring you a tostada with ceviche.  It's on the house.  Their ceviche is fresh and flavorful without being overpowered by excessive lime.  As for entrees, I would recommend.... - shrimp culichi - fish tacos - grilled shrimp - fried fish in garlic sauce - molcajete - any types of ceviche  Most dishes come with a side of beans, rice, salad, and flour/corn tortillas.  Be prepared to walk out with a full belly plus some to take home.

3GOlyCXZDY7T3C6ac1i07A.text: So we pull up and the first thing we see are 2 Phoenix police cars -- SCORE!  You know cops always know where to find good food!  LOL.    This place is fantastic!  After only one visit, I'm rating it a conservative 4-stars, but I can easily see upgrading to 5-stars after a few more visits.  The food is the star here.  We ordered the ceviche with fish and shrimp to start, and it was well-balanced and fresh!  One ingredient didn't overpower the others.  It's served with adorable tostada rounds versus chips, but you can always use your chips they automatically deliver to each table also.  Neither my BF nor I were super hungry, so we both ordered tacos -- I ordered the shrimp tacos and he ordered the fish tacos, and then of course we shared because, well, that's what we do.  I'm always hesitant to have my tacos served with cheese already served on them, but I'm so glad I didn't order cheese on the side!  My tacos were in toasted flour tortillas (they normally come with corn tortillas, but I asked for flour) and had the perfect amount of melted cheese holding the sides together.  Just thinking about them makes my mouth water.  The pinto beans served with the tacos are also really flavorful.  (They're also served with some greens, but I didn't eat them -- who has time for salad?)  With a Yelp check-in, you get a free slice of cake, so we ordered the coconut cake. OH-EM-GEEEE!  This is literally the best coconut cake I have ever had in my life!  The flavor of the coconut really shines through and is not diluted by sugar or cake.  Neither of us could believe how good it was.  Even as we were getting up to leave, my BF was scraping the plate clean of the rest of the cake. LOL, greedy self!  The only possible area for improvement are the margaritas.  I initially ordered just a house margarita and my BF ordered the mango margarita.  Although the flavor was good in both drinks, the tequila was lacking.  I'm not trying to get lit off of one margarita, but I should feel a little something. LOL.  But we both ordered the Cadillac margarita as a second drink and that one was WAY better!  Next time I'll just start with that one.   All in all, a pretty great experience, and I look forward to going back to try more items (and get some more coconut cake)!

kbeTb7HHPIM_xmv5e3KFRg.text: I'm not sure why this has such great reviews...our food was terrible!! :/ I felt sick the rest of the evening...the ceviche looked like it had fish particles in it. It tasted really bad. :/

9XXQmHU0a3_i3-xeVKO1Dg.text: This is the most fantastically delicious Mexican food I have ever had. We started out with a fish ceviche followed by a shrimp ceviche. My daughter had a sea bass grilled and my son ordered a chille relleno. My wife ordered a carne asada fajita. Then we ordered a Molcajete Caliente for 2. This comes in a stone bowl with green sauce and cheese. It has shrimps, fish, carne asada and chicken. All hung on the hot stone bowl like a shrimp coctail!! Needless to say we all were eating each others food!! It hits your taste buds from every direction!! Yum!! We thought we would finish the meal with a flaan. How wrong we were! We just had to order another one. It was so delicious. The quantity is right up there with the quality. We had to pack up the left overs to go. There is no way I was going to let one ounce of this feast go waste. The service was exceptional. Our hostess/server was there like a genie. Water glasses were filled before they got empty, hot tortias appeared by magic, lime when requested materialised. Even when we awkwardly spilled a glass of water, it was soaked dry with a smile. I wish I could have this meal more often. I know that every time I come to Phoenix, they will have to deal with me!!  :-) :-).

0QbdSrQz8PCKbJ6lSH9uZg.text: I got the Camaron culichi it was really good, but has to wait on my tortillas, husband got the shrimp/ pulpo cocktail with no onion but came with extra it seemed like, serve was extremely bad never came to our table to see how we were doing if we needed any crackers for the shrimp cocktail, I asked for a soda with a cup of ice got the soda no cup of ice had to wait 10 minutes for my ice had to ask another waitress, asked for one taco of carne Asada no onion Took another 10 minutes, asked for the bill and that came out in one minute not sure if I would be going back the service sucked.

Bs1wmqUp2fZSMIniN4yLFA.text: Excellent decor, very small with a great "Mom n Pop" feel, beautifully painted and warm, and the food trumps all those compliments.  AMAZING SEAFOOD!!!!! Try everything, I loved the oysters and the Crab Enchilada. I grew up in Maryland and I am a picky crab lover there is, this seafood gets 5 stars easily.  UPDATE JAN 2018: The quality has deteriorated and this place is not what it used to be. The food was not good on my last visit, the entrees were COVERED in cheese(never used to be) and the taste was nothing like it was a year ago. Nothing left to say, will not be returning here. Sad.

6bd_668tCjW-dm_g9UdhBg.text: This place is pretty good. The decor was great! The service was very good.  The food was good, but not exceptional. We expected the prices to be much lower than they were.  Overall, it is good and we would eat there again, but we wouldn't go out of our way.

vOPLGLu87KagBbCLUoRFKw.text: Food is AMAZING! We've come here for date night 3 times and it never disappoints.  Love the mariachi band and the service is excellent.

ceAj3cP2znH7gCJ0X5dyvA.text: The real deal. My new favorite Mexican place. I had some pablano fish dish, it was excellent. Place was packed but service was fast, not expensive.

JvTsV_z_yr1s8MmbGITPBA.text: Im only giving 1 star because I can't give 0 stars. We come here often and have never been treated the way we were treated tonight. We got there at 8:30pm, waited for 20 minutes, we were never acknowledged, then at 8:50pm the gentleman with the glasses walks over to give another waiting customer their to go order and on his way back to the kitchen stops and tells us that he doesn't think there's room for us and they close at 9...basically telling us to leave. We are extremely disappointed because we really enjoyed this place. Please coach your staff on the proper way to treat paying customers.

x26g3a4Jth0_J4XPmlXWhw.text: I had the cocktail with everything. It's been 6 hours since I last ate and I am still full!! Portions are awesome and the service was great! I will be coming back very soon this place is legit!

I-biSE7LcmsztVeRGlbwNA.text: The food isn't anything special. It's not bad food either  It could be way better food for the  prices your paying. I really do like the decor very colorful and so many stuff to look at on the walls. The Mariachi guys are Loud!!! And funny definitely make you smile. Come here for a good time don't expect much from the food.

bvh0NRXa7XBSd1_vw-4pBQ.text: Okay, so first I have to mention the decor is so nice it took me back to Mexico!  It goes downhill from here. We waited an hour for our meal of fish tacos and shrimp cocktail. In their defense, they did have a large group in the back. However, when we finally received our food, my hubby's tacos were steaming hot and his beans and rice were barely warm. Also, my shrimp was a tiny bit fishy tasting which was very surprising for a place that specializes in seafood!  Overall, not bad but a disappointment.

-lhT4rrn_42gln9cidGuvw.text: awesome ceviche that was fresh and full of good veggies and fish, she had tacos that were also good , great mariachi played requests all night payed by the restaurant and only accepted tips, reasonably priced all around,

WGTxeXa-eI0WDIiwoLONcQ.text: So my husband and I were looking for someplace to celebrate our anniversary. We both love seafood and found this place. It reminded us of the first time we went to Mexico together so many years ago. The chips and salsa, especially the green salsa (in my opinion) were very good. We shared the molcajete and it was so very delicious. The green salsa in the middle is extremely tasty. I have no idea what is in it, but I would eat it again. The hubby had the $5 mug of Tecate and I had a Corona margarita. We definitely plan to come back!! The service was attentive and helpful, since it was our first visit I asked a lot of questions and our waitress was patient! Can't wait to go back!

5w4r9uGDKhemg--Hbwz0sA.text: This place is awesome!  Clean and colorful, with excellent service, and the place was full on a Labor Day afternoon.   We had the shrimp with the green sauce and fish tacos.  Super tasty.  Ice cold Negro Modela on tap, 24 oz for $5 is unbeatable!   Wish the bar area was bigger but overall this place rocks.

E7Dp3Zs4XbFNMG9vQhcqrw.text: This was my second time in today and both visits have been excellent. I had the camarones culichi, and it was the most delicious thing in the entire world! Service was excellent as well. We will be back soon.

mWD5cYH-N7zJYh3rVimWpw.text: I love this place. My dad and I went here about 5 months ago and I have been here almost a dozen times since. I love the fish tacos. The place seems clean and the help is really friendly. They also have this green salsa that they bring out with the chips right at first that is really good! The surrounding area is rough but this is good!

L34EjdmNA0eWgfuLGZP4-g.text: simply amazing!! best mexican food i have had in az ever!!!  yummy!

c33vV4X3lwRgAG0c8Zmxkg.text: Sometimes you have to explore and try those hole in the places. Sometimes you get junk and other times, if your lucky. You get a place like this. I was astounded yes I said it ASTOUNDED. By how authentic and delicious this place is. If you haven't come here you haven't had real Mexican seafood. Trust me you have to come here. Chase out

tPzSZl0XtUkhoIqlv8_ZIw.text: Excellent food and service. Most of the menu specializes in seafood and it's great. I highly recommend this restaurant!! I frequent this place every time I'm in Phoenix at least once. Last visit I made it back a second time in one week. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Don't let the location turn you off. Just go in and enjoy. Oh yeah - 22 oz. beers on tap.

AWMSdIvNlChvTcDwYf_01g.text: I've been coming here for YEARS and just thought to review it?  WTF is wrong with me??????????????????????? THIS is Mexican seafood.  I've been to other places and nothing compares!  I take a book, sit in back and people watch while creaming my "Make Me Yelp" panties as I eat my culichi.  It's D I V I N E!  Eat the shrimp with a fork but you sure as Hell better use a spoon to destroy the rest of the bowl and leave it clean! Everything is fresh and the wait staff is loaded with recommendations.  Ask, and ye shall find.  The snapper Veracruz is so good I often order 2 and take one home.   The decor is fun - aquatic scenes that won't make you feel guilty for eating the seafood in front of you.   At Xmas they had a Santa at the door!  The people here a super-friendly!   They have their own parking lot.  You know it's a good place when yours isn't the fanciest car in the parking lot.  All kinds come here, despite the neighborhood not being the nicest in DoPho.  You can't miss it - even though I do pass it every time!  I think I'm too excited thinking of the shrimp culichi and my mouth is watering so much that I always manage to say "Crap, passed it again!" Go.  Just go to this place.  You won't be disappointed.  I swear.  And, you won't break the bank.

gg9Pvhb2ZWuwqVRbSHa0aA.text: At 1 PM, we were handed large menus with several dozen interesting choices. Only one seafood entree (fish tacos) on the entire 4 pg card was less than $12, and that included soups. I didnt really want to settle for fish tacos in a lauded casa de mariscos.    Entrees come with complementary ceviche tostadas, which was a nice surprise.  My son had the house specialty,  camerones culuchi, and I tried a flash-fried whitefish, served whole with sides, for 15 bucks.  We agreed the green culuchi sauce bathing six shrimp was instantly forgettable. My fish had about 150 pin bones and less meat than a small can of tuna fish. That's not an attempt at humor. I can debone a fish and there was less meat on this crispy carcass than a standard 6 oz can of tuna, as if they extracted most of it for their own devices, leaving me with little more than skin, bones and an eyeball.    It's hardly a crummy place on the inside - the decor is cute and colorful.  Service seemed friendly, if a bit confused, and having grown up in New England,  I'm aware seafood can be pricey.  That said, after tax and tip, we spent $40 for one meh and one pretty craptastic lunch, in a hole in the wall just south of Roosevelt.   Judging from the other reviews, it sounds like we just came at a bad time, but that doesnt help me get my forty dollars back. Two stars for the ceviche.

3GI043B9S276KgaxvTugfw.text: This is the best Mexican seafood restaurant I've been to.  Yum, yum, yum.  I loved the chips and green salsa.  The draft beer comes in a huge margarita-like glass, enough for two people to share if you don't want too much to drink.    The Camarones Culichi was heavenly.  The service is friendly and prompt.  The atmosphere is warm and cozy, yet also festive.  The prices are extremely reasonable, especially given the quality of the food and the complimentary ceviche before the main entree.  Absolutely everything was delicious.  This place should be packed on a Saturday night, although it's okay with me if just a few people know about this culinary gem.  I want to try their tequila have my next birthday celebration here--drinks, awesome food, friendly staff--sounds like the perfect place for a party.

MR5MJC3pEwc-4X1155zyJw.text: Great flavor and service. Excellent fish dishes. Clean and friendly.

SB0nQ3Ucl-bjtll_ETdPPg.text: The best burrito I have had in a long time and the service was great.  They gave us a complimentary ceviche tostada and it was yummy.

djBURIsm_qoZtGTDBLpB0w.text: My husband and I visited MPH last night after reading some great reviews on Yelp. This place did not disappoint.  The decor inside MPH is colorful and welcoming. Nothing to special, but nice. We were sat immediately and our drink orders taken. The reviews of the chips and salsa have not been exaggerated. The chips are thicker, almost softer and deliciously warm and salty. The red salsa has a nice rich, spicy flavor, but the green salsa, oh, the green salsa. The green salsa is avocado and cilantro based. It has a wonderful fresh, almost tangy flavor that is complimented well by the creaminess the avocado brings to the dish. When our drinks arrived my husband was delighted by the icy mexican coca-cola, as was I. Our waiter also brought out a fish ceviche tostada. Though it was a surprising treat the ceviche was not a flavorful as we had hoped.   While we enjoyed the chips and salsa we could hear and smell our entree being freshly prepared. With out waiter suggestion we ordered the Molcajete. Which is essentially a sampler of grilled sea bass, shrimp, chicken, beef and octopus all swimming and sizzling in a tasty tomatillo based sauce. All the meats were fresh, tender and very flavorful. The rich green sauce was delightful. The bubbling cauldron of flavor was accompanied by flour tortillas that were tasty, but most importantly had a great texture for sopping up all the sauce, yum. Also included were some decent creamy pinto beans and fluffly white rice with what seemed to be veg-all mixed in. Mu husband loved the rice, I was less impressed and opted to fill up on everything else.  I can not leave this review with out mentioning the amazing guacamole. Freshly made, and the perfect amount of chunkiness. Some of the best gauc I have had recently.   Our bill was an even 40 after tax and tip and we left with some delicious left overs.   Overall this place is great, delicious, fresh, and affordable with very friendly service.

qPQkBPIOU4jD9xd_xHvQcA.text: The bright decor soon gives way to best mariscos I have had in Phoenix; you have a loyal customer.

O7U2E8S3QlZATAPzp63kMg.text: If I lived near this restaurant I would be there all the time. They make the most refined yet homey sauces (especially the camarones culichi, or shrimp in green poblano sauce is addictive), serve freshly fried puffy tortilla chips, delicious ceviche tostadas on the house, and perfect shrimp tacos. The atmosphere is warm, festive and neighborly, no pretensions and the prices reflect this. There is a full bar, huge draft beers with lots of lime, and very hospitable service. I haven't enjoyed such a wide array of flavors, amazing Mexican style seafood outside of Mexico, even in San Diego which comes close.

CI6GjY4f_1i_TIH_jFZQPQ.text: Great fresh sea food!  Best I have had in Phoenix, clean and great service.  Do not let the neigbor hood scare you away, this place is great.  Crab enchalads are the best.  Ceveche is as good as I have found.  I will be back soon.

Q6ZANPoa9ZYZLNc4-r_OVw.text: This is the kind of place I want to go back again and again. There are so many amazing things on the menu. Fish of all kinds, prepared in all sorts of traditions. Shrimps, etc.. And Modello Negro on TAP. yeah man. And the people were really friendly - clearly a family run place. LOVE IT.

791umjkMexWM4WsIqn0ilQ.text: I love this place! Great food and great service. The green salsa is terrific with fresh chips. I usually get one of three things: filete a la plancha (grilled fish), tacos al gobernador (shrimp tacos) or the fish ceviche. The shrimp cocktail and shrimp culiche (baked in green sauce with cheese) are also amazing. I've been coming to this place for years, and the quality is always outstanding.  I'm just a bit surprised that it isn't more crowded--with food this good, you'd think people would be flocking here!

X8wcBgdUPDbSr7E294J-TQ.text: I'm not a fan of Mexican food, but this place changed my mind!!!  The food was UNBELIEVABLE, the service was fantastic, and the staff was very friendly...  DEFINITELY try this place if you are in Phoenix!!!

ksOvCDVx3tYBpXdF5xVHVA.text: We went to this quaint little place for the first time and were very pleased.  We started with two different types of cerviche, shrimp and fish, both with a nice mix of veggies and spices.  We then asked for a split bowl of the seven seas soup, which they willingly split. The two split bowls were almost as much soup as one regular bowl.  As advertised, there were seven types of seafood combined with a few vegetables and was delicious.  After almost having a full meal already we opted  for a the fish with poblano.  We also requested double salad  instead of beans and rice, and again were accommodated.  The base was very lightly breaded and topped with a mixture of poblano pepper, tomato, and onion, which blend nicely with the fish.  The server was very pleasant, helpful, and checked with us at the right times.  When the bill was presented we were amazed by the low total.     The atmosphere, service and food were all top notch.  We will definitely be returning.

1WkjOwBr5yBVBmOXMMjCxg.text: I've been here a few times and they never disappoint.  The seafood is incredible, service is good and the decor is - colorful!

JYAlanx1aEeqenEuZ_KsdQ.text: This place is the best Mexican seafood I've found in Phoenix! Delicious chips with two kinds of salsas, plus they bring complimentary shrimp ceviche tostadas that are superb! The Camarones Culichi, one of their specialty dishes, is OUTRAGEOUSLY good! You'll finish all the shrimp and then want to sop up the rest of the sauce with their fresh homemade tortillas! My only complaint is that the beans served with the dish were cold. If you go for lunch and aren't a huge eater, be sure to ask for the lunch portions, which are half the price listed on the menu! The atmosphere is wonderfully festive, much nicer than you'd expect from the outside, and the service is prompt and friendly. There's good reason for the numerous plaques and articles of praise adorning the walls (including a 5 star review from Seftel back in '04)!

PCnPUPH07jYERBvKnXTo3A.text: Three of us dined here Saturday. Their parking lot is small, the neighbor is not upscale, but it seemed ok. We all agreed the ceviche is great. The whole grilled fish was very good as was the breaded fish fillet. The crab enchiladas were horrible. The sauce tasted burnt and the crab meat had a very fishy taste. The side dishes were all the same: rice and beans and small salad. The rice and beans were tasteless and bland. The salad was iceberg lettuce and not much more. We may come back for the ceviche and to try some of their other entrees. The cost of most of the entrees is around $13-$14. The best part of the evening was the large supermarket we discovered , just before I -10, it has a large food court, ceviche bar, Mexican bakery and all sorts of specialty items used in Mexican, Carribean, and Latino cooking. The staff is friendly, the place is well organized, clean,and it was a  fun place to browse and shop.

-fsBXDmVsBBlXn1mxT6jwA.text: Food was good,Oysters were small and a little understaffed when we went this past January (2014). The restaurant is not in the best part of town but has a lovely ambiance, I would definitely go back and try some of their other dishes!

q74cioZM2Mm9jHx6Nd_UMQ.text: Great service and very friendly staff. The food was good, especially the Shrimp Albondigas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Albondigas de Camaron

NWqNOWXlfEebSIaUlPz1jw.text: Excellent.  I was very impressed with the selection and food quality.  In fact, I will go back just for the authentic and fresh salsa.  If you are looking for Mexican food with quality seafood, this is the place.  They have an informal dinning area; although the place doesn't look like much from the outside, the inside is pretty decent.  The staff was friendly.  They also have a full service bar.  I'll be back.

5XoC6Lj3TQ1rvd13ARq7RA.text: The outside of this restaurant does not look like much, but the inside of the restaurant feels very festive and exciting. Our waiter was quiet nice. Right after you are seated, you get a bowl of chips with 2 dips: a red spicy one and a green, sort of mild one (it is not guacamole, by the way). Then, after you order, you are served a complementary fish cerviche, which is quiet tasty. We ordered the fried Tilapia,  the shrimp in green sauce, and the shrimp with peppers. All came with beans, rice, and a salad on the side. The fried Tilapia was quite large, it could feed at least 2 people. The outside was very crisp and the inside tender and steamy. The shrimp in green sauce was like a soup, and it was very good, creamy and the shrimp was tender, The shrimp with peppers were excellent also and were served with tortillas (wheat tortillas or corn tortillas, your choice.)

RouIMpzsCcwgOugDImfp_w.text: I thought that the Ceviche was amazing, so fresh and delightful!  I also loved the beans!  Excellent quality and so so fresh!

wU0DyglcvnlpqiHzC_1KNg.text: First time tonight...and was extremely pleased. Excellent service, fun decor and outstanding food. I had the mix grilled fish/chicken/meat that had a wonderful creamy tomatillo sauce in the middle filled with octopus..this was like a mexican pupu platter!! Enough for 2, have leftovers. I love the complimentary cerviche taco they bring after ordering our margaritas...definitely a will go again soon...

DaQKDzQDfxffNNlT1B0-CA.text: I found this place using Yelp. They have well-made margaritas. The chips come with red and green salsas. The service is really friendly and the food is delicious. I would go back. I recommend the ceviche tostadas. I had the crab enchiladas that were good. The best entree I tried was a fried fish entree.

CJhkiAPkreEc036I1XFKuA.text: I really like this place. Nice setting. Good service. Especially like the fish tacos, and Crab Tostada.

Gz8WDaRxokiA5ez4akEdVw.text: Great location, sea food is fresh, I enjoy the end of the week.  Garlic Shrimp dish blew me away.  One of those places when you finally eat there you were thinking why it took so long.  Real Food is here, Look for their three locations in the Valley

ldzylXwSo6uvvXgQDidc9A.text: 2nd visit.  1st visit had seafood soup.  A bit heavy on cilantro for me, not a cilantro fan.  2nd visit had fish and shrimp with poblano sauce.   Would have been 5 stars but the only 4 shrimp came with it and they looked a bit lost on the large plate. Draft beer at $3 is a real bargain.  Service was helpful and quick.  HOW do they get the food out so quickly?  Place was nearly empty both nights. If this place was in a suburban strip mall, the line would be out the door.  Do yourself a favor and go.  I certainly plan on returning often.

Pujbmx5LfchbZZtFVk7Tvg.text: We really enjoy the seafood here.  Our favorites are fried fish with diabla sauce (really hot!) and fried fish with culichi sauce.  The ceviche tostada is great too!  Our sons like the fajitas.  I have recommended it to my sister and family when they travel to phoenix.  We have been coming here for years.

ssG-BtdA7e7Cm7g_wiWM7Q.text: While passing through Phoenix we had a wide-selection of restaurant options to choose from. So glad we picked Playa Hermosa! All I can say is: WOW!! Our food was delicious and SO incredibly fresh!! A surprise from a non-coastal region. I ordered the Seven Seas Soup and in addition to it being chocked-full of seafood, the broth was flavored to perfection! The ambiance was festive and nicely decorated, very clean, and the staff, friendly, attentive and professional. Great place - don't miss it if you are looking for an unusually nice, casual and very reasonably priced dining experience!

qeTdcAP1kBEgK7-A8sYj9Q.text: Wow, from the street it looks a little rough. But I noticed that the parking lot had been freshly hosed down and was spotless. As soon as we entered I knew we were in for a treat. A wonderful friendly atmosphere and all of the chairs and tables were hand painted in Mexican folk art. The place was immaculate.  We had called for a reservation for 12 people and our table was ready for us and we were immediately offered chips, 2 types of salsa and waters.  There were so many wonderful things to try on the menu that we all ordered something different. After we ordered we were given some of the best cevichi I have ever as an appetizer (no charge)!  Even though the kitchen had to prepare 12 different plates, they all came out together.  EVERYTHING was very carefully made and delicious. By far some of the finest Mexican food in the valley. We travel in Mexico often and have had many wonderful meals there. Imagine going to 16th street and Roosevelt for something even better.  The service was VERY friendly and timely. It felt like we were eating at my Grandmother's house!  Hands down, my new favorite Mexican Restaurant

WjkQ8L06TNtxHMkReL_U2g.text: I selected this place based on all the great Yelp reviews, and all I can say is that I was very disappointed.  I'm fine with it being kind of a dive...my issue was with the food.  We both got ceviche apps, which were pretty good.  I had a fish filet & my BF had the dish with chicken, shrimp and beef (forget what it's called).  I found the food to be pretty salty, which I can't stand.  My fish was swimming in some kind of liquid, which totally turned me off & the salad it came with was drowned in some kind of yellow Italian dressing (Wish Bone out of the bottle?  not sure).  My BF's dish was ok at best...the beef was chewy & the shrimp & chicken were salty.  I hate to be so harsh, but I gotta call 'em as I see 'em.  Would def. not return.

Tqy8scMSuSDmFdlHr2ZDUQ.text: Best Mexican restaurant I've ever eaten at! Next time in Phoenix will be back! Friendly service and good prices!

YNrnntxQT_YYPYygQqWOFA.text: We love this restaurant!  The food is simply too wonderful to describe.  Our goal is to sample every item on the menu.  They all sound wonderful.  If you love seafood prepared with style and imagination, you should check out this place.

VPvYipKoHxXsJoPJpOHbkA.text: This would be three and a half but you can not do that.  A rough looking sort of neighborhood but a nice and welcoming environment once you get inside.  Great menu you with items you do not see in most mexican restaurants.  Not cheap but a good quality and quantity.  Would recommend it.

SL9TPIBDEqE0k_mQEtPoig.text: great customer service. We reached just before closing ( 8pm on a weekday) and we were the only customers there but still got great service. The la diabla fish fillet in a red sauce and Camarones culichi were both very good. The sauce with the fish filet was yummmm. The tortillas were made fresh and just melted in the mouth. I would def. come here when I am in the area!!

th_AYNjoDZ9Wz90ibzhIHg.text: Our visit to Mariscos made us feel like we were on vacation in Mexico. The salsas (rojas and verde) and chips that we were greeted with were tasty, as was the ceviche. We started with the Mexican Shrimp Cocktail (we each had one), very nice with lots of shrimp and avocado. I had the green cheese enchiladas - LOTS of cheese and sour cream - yum! My husband had the octopus rancheros - he proclaimed it delicious. Both were served with rice, lettuce salad, and beans. The beans were much better than the usual.  We were too full for dessert, should have shared the shrimp cocktail.  House red wine was good and prices were reasonable. It's a long drive for us since we are near Pinnacle Peak, but we will be back.

ee3q8QXOuU9PoMfzbv-48Q.text: Magnifico!  Great little place tucked away in a semi-residential area of town.  Felt like I was part of the family after being seated.  Bright cheerful atmosphere like a fiesta!  Food was very flavoful even the white rice.  Crab enchiladas full of white crab meat and smothered in your choice of red or green sauce.  Salsa you get red (Spicy) and green (mild) with chips and I got a complimentary Cerviche.  The red salsa had a nice smoky flavor and just the right kick of heat.  Can't wait to try other dishes when I return to Phoenix in a couple of weeks!

Vd1gd0w1QoIrIgdOiZ6Hrw.text: This is a great Mexican restaurant. Big portion sizes, very tasty dishes! Awesome margaritas! Our waitress Brenda was super helpful. A+

x-Q7TybXxO9VywUjpTI7TA.text: Thank you Yelpers for such honest reviews.  We came here today hoping reviews were True and we are very pleased.  The food here is Delicious!!!! Service was great, very family friendly environment, clean with a nice patio dining area.  Very authentic favors...we will definitely be back with the rest of the family.  Thanks for the free ceviche tostada and check-in slice of chocolate cake...you made a fan of my picky eating 6yr old son.

DeuGNt9DtIr6B9HpVfW-eQ.text: First time here. Overall was not disappointed. I thought the service was great. The wait staff was excellent. I had their fish ceviche with an horchata. The fish ceviche was not the greatest I've ever had but it was really good. I'm always skeptical about eating ceviche at a restaurant but this place didn't disappoint. And it was on special so it was about 8 bucks. The horchata was pretty good. I checked in on Yelp and got a free piece of cake. I'm glad I tried this place out. I'll definitely come again.

vgyj4t8i651KtXL5TrtT8g.text: Saw the Mariscos Playa Hermosa menu photo layout in the Phoenix Mexican Food Guide (Mexican Seafood) section and we had to try it. It's almost 30 miles one way and I would do the drive a couple times a week for the food, service and friendliness We were taken care of from the time we entered right up to leaving. The "on the house" appetizers are are excellent. I like the red and my wife liked the green so much she had it put in our take home. We shared the Molcajete Catiente Mix and had enough take home for a late dinner. My beans and rice were the first empty plate and I know I had two loaded plates from the bubbling Mix bowl. The Mix sauce was so good I put it on my rice and could have made a meal from just that and the beans. I had a little trouble getting Yelp to come up,on my cell, but they had already taken our order for the complimentary "Yelp cake". If you haven't tried a Tres Leche Cake you will want to make sure and order a slice here. My wife's chocolate cake was top notch too. If you haven't read the Phoenix Mexican Food Guide (Mexican Seafood) article you want know how to get the cake. Here's a link to the restaurant: mariscosplayahermosa.com... and a link to the Phoenix Food Guide magazine: phoenixmag.com

qj9xDaxBqB4gfQBebIPQQQ.text: The moment I entered this place it's like I'm in a giant playroom. The place is very bright and colorful. I wouldn't be surprised if Dora or the whole Sesame Street Gang suddenly showed up.  We ordered the Molcajete and fish ceviche. The Molcajete ($22) is the bomb! It's this delicious dish that has beef, chicken, shrimp, and fish lined up around on what seems like the Wicked Witch's cauldron filled with tomatillo sauce. It's enough for two people. You'd know its one of their popular dishes because all the other tables have it. One group of people even ordered three! It's like we were part of a Mexican witch convention. It was pretty amusing.  My husband got the $4 draft beer which he later regretted because there's this promo girl who gave out some freebies including a bottle of Budweiser beer for each of us. I'm not sure if they do that all the time. I guess we're just lucky. We went on a Friday night so we got a live background music from their Mariachi band.  Overall, we loved it! Can't go wrong with Mexican seafood. We'll definitely be back.  Trivia: Apparently, the Molcajete is the traditional Mexican version of mortar and pestle. Thanks Wikipedia!

JCiEZs1PJAtNvYOqUjbQ0A.text: We started with shrimp cocktails, Modelo negro draft and Michelada. Cocktail was perfect and they provided plenty of limes, hot sauce, ketchup and crackers. Lastly we shared their Molcajete with a very savory tomatillo sauce surrounded with grilled fish, shrimp, chicken and beef. Lets not forget the sides of white rice, beans and salad. We will be back. The price was not bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete nuf said :)
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Michelada

uiLVcVk7s_G8MyTkZ2gQOw.text: hmmm I must say I was a little disappointed after driving 45 minutes to eat here. I saw it reviewed on a popular local TV Show and it looked awesome so decided to give it a try.  First the parking lot was really small/tight so that made it a challenge. The place was very much smaller inside than it looked on TV as well. Your table chair up against another tables chair small. You couldn't easily get in and out without hitting other diners.  As far as service they were nice enough but after taking our order we didn't see our server very often. Had to ask for menus and after we received our food we had to ask for silverware. It was said on the show everyone get a small sample of the ceviche. We did not. We did get chips and salsa as well as a tomatillo green sauce. While not bad the chips and sales was not that good either. They did not give small plates or anything so the chip went into the sauce then straight to your mouth. Kind of sloppy.  For an app we had seafood cocktail. It was large and pretty good with lots of different kind of shrimp, octopus, fish etc. They didn't scrimp on the seafood but at $18.00 each I would hope not! It was served with saltines which I also thought is kind of weird for a Mexican restaurant.  For entrees we had a spicy shrimp dish and crab enchiladas. The spicy shrimp was good. Smothered in a red sauce it was a little hard to eat since they left the tail shell on and it was hard to remove and eat because it was smothered in the sauce. Not sure how you were expected to pull it off?  The crab enchiladas were not good to me at all and had a weird smell. I only ate two bites and was done. Overall damage approached $70 for two people and I left hungry. I love Mexican food i guess just not Mexican seafood.

oTXHZpD9OS-p5-9JDy1xUA.text: This is a great little place.  Excellent Mexican seafood and superb service.  Highly recommended.

bcqInu_3jHeDyMp2doODtw.text: I found this place on yelp, I was craving some mariscos close to the hospital where I was visiting. I really wanted to love this place because unlike other Mexican mom and pops restaurants they had excellent service. We were greeted and seated quickly, the waitress quickly took our drink order and brought them right out. After she took the food order we were given complimentary tostadas de ceviche. As for the food the chips and salsa were on point. But the beans and rice were terrible. The camarones culiche were not spicey at all and just lacked flavor. I'll go back for drinks but not food.

hOn7R_-suVu1n1mLrUnqmg.text: I'm in love. The festive decor charmed me the second I walked in the door. We sat down and were immediately greeting by a sweet waitress carrying a basket of chips. The chips were light and fresh and came with two salsas, a red and a green avocado salsa.  We ordered: Camarones aguachile hot drowned shrimp, Camarones culichi shrimps in a green sauce,tomatill & cilantro, rezongue enchiladas crab enchiladas in a red sauce. I also ordered a club soda and when the waitress asked if I wanted it prepared mexi style I said yes. What she brought back was a delicious mix of club soda, salt and muddled lime. It's my new favorite drink.   We patiently waited for our meal and remarked on the little mermaid scene in front of us. I almost expected the crustaceans to come to life and start playing music.  Then to our surprise little fish tostadas were dropped on our table. What a nice touch! The dishes were excellent, all were paired with homemade tortillas, beans and white rice with vegetables.  The camarones culichi was my favorite.  Fresh seafood, fun atmosphere, great service.

KX5xe9lOzCAJ377NZQacdg.text: Very good food, great service--the staff was extremely attentive and polite. All of the other customers were Latino, mostly families and couples, which speaks to authenticity of the food. The location is a bit out of the way but worth going to if you are looking for good Mexican food. Highly recommended.

l4NC7PvNNaCr_Da8hZwW8g.text: Best seafood and service. I recommend to everyone I know or just meet. Love the soups and the ceviches. Yum!

pS-gvzJIScYVC22MNIkUHA.text: It's another beautiful sunny Arizona morning after an evening of birthday festivities...which after seeing "Check Please" was celebrated here at  Mariscos Playa Hermosa.  We were a party of 10 with a reservation and ready to sample what appeared to be some great seafood!  The restaurant is small with lots of beautiful colors and wooded tables with authentic chairs and I felt like I was in Mexico!  The atmosphere was a bit chaotic ... Although they were not super busy they were running around like chickens with their heads cut off... BTW... Today's special.... Chicken! ... NOT!   In reading previous reviews... The biggest complaint is the service... Or lack of it!  Boy oh boy... They were not kidding!  Why o why do they not have ample employees?  Or at least experienced ones?   HEY OWNER... Do yourself a favor... HIRE SOME EMPLOYEES!!  Moving right along... The place is small so you can imagine it would be loud... Which it was... but that's ok.. Made it feel more festive!  It took forever to just get water and for 10 people they gave only 2 bowls of chips and tiny saucers of hot sauce... Water glasses and drink refills RARELY happened!  We tried many item between all of us.  The larger whole fish was moist and delicious! This was the best part of the evening!  They served their complimentary ceviche which was enjoyable and might I add... A nice touch!  The shrimp and fish in garlic sauce... Let's talk about that for a sec....  Ok, just the other day I cooked some shrimp on the Barbie bathed in butter/garlic. Mine was equally as good if not better because my shrimps were larger.  They use a medium shrimp that's tasty but nothing the average Joe can't make themselves... The fish part of the dish was a saturated fried piece...   Didn't try the rice simply because it looked unappetizing and did not care for the beans... I related them to baked beans... Like in hot dogs and beans... That's the initial taste.  We also tried the crab enchiladas ... Again not impressed... It was filled with crab meat but did not care for the taste ... Nor did anyone at the table.  The tortillas were tortillas nothing special.  Back to the service...I don't want to hear excuses like " it was very busy" because according you all those 5 star reviews( which I just don't get) you should expect it to be super busy on a Saturday night!  One end of the table was almost finished by the time the other end got their food... The servers had absolutely no idea who had what so she pretty much passed the plates and we figured it out ourselves!    I had to ask for all the dirty dishes to be taken away as nobody came to take them.  On to dessert...they knew we were there for a Birthday and we had to remind them several times.  For the birthday girl they give a piece of cake and she chose " tres leche cake" the cake was unlike any Tres Leche I have had.. Had a raspberry? Filling and did not taste very leche... I am no expert at this but the ones I have tried sit in the leche which absorbs into the cake making it somewhat soggy and delicious... This was different ...  I am sure there are many different kinds but it was not a hit at the table...  So, they have this other deal... Where they bribe you to YELP a reviews using names of servers and when they confirm it was posted they give you a piece of coconut cake...so one of the kids at the table did it...  I must say...the coconut cake was delish! Very moist and lots of coconut!  Getting the check was another challenge and when we did get it they charged for 3 items of which we only had 2....  Really makes me wonder... Between the REVIEW BRIBES and the mistakes on the check.... How much money they make this way?  Since we live nowhere close the chances of any of us returning are slim ...  On goes my quest to find some great Mexican food!  I imagine when a restaurant knows they are going to be on TV they make sure everything tastes great and service is great...  But on any other day you see how it really is... Don't believe everything you see on TV  It is a cute place and the fish was good... Give it a try... See what you think!  Never base a decision on one persons review... Food is a preference and I am very tough critic!    Bon Appetite'

g4Jy37iOTllbwLAVn4pAzQ.text: Mariscos on a Friday night is awesome! Our waitress, Brenda, was super cool to tres gringos! Molcajete was amazing, as well as the shrimp caliche and BACON WRAPPED SHRIMP! Their flan is also good, if they happen to have it.

1cSqqRfisSmAoIR5LEoDig.text: The best mariscos in Phoenix! Molcajete best dish to share!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Once u start u can&#39;t stop!!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy!!

U-4SHvRrJpyvheA2CK4_AQ.text: I'm gonna have to join all the 5-star reviewers.  This place is TOTALLY AWESOME !!  (forgive my usage of the cliched 80s standby, but this applies here !!)   Everything was just about right.  The service was prompt and helpful. The salad was fresh and crispy. The rice was filled with little chunks of green beans and carrots and I think corn too. The refried beans were not overly fatty nor were they overly salty. The guacamole was chunky and tasty, with BIG chunks of avocado. The corn tortillas were light, soft, and fresh. The Shrimp culichi sauce was so good that I was eating it with a spoon. The Negra Modelo on tap in a 28-oz glass for $3 was a super-bargain and Oh So Cold and Yummy. The chips were hot and fairly thick and a little oily - top notch. The red salsa was smokey and had a bit of kick. The green tomatillo/avocado salsa was about the best I've had in town. OH YES I ALMOST FORGOT:  They gave me an "on the house" Ceviche tostada, and it was the BEST Ceviche I have EVER tasted.  I don't normally like it, but this was SCRUMPTIOUS.  Can't wait for tomorrow to munch on the leftovers.  This place is not only a great Mexican SEAFOOD restaurant - it's about as good as any REGULAR Mexican restaurant in town.  Miss out on trying this place? That would be a bad move.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Culichi - awesome

14fHd9rCPxKLeBZK12N7rw.text: I only had the mixed seafood cocktail. It was not as cold as I expected it to be. The temperature and watered down flavor made me cautious about eating it. Not the best I've had. The michelada was amazing and my husbands carne asada tacos were flavorful. I would go back and try something different.

VllZ5qfJtkPPremEVSvoxw.text: Way overpriced for the amount of seafood you get. Don't think I'll be going back to this spot.

glt1kCYUg8KahFZDaWT3OA.text: The food and service was excellent. Our waitress Sol was great. We did the "Check in" on yelp and got a delicious piece of chocolate cake. Micheladas also perfect.  If you are looking for a Mexican/Seafood restaurant definitely try Mariscos Playa Hermosa .

9DipUuvDIWwzk9Ebr_Te5w.text: Great food, great service...  Ate outside on a warm and balmy evening. The waitresses checked on us regularly and no request was too much. They love to cook seafood and they are great at it.  Wonderful evening

jHMhnS1ZekLXsH0v29_leg.text: Very friendly service.   Ceviche tostadas (shrimp and fish) underwhelming, somewhat better with very generous application of lime but still not great. Bizarrely, supplied with a basket of saltines--in reality, much better on the complementary starter tortilla chips.   Camarones culichi too cheesy but otherwise a very nice sauce. The whole fried fish was great.   Flan was too firm in texture and not particularly remarkable in flavor.

37r-6QNz8QklbzllDvfc5w.text: Always great service, the drinks are on point. I highly recommend the michelada! The oyster shooter is great too but I wouldn't do it if you have an issue with texture. The tostada embarrazada is also really good but don't underestimate how much food it is! All in all a fantastic restaurant and I definitely tell my friends to come here!

0g9zY768AeIO5Oe7oGu0Tg.text: First time trying this restaurant and we weren't disappointed!  Great service, great prices and amazing food!  Portions are huge!  The ceviche is fresh and a ton of seafood in it.  The carne asada tacos were so good with lots of great tasting meat in them.  They brought us a slice of delicious carrot cake for our anniversary.  Highly recommend trying MPH!

P_C0Yc3xgQfu4w_X5I7_Jg.text: Just plain fantastic. About 70% of the menu is not your typical Mexican fare... Excellent seafood options. Tried the shrimp peppers and wrapped in bacon. It was pretty darned good, but will try other items when I come back because there are literally 12+ must try dishes in their menu. The michalades (spelling) drink with tomato sauce and beer was super fantastic. Way better than a Bloody Mary and I love Bloody Mary's!!!

GHDPa-wW17ZHtPGSFkGRhQ.text: One of if not the best Mexican seafood restaurant in all of Arizona, the staff goes above and beyond to fill all your needs, the food is amazing and fresh, the drinks are a memorable part of the experience since they make sure to either add a twist in most of them or make them so good you'll remember them anywhere you go! The decorations are beautiful and make you feel like you've transported to Mexico as soon as you walk in! Highly recommend!!

wNteqwAPu6zsLFo-7Qoozw.text: Very nice place.... inside makes you feel at ease and the colorful tables and chairs make it great atmosphere.

C_mM00WmPbNE_4ddDw64og.text: One of the best Mexican restaurant. First word I would describe this place is authenticity. The food and drinks are unbelievably delicious. The waitresses are so friendly and it makes our dining experience amazing. Thanks Brenda, the waitress, for being so awesome. I will definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The carrot cake is fucking delicious.

Ai0S40E_WdVJPsh_ONOjJA.text: I'm from out of state and this is one of my favorite places to visit while I'm in Phoenix area. It's a great time for the whole family. The food and music make it a wonderful experience. Staff is very friendly and the food is wonderful.

4elZY0oC-GOXpjnG_yEgVg.text: The food ambiance and customer service has always been great here! The food is always fresh and the flavors are amazing! I have tried different items on the menu and I have not been disappointed. Quality is something you will find here!

Pt3K1OcnwDJdzEkF2EMJWA.text: We just tried MPH for the first time. Absolutely full of color and charm, excellent service, and awesome food. Our waitress recommended the Molcajete Caliente (fish, chicken, shrimp, and beef draped over the edge of a serious bowl of boiling green sauce, with soft fresh corn tortillas, rice with vegs, and super good beans. Short story: It was amazing and we will be back.

UWXEU36KbDcCg57KNiL4Sw.text: So delicious! I can't wait to go back. The food was fresh and hot and the serving sizes were large. I really enjoyed this place, a definite must try!

hDQPJbO4rsjLpHlCd_GkzA.text: This place was amazing. The food and service were impeccable. A note: when something on the menu says hot, they mean HOT! My husbasnd and I had the molcajete a la diabla for 2 ($33) and we went through so many napkin wiping our eyes and noses. Neither of us are woosies when it comes to heat either. I had a michilada and my husband had a house margarita, both delicious (and strong). I'd love to have more of the device next time, also looking forward to trying the shrimp cocktail. We'll be back for sure!

V1wnJlQI_45WbgXdNpxqvw.text: Awesome place! Great food good ambience. It was my Bday and the mariachi played me some songs!

L5UXqQsR7oEXTxO2vfQX5A.text: Great customer service and every food item was made from scratch. This is my 2nd time here. I loved it the 1st time but decided not to post until I was sure it deserved 5 stars. My 2nd visit was even better.

LMOXZZew9k6mp3T2J67vVg.text: Man oh man.... did I stumble onto a gem!!! Just landed in Phoenix and was looking for some lunch. All the great Yelp review led me to this place. As soon as you walk you'll notice the place is fully decorated with Mexican/ Latin theme. The place was busy and the smell made you believe that you were going to walk out satisfied. The serves were so friendly, they helped us pick out some great items off the menu. We started with the choriqueso which was a hot place filled with cheese and topped with chorizo and jalapenos. For lunch, I had the fish ceviche- a very light dish filled with flavor of lime, onions, and cilantro- was a big hit! My dude had the popular burrito with carne asada, a dish definitely enough for 2. You'll be amazed just by watching the dishes that are served to others eating at the restaurant. I'd absolutely return here and recommend this place to anyone whose looking for a mixture of seafood and Mexican quinine.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh fish ceviche

iklgnxiKAnMM3u0MH1OBxA.text: This place is great! Hole in the wall for sure. Wonderful authentic food. Love the Carne Asada, and the drinks are totally picture worth. Great place to come and celebrate. Make sure to check in and show your server so you get your free slice of cake

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check in to get your free slice of cake
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Monster Margarita &amp; guacamole
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Monster Margarita &amp; guacamole

UXFl4p4ExVhjZ-fXTTxe_A.text: Every time I come here it's Amazing. I like Marisco joints and and I Love this Marisco joint! Great lil place. The food is fresh and full of flavor. Some may consider it a bit small for the eating area I call it quaint and colorful. You feel like you are in a real mariscos down in puerto Vallarta (w/o ocean view of course). I prefer Camerone (shrimp) and this place has got it down, so Tasty. I don't believe that you can order a bad plate here. The food presentation is also decent on your plate. There is also Pescado (fish), steak and chicken if you prefer non seafood that day. Avocados are fresh and the staff are friendly and quick to take care of you. The only bad thing about this place is that the parking is a bit small so arrive early for lunch or you'll have to park along the street. The portions are decent sized and very flavorful. I'd recommend this place to anyone - Yes anyone. Even my enemies lol. It's great enough to share.

hNUa7RCAlo3ZlNS5x6bgkw.text: This place has been on my list for awhile. We were in the area so we stopped in, and although the majority of the menu is seafood, I just wasn't in the mood. I will say though, most dishes sounded great so if that is your thing it's probably worth checking out.   The interior is colorful and they have many tables packed in there, so plenty of places to sit but feels a little bit like a maze trying to find your table and not run into those serving.   We were seated promptly and got our drink order in, plus chips and salsa. The salsa was awesome with a green and red option. Once we ordered, they brought out a ceviche tostado for each of us. Decent flavor and a nice touch.   I ended up ordering the al pastor tacos which came with rice and beans. The meat was delicious, plus the pineapple and onion complimented it as well. I really enjoyed them and the rice and beans were great as well. I would definitely rate these more of a 4 at least.   My girlfriend ordered the chicken enchiladas with the green sauce on the side. She said they were ok, but the chicken was pretty dry. Then again, she was eating them without sauce but she's gotten similar items without sauce elsewhere and the chicken has still not been too overdone. Either way it was average.   The service is what brought it down to a three for us. Our server was very nice and pretty attentive in the beginning, but once we ordered she was MIA until the check was dropped. Our drinks sat empty for more than half the meal as did our chips. We wanted to ask for refills but we literally didn't see her until we were ready to pay! Not sure what happened but overall, we had an average visit. Didn't stand out to me but again, perhaps the seafood is what does.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3Te6wA7pISc7dBEe_hPRAQ.text: Outstanding food and service!! Looks like a sleepy quiet Mexican Seafood joint, but walk in! Vibrant and fun.  Our table ordered a variety of seafood and all of it was awesome. The beer and grilled shrimp (forgot what it is called) was the best. The service was fun to watch because they hustle. Definitely going back.

KbMPgf6KOzTlPBToYpDPLA.text: Great selection of Mariscos plates. Ceviche good. Different from the normal ceviche I'm use to in California. This one is sweeter and less lemony. But good otherwise.

Z3HTJ2A7sfkdF8VVkEDlXA.text: I come here ANYTIME I'm craving mariscos and i LOVE it. It's not 5 stars because nothing will top fresh mariscos that I've had in Mexico, but this place knows how to do it right and close to it. I love the garlic shrimp, that's my usual order. Every now and then I'll throw in a beer. Their mixed drinks selection is AWESOME. My boyfriend likes the fried fish and we love sharing a classic shrimp cocktail together. Overall AMAZING customer service. They do get busy so it can take forever sometimes to get our food or ask for something, but that's understandable seeing how packed they can get.

nyZ89OwhLwDTB7rm7Y5GmA.text: *first Yelp review*  My boyfriend and I tried Mariscos Playa Hermosa for the first time and were impressed by the food and great customer service. If you're looking for a tasteful authentic sea food Mexican place this is it right here at Mariscos Playa Hermosa. From the great customer service they provide to the food and drinks. We started with chips and salsa the red salsa was spicy just how I like it, then we received our beautiful drinks while waiting they brought us a complementary tostada de pescado. Then it was time for our main dish it was delicious fresh and out to our table according. We had a great time enjoyed our meal and experience.   -10/10 would recommend to a friend and as for me I will be coming back.
