1WZRtGMUnM0hYaWs_xK6MQ.text: We went for my husbands birthday to eat some yummy seafood. We all got different entrees and enjoyed them. The wait was a bit too long and it took awhile to even get utensils. But our server was very friendly and accommodating to my baby daughter. Not to mention they brought out a flan for a birthday surprise for my husband. It was a really good experience overall. I would recommend not to go on very busy days because you'll end up waiting and usually outside since the inside doesn't have a waiting space without blocking the entrance.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu; some specials... will update review after we try the food! :)

IQcRAkmJ5XPtHL2pd4ij6A.text: Having moved from the Houston area to Phoenix recently, I was hoping to find a good Mexican restaurant, and this place caught my eye on Yelp. I had the beef fajitas, which were pretty good, and the restaurant's decor was very beautiful. However, I was pretty disappointed in the margarita that I ordered. I got the Azul frozen margarita, which tasted watery and truthfully I am unsure if it had any alcohol in it. In addition, the drink menu has no prices on it, and while I assumed a margarita at a Mexican restaurant would cost about $8, I learned when I got the check that I was charged $12 for basically a virgin margarita. That is very overpriced, and the restaurant should be more candid about their drink prices.

CJyGDgwd4gc2twGInJ3kbw.text: Stopped here after landing in Phoenix, before heading off on a long drive. My son had grilled shrimp on a bed of bell peppers and onions. I had the grilled scallop and octopus leg. Both were fantastic...we agreed that the octopus was the best thing on the table.   Service was friendly and swift. The decor is bright and amusing. Mid-day we saw a few families sharing lunch. If I weren't driving, i woukd have loved to have tried a michelada.

uWZJXQNp92EULCGz2OrAPQ.text: The five star reviews for MPH... are all True!  This is a wonderful restaurant serving a delicious selection of mariscos cuisine.  We had a tostada covered in cerviche and a guacamole. Our server, Rocio, was super friendly and she made excellent menu suggestions.  Rocio made us feel welcome!  The decor is also really colorful and inviting. This neighborhood restaurant is super popular. We came just before dinner and by the time we finished the restaurant was crowded. Clearly, they all know where the best mariscos is. Now I do too and so do you. Recommend MPH for awesome seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7BcWybo8pS94VyGzTF4aqg.text: As someone who doesn't love Mexican food, I sure loved Mariscos Playa Hermosa!   FOOD (5/5): The tacos were pretty cool. They come in orders of 4 and a bunch of toppings: beans, rice, onions, cilantro, red cabbage, limes, salsa, etc. When you order a bunch, they line it all up, creating a fun presentation. I ordered the tostada embarazada and I was super impressed with the value! It was filled with octopus, raw shrimp, cooked shrimp, topped with a couple slices of avocados. The waitress was nice and offered to get me half crackers and half mini tostadas chips (to get the best of both worlds). My significant other was concerned about fthe handling of the raw shrimps. It's been 24 hours and I am proud to say no food poisoning occurred.   SERVICE (6.5/5): I don't think I could say enough nice things about our waiter, Hassen A. is from Syria. He is truly the nicest, caring and most hardworking individual we've come across. He asked us if we needed to split the receipt, to get that squared away in the beginning. Despite it being super busy and having to bus a bunch of other tables, Hassen never forgot about us! He was able to provide our whole table with complimentary mini tostadas (perhaps it was later in the evening, or because it was our first visit, or maybe to keep us content while waiting?). Hassen was super personable and made sure we had an excellent meal and experience. He even offered to to take a second group photo for us after we received all of our food because he saw how I was being a total foodie. THANK YOU, YOU KIND SOUL. Unless you already have a favorite person, I definitely recommend asking for Hassen as your server. At one point, a man wearing an apron came out to ask the customers about their meal, I would assume he was the chef or owner. I appreciate and admire the extra effort and pride they take in their work.   ATMOSPHERE (5/5): It was a Sunday evening, so they had a live band. For anyone not familiar, it can be a bit loud, which wouldn't be ideal for a first date if you're hoping to have a conversation. There's also outside seating, but I wasn't sure if it would have a bit chilly for some folks. I loved the colorful decoration inside and dreamy lights outside. The music makes for a fun and lively experience (but I would check with the restaurant ahead of time about the schedule if you were looking for a place with minimal background noise).  PARKING (3.5/5): Their little parking lot can get pretty full, but there is another parking area across the street, behind this laundry mat. You will definitely find a spot, but I want to warn you that it's not well lit in the evening. Just a warning for anyone traveling alone because it could be a bit sketchy.  DEALS (5/5): Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for a free slice of cake! I saw on the menu that for desserts, they offer flan, carrot cake, coconut cake, and chocolate cake. Our waiter brought us a pretty nice piece of chocolate cake!

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The line up!

JNLQbmdJi0lYA5_Xc60RDw.text: Went searching for mariscos on Yelp and found this place on an ad. After looking at the reviews and photos I knew I just had to come.  Inside this place is beautiful, it took me right back to Mexico. When we came in we kinda knew what wanted, definitely had to get the fried red snapper. We also ordered a couple ceviche tostadas and two ceviche tostadas were provided complimentary.  We also ordered the Plato del Capitan and holy moly this was insane, so good. The shrimp was prepared like four different ways and they were all fantastic.  Back to the red snapper, it was sooooo good. Like so good! The fish was prepared perfectly, it was moist and it tasted amazing.  I've long searched for a great Mexican restaurant out here in Phoenix and I can finally say that I have found one. This place is exceptional.

vbomz-KvJ7ufkcBBSGh_xw.text: Hands down the BEST Mexican Seafood I've had in a really long time! We come to Phoenix often, I guarantee we'll be back.   Oyster appetizer was delicious -- very fresh and clean. Had two micheladas and to be honest I usually don't order micheladas as I don't like them. I tried my husbands and I was impressed.   We shared a mocajete that was more than enough for the both us. It has beef, chicken, shrimp, and oysters inside, as well as fish. Also ordered the "Toritos" which are jalapenos (not regular jalapenos, not sure what it was) stuffed with shrimp and wrapped in bacon. Cooked to perfection!!  For dessert: the flan -- this wasn't my favorite but it was still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lKdL8LQeFhgIwYED6O1ObA.text: Great Food.   This is the place where Abuelo's and Abuelita's go to eat and they don't want anybody else to know about it.     Chips and salsa are delicious (usual gringo litmus test) The seafood selections are all outstanding.     The simple sauces to accompany the varying dishes are extremely flavorful and very diverse.    I lean towards the fish and or shrimp preparations.   The service is good and the prices are reasonable.

r7K0oeYIvGyx95pSh90j7g.text: We experienced slow and unorganized service. Our party received our food sparatically with 2 of our orders delivered about 15 minutes after the others. We also had to remind our server that we asked for another beer after about 20 minutes of waiting.   Overall the food was decent but we received really bad service.

8PDVqbNhaAm1BK4AlxP1dg.text: This place is really good I enjoy the food, everything is delicious service is okay and I love the mariachi the only thing that sucks is that it's very very small so seating is limited and very awkward it can be hard to enjoy a meal when all the tables are crammed together but everything else is good

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner with the family

BdI-ivAh9Rzx5LvQ-fdKog.text: Pescado a la planca is excellent!! We were a party of 10 when my parents were in town and the food was excellent. Unfortunately they confused some of the order and wouldn't fix it, which put a slight dent in my opinion of their customer service.  Love the place.

uiUbGSR12faaHpm0YRFVYA.text: Pescado zarandeado 5/5- AMAZING dish but THIS FEEDS AT LEAST THREE PEOPLE! Order accordingly or you'll have a whole pound of leftover fish to take home.   Camarones aguachiles 5/5  Toritos 5/5- these are spicy but so worth it!   Tacos al gobernador 2/5- we went with a safe choice when choosing this dish and were disappointed. They were very bland corn tortilla tacos with too much mozzarella cheese. I would recommend you go for something a little more risky!   Enchilada Style Burrito 1/5- not good. This goes to show that if you go to a mariscos (seafood) restaurant, you shouldn't eat anything but the mariscos!   The food is very pricy and not necessarily worth it, but I think I'll still be coming back for more toritos.

4BTruekGvwxmERtc4uY87g.text: One of my favorite place when it comes to seafood. I have tried many things on the menu but I have to say my all time favorite are the fish tacos! I have tried the aguachile and it is good I personally would of liked it more spicy and some more avocado which traditionally comes with. The micheladas are     Pretty darn good. If your up for trying something outside the box try the camarones culichi.

INp2MsCD7pWeMZdQIoZpZQ.text: LOCATION:  This restaurant is indeed in a part of Phoenix  (south of I-10) known to be a "bad" neighborhood.  This is no easy badge to earn, because, unlike most other cities, there aren't good neighborhood separated from bad ones:  Phoenix is one of the few cities I've ever been to, where you can have a million dollar home and two doors down from it is a crack house.  Bizarre, but True.  Having said that, I personally would not want to come here when the sun is down, but when we arrived at 6pm, it was quiet and I didn't feel uneasy about the surroundings.  PARKING LOT:  The entrance to the restaurant is off of Garfield and not 16th Street, which you'll be taking to get here.  This is important, because you'd think it would have an entrance to the parking lot from the main road; it doesn't.  The parking lot, like the restaurant, is small and they share it with a barber shop, which threatens to tow if you park in their spots.  Obviously, this is no problem after they close; but during business hours, I imagine it can be hard to find spots which "belong" to the restaurant.  THE RESTAURANT:  And, like the parking lot, the restaurant is small inside.  There aren't a lot of tables, so it wouldn't take much to fill up the place.  The decor is typical "Mexican":  lots of colors, nature motifs, sombreros, etc.  It may be jarring for some conservative Anglo types, but they more than likely wouldn't come here anyway.  The pinks, blues, greens, yellows and other colors so typical of the Mexican Pacific seem to blend nicely and don't seem garrish at all.  Now, as I said, the place is small.  So, for example, someone sitting at the table behind me actually had to pass next to my table to get to their seat.  Not a big deal and she politely excused herself twice.  This might be unacceptable in a 3 or 4 star restaurant or even something simply "formal".  But the atmosphere in this place is far from formal.  It's friendly, loud, noisy and familiar.  If you don't like people and if you're uptight about someone walking past you while you're eating, you won't like this place.  If you're there to enjoy the food, have a good time with friends, or don't mind a lively atmosphere, you'll do fine here.  That being said, I believe, I read somewhere that they have live Mariachi music on Fridays.  I'm not a fan of the genre, but even if I were, as small as that place is, I have a strong feeling it would be very LOUD while the music was being performed.  There are two TVs in the place, which, typical for this kind of venue, were playing soccer.  They were not loud and did not intrude on personal conversations.  The place also seems to have a full bar and a number of beer specials.  THE FOOD:  Being older and having to bring in my reading glasses, one of the things I very much appreciated about the menu was each item being listed in Spanish and English, with Spanish written in blue and English in yellow ink.  This made it much easier to separate the two and quickly see what was what.  I ordered a fish combo which was supposed to come with octopus and shrimp and with a creamy mushroom sauce.  It was not a "combo" in the sense that most Americans would be used to.  I expected there to be some fish filet, some shrimp and some octopus.  What came was a fish filet covered in mushroom sauce with some shrimp and very tiny pieces of octopus mixed in.  My companion had a less expensive fish filet with garlic sauce.  Outside of the different price and the cream sauce, they looked exactly the same.  Nevertheless, while this might sound negative, I was not at all disappointed with my plate.  My companion thought his fish greasy; I think it was the garlic sauce.  My fish was not at all greasy and tasted wonderful.  The food was served hot, but not so hot as to burn you.  The rice served with the fish was plain and nothing exciting; and yet, it complimented the fish perfectly.  The portions look huge and they are; but I didn't feel stuffed when I was done; just contented.  It was just the right amount of food.  I had oysters as an appetizer.  If you like oysters, they were good with the lime juice I squeezed on them.  If you don't, well, then it doesn't matter, does it?  The ceviche was okay; a lot of reviewers made a big deal about them in their reviews.  There was nothing bad about them; just nothing special.  Overall, we were both VERY happy with the food, the portion size, the temperature they were served at, and the taste ... and my partner usually complains about everything!  So this is a BIG endorsement!  THE SERVICE:  *sigh* ... Not everything can be perfect and this was the pebble amidst the pearls in the evening.  The service staff is friendly.  But the place is too small, has too many people  (on a Thursday night, no less ... can you imagine it on a Friday?!?); and not enough servers to be as attentive as they have to be.  Food and drinks were served promptly.  But when it came time to pay, I had to track them down.

5TuGS_5BxIOHEIT43AFMkg.text: A decent spot to eat at. Our waitress wasn't as fast as she could have been considering it wasn't packed. Most of the food was tasty especially the molcajete but we had three complaints that kept coming up around the table. The fish was very sub-par, over cooked, and over seasoned. The rice was a little soggy and it was very tasteless, it was almost hard to eat to be honest. To finish it off the salsa was very watery and it felt like it was missing something. All In all, it was an alright spot I doubt we will be going back considering the long drive but I wouldn't count it out for good.

YLK7aw2xquhszk_cGt4Ixg.text: One of my favorite mariscos (seafood) places in the valley. Their avocado salsa is amazing. They make incredible micheladas (which is surprisingly difficult for a lot of Mexican restaurants). Their cocktails are delicious. The restaurant is very clean. My only complaint is that parking can be difficult to find, but still, if you're craving refreshing sea food, I would highly recommend this place.

9WvvCvT-Bf4-2QRHrxsafg.text: All the Mexican seafood favorites - shrimp cocktail, ceviche, fish tacos, etc... The shrimp in hot red sauce are fantastic! All around good stuff. Good selection of Mexican beers as well. I went for the 24 ounce Modelo. Reasonably priced as well.

_6jBnyL4nhwTXofhHqEFBw.text: Although I'm from the midwest, I consider myself well traveled. This was the best Mexican I've ever had. You know you are off to a good start when the salsa is amazing. They gave a complementary salmon ceviche as well to start. I ordered the fish with two sauces, half cilantro sauce the other half chipotle sauce. Huge portion. The fish was fried and cooked to perfection. With my one night in Phoenix I'm so happy I went here.

Sp2sL4065_7cMjI3JVSY4w.text: Very festive decor with all kinds of little mermaid paintings and colorful chairs/counters. Chips are light and fresh and came with two salsas, a red and a green salsa.  Fast, friendly and attentive service.  Had the recommended crab enchiladas in a red sauce. Delicious and heavy on the crab, as it should be  BOTTOM LINE: Festive and delicious Mexican seafood in a strip-mall barrio kinda way

xH57IiykROx_sXorkScraQ.text: Authentic food, friendly service and the best mariscos! Must try and bring some friends! Their Margaritas and Micheladas are great!

lGrDkjTN783OZOGDsTWobQ.text: I've tried every Marisco spot in phoenix and this place is on another level. Great staff , amazing food and good tres leches cake. Food always Is fresh and the appetizers are out of this world good. I ate here 2 times in one week when I first found out about it.

cs_55J3KqASXejbCbGnaIw.text: Love this restaurant. Enough the shrimps in red sauce. Hot, spicy, wonderful. Bright and beautiful. Service is excellent. Amazing micheladas. Every dish is cooked to perfection.

pMskV9olm6aQzmY945VVWQ.text: The service was pretty fast. I was not too impressed with food. Ordered the culichi shrimp and a consume. My rice was undercooked, there was literally 5 shrimps in the green sauce. The sauce was very watered down. My consume was pretty flavorless, I added salt and limes sadly it didn't help. It was not the best I had but not the worst. Would not come here again.

SX0WsldcGWRdYQ3r_413Bw.text: Had the Grande Mix Cocktail, Shrimp wrapped in Bacon, and the famous 7 Sea Soup.  One of the ingredient in the cocktail probably has seen its better days, cause it was unpleasantly fishy and bitter. Shrimp wrapped in Bacon (Shrimp Fantasia) was decent, but I had better at other places. 7 Sea soup was average, thought I think I will like it a lot more if the soup is served warmer than room temperature.   One last thing, Mexican cuisine usually pairs with tons of lime as garnish and flavoring especially when it comes to seafood. And almost all Mexican restaurants (or taco trucks) i been to seem to shared the talents of picking out the juiciest limes  that's ever grown. Well, not this place. One interesting I encountered today after decades of Mexican food experience was how dry their lime were. Most of them won't even budge one drop of juice for me. Wonder if that would make the difference for the cocktail or the soup?

97Bkq0TWpl_NCXFYgphKqg.text: Best Mexican Seafood I have ever had.  And, I must add that I live in Los Angeles area and we have tons of Mexican Seafood Places, but this place is by far the best!!!!  They also have a very friendly staff as well... I travel to Phoenix all the time for business and I'm not having another trip w/o eating here..

JD34fKWBPJEgbUR2aB_9UQ.text: The further into the sketchier parts of Phoenix we drove, the more I knew that Mariscos Playa Hermosa was going to be legit. Its quite unassuming from the outside but the overly-enthused lobster sign out front let's you know you've arrived.  Don't judge a book by its cover.  Mariscos Playa Hermosa may appear a bit ghetto but open its doors and you've entered a tropical island paradise.  The inside reminds me of what the Chiquita Banana lady's house would look like...  blindingly bright colors, suns, moons, parrots, wooden fruit, flowers and trees.     There was one man running the show and he was superb.  Very attentive, expedient and friendly.   You won't be disappointed with the shrimp culichi or any of the cerviche menu options... not to mention the wide margarita selection.

Oi2sypWKvm30TWvEzZoi0g.text: I've tried several of their dishes. It's ok.  I did like their cocktail de camaron but nothing special.

3r9gyOFif8Yf5gV2gYu27w.text: Best seafood in Arizona hands down. I love this place just wish it was closer to home. The fish tacos are amazing.

-IZQAu8aJ-xvZmnPuxnndg.text: I was in Arizona for the weekend visiting my cousin and this was the best last meal we could have together! I can honestly say those are the best fish tacos I've ever had plus their cilantro/lemon/guac salsa is amazing! The waitresses went out of their way to make sure we where comfortable and that my cousins kids where happy. Plus, the place wasnt packed at all and the atmosphere was wonderful with all the bright fun colors.

Ltr8a07QJdZiadmV7sEJUQ.text: Everything was DELICIOUS!  We're from out of town and found this little gem through Yelp.  They give you complimentary chips and salsa and ceviche and tostada with your entree order.  Service was great as well, very attentive and accommodating.  Great restaurant!  Highly recommend!!

_XJyEYt2aHJMmkXBovlrsQ.text: I'm taking my dad here.  This place is pretty authentic- made me long for a beach in lareado.   The Hunny and I had a dozen oysters (not a good choice but not bad any means)  We downed those with tapatio and fresh lime.   Then we had ceviche.  So good! I loved it. It was hearty with great lime sauce.   I had the fish tacos and he had shrimp and fish veracruz or something.  Both were good- did it taste like the freshest fish of all time? no.  Did I eat it anyways because it tasted like Baja California. Yup.   I really like this place.  They also have the fat boy's favorite mexican beer- bohemia.

SoTX3NJ9_5cy7BxtfGJOSQ.text: This is my absolute favorite favorite place now!! Everything we've had has been great but our go to dish is the Molcajete Caliente and I will probably never steer away from it. The sauce? BOMB. The tortillas? BOMB. The octopus? BOMB.

DFpFmowE-9SfcrxSIGM_uA.text: Came back to try more stuffs... it was kind of disappointing to be honest. This time I tried the Camarones culichi and a dozen of fresh oyster on the half shells ... Camarones culichi... the sauce is pretty good! However, it was overpriced as hell.... it was a small bowl portion with 6 shrimps in a bowl of sauce and some cheese sprinkled on top. Way too expensive for a 15.99$   Oysters came out okay but to my surprised there was no cocktail sauce nor horse radish. It was only oysters and lime..... -_- you can imagine how fishy the taste is. 16.00$   Cocktail was good as last time. $15.99  We don't get complimentary ceviche this time :( I wonder why

w1WeBiFyAToJ7uIzT1ueyw.text: Food was good. I loved the fried whole fish. Burrito left my daughter desiring more so she ate 1/2 my fish. Rice and beans cane out cold and they charged for every extra little thing we asked for. Example the Pico de Gallo. Nearly $5 really?!? For Arizona, we out of town era expected better flavors, food options etc than we'd find in Washington.

mheUZzhq6DPHdcmXRZq8hA.text: Holy hell!! Lovely atmosphere, servers were nice but confused... the food seems prepackaged...like on the frozen thawed out side of things...the horchata was pink .... the salsa was hot sauce.... overpriced... never got our salads... didn't receive silverware until we were almost done with our food....the rice had your moms frozen peas and carrots mixed in it... 4.5 stars  I spent half the price for more authentic fresh food at las Gloria's and walked with left overs that I will eat now instead of my lunch.   I would give 5 stars for ambience and a nice waitstaff

y4z2xXonLj7tf4CwF0Rdmw.text: I live in Southern California and we came from there on Sunday and we happen to have Easter lunch it's very hard to find a good place that serves seafood especially when the ocean is nowhere to be found very glad that we found this place in the middle of the desert

JiKVAOPjmibsvwTK_mM8GA.text: Wow! Everything here is amazing. The food, the service, the atmosphere, the prices.   The food tastes SO fresh. The seafood, the veggies, all of it. It is so great. And if you like spicy foods, try the Diablo sauce.... boy, is it hot (but tasty).   The service really is unbelievably amazing. We had a couple of questions that our sever couldn't answer so she grabbed someone who could. They were also great about working with my wheat allergy (they definitely have a number of gluten free options).  I had the jalapeno margarita and sucked it down so quick I was actually amazed how good it was. I could barely taste the alcohol for a few minutes then quickly realized that it was, in fact, kind of potent... it had great flavor and a little bit of a kick (nothing too bad). We also got a Cadillac margarita, which was also tasty.   Our bill ended up being about $100 for three people (with six drinks). You can't beat that price anywhere.   Come here if you like great food, drinks and prices.

QiAHv39X7RyuR33Q60kvOw.text: Super good!!! Ordered ceviche! My husband ordered shrimp cocktail and it was filled w shrimp! we got free tostadas! The mangoyada was perfect-enough tequila and chamoy! Only negative is they only have one bathroom! Service was great overall!

otfO0XoyUllA56yzr0Gs9Q.text: If you have a service dog, (legit) they'll make you sit on the patio. When we showed our papers and questioned why we had to sit outside when it's cold. They came back and said they couldn't serve us cause we're drunk! Which wasn't the case, the person who needs the dog has severe anxiety and is a little intense with a disability. We were extremely offended and upset, but gladly left.

uz9D0dSdJ8vi30-EEbN5jA.text: Great food and the service is second to none. They had a Mariachi Band the night we were there (Sunday). Have been there a couple of times and it's been great.

QQAKU-W4L7zisFHCeCUfZg.text: Love it! Food was amazing. We got the molcajete for two in salsa verde (green sauce), is a delicious combination of seafood, chicken and beef, served in a hot bowl made out of rock. It was YUMMY! Place is nice, great decoration, fair prices. Service was wonderful, fast, attentive and kind. Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Say what? Yummmmmmmmy!  Molcajete. Believe me this is something you don&#39;t want to miss. Delicious combination of seafood, chicken and meat.

4yDn2DxdPbmMJmpvVxnwQA.text: Excellent service and great sea food. I recommend the shrimp ceviche. The wine was poured generously which is always nice.

BX2unDd0m15gkaEsquXyPA.text: It's very hard to find a good seafood restaurant in Phoenix.  The service was great.  Our waitress checked with us a lot making sure we had everything we needed.    Clean restaurant.  It wasn't busy but I hear that it gets packed for lunch.  Their Hibiscus juice (jugo de Jamaica) was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food was delicious!  Steamed fish with veggies over it.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Colorful setting and very clean.

vX4HltsyUJ_L5zt34jgmMg.text: Horrible service , waiting 49 minutes for a table, waitress took another 10 minuets to come and take our drink order , waitress left with our drink order (Margarita and beer) came back without drinks , took our food order , waited another 15 minutes still no drinks , but food arrived , ordered a shrimp cocktail and 2 shrimp tostadas and 3 tacos , still no drinks ... half way through our food (which was ok) waitress shows up no drinks and finally we asked we for water and she gave us another excuse as to why our drinks were not here yet, food was almost done and finally our drinks , waitress never came back another waitress delivered our drinks, and check .. will never go again , not sure why it receives 4-5 stars .... rethink about going to this place it's very small , and not organized enough , need better service ...

FyBO0OEkYmZ7V0EVkGmQ_w.text: As a visitor in Phoenix we went with highest rated and nearby place.  Easy parking, loved the cute doorbell and liked it was full with a range of folks from couples to families.  I wish I had gone with the jug of margarita because YUM!  Food was fresh and tasty.  We had fish tacos, enchiladas, and a side of guacamole, would do again.

20WVDWdqSFJWvyk7PKJXjw.text: Close to the airport and they offer a complimentary fish tostada. The grilled fish tacos are really delicious. I will come back next time I am in AZ!

GZ3mhqh5Pf_mtrldXeXgrA.text: Ok,  this place is awesome.  If you are anywhere near the airport (or even if your not!) you must stop by here.  While listed as a seafood restaurant their menu covers the gamut.  Oysters are excellent.  If you like hot, their fish filet in diablo sauce is as good as it gets.  Look I eat Mexican all over the country and trust me when I say this place rocks.  Friday night they have a mariachis band.  Beer is cold and the margaritas are solid what more can you say.  One of the better Mexican restaurants in metro.......YES!

x80BmsJEFP0VmJS10qjW2Q.text: Hands down a wonderful experience. My grandparents were visiting from Colombia and love Mexican food and even more, mariachi music. We saw the great reviews about this restaurant and brought them here only to find this place exceeded our expectations. From the moment we walked in, we were taken to a little world of authentic Mexico. We were greeted by their owner, Jose, then serviced with genuine smiles and excellent service. The details in their decor and furniture made for great pictures and amazement. We were then serenaded by the talented Mariachi band and even they had warm smiles on their faces. I can't leave out the food that blew our taste buds away. If only there was a way to expand our stomachs :) You must visit this warm and welcoming restaurant and taste their savory dishes. Trust me you won't be disappointed.

QUQDlcZcBn_H_WDlzym1Dw.text: This restaurant isn't located in a very good part of town, but the food speaks for itself and is worth the travel. They serve Mexican-styled seafood but does offer non-seafood options for those seafood haters. Options are numerous and diverse. I ordered a fajita during my first visit so I couldn't attest to all their seafood dishes. However, the options I tasted were well-constructed and tasty. They were very judicious in their use of lime, which I greatly appreciate. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fajita and even the chicken was on par.  The restaurant itself is rather small and interior is vibrant. They pack a lot of people into this place. There is no wasted space. There were a lot of people there, and our wait was about 20 minutes. Most people sat on the patio as they waited for a table. To access the patio, you have to first walk through the restaurant. It's an awkward set-up. The patio itself was pretty decent. They had umbrellas and misters which kept everyone cool. The bathrooms look like they're newly renovated and were very clean. Our server was very nice and helpful, but there was definitely a language barrier. I appreciated her effort to understand and communicate with us.

WHrfhpke-TvS_bk9Fp3RFA.text: My go to spot for a nice cold brew or yummy michelada! The micheladas are up there on my list of favorite places to grab a michelada! The waitstaff is attentive and friendly. Tried the shrimp quesadilla, which was a healthy portion that was of shareable size. Will continue to come here!

lrk_vmeB5VMaQQxd6vEgKg.text: Mariscos Playa Hermosa was picked for May's International Supper Club UYE and we had a big turnout expected 14 but had around 26 to 30 and I have to say management & servers didn't blink an eye when I kept asking for another chair please.  Excellent customer service!    The parking lot is very very small, maybe can park 8 to 12 cars, but there is plenty of parking on the street, so that what I did, once inside the place is very colorful and inviting.  I ordered the 3 carne asada tacos with beans and rice. They were great street tacos perfect for what I was craving. The beans and rice were ok, over all it was a good dish and with tax included came in under 10 bucks! That's a great deal for dinner!    After everyone was done eating they brought us out 5 different types of cakes/dessert to try, chocolate cake, tres leches cake, coconut cake, cheese cake & flan. I'm a chocolate lovin fool and the chocolate cake was perfect, it was sweet, rich and full of chocolaty goodness, but my favorite I have to say was the Tres Leches Cake, that stuff was amazing! Also the coconut cake was great too!   I defiantly will be coming back to try a few other of their dishes for sure!

We saw the great reviews about this restaurant and brought them here only to find this place exceeded our expectations. From the moment we walked in, we were taken to a little world of authentic Mexico. We were greeted by their owner, Jose, then serviced with genuine smiles and excellent service. The details in their decor and furniture made for great pictures and amazement. We were then serenaded by the talented Mariachi band and even they had warm smiles on their faces. I can't leave out the food that blew our taste buds away. If only there was a way to expand our stomachs :) You must visit this warm and welcoming restaurant. Trust me you won't be disappointed!

gb62MU91zA5fbgzzPLbDKg.text: This place provides wonderful service! Wendy was our waitress and constantly attended to our needs. The restaurant is beautiful, colorful, and very clean. We went on a Friday when there was mariachi. The environment feels light and fun.  The dishes are beautiful and DELICIOUS. Overall everything was more than I expected.

QoydFfCAQI_POf_IEK-FaA.text: The owner and management of this establishment need to get their act together.  Their hours of closing are listed as 9pm.  If you arrive at 830 they don't serve you, if you arrive at 8 they don't serve you, if you arrive at 730 like we did this evening they decided to close early, there's a new excuse for closing early every time we are turned away, although there were still tables with guests having dinner. The food at this place is outstanding but honestly driving 30 minutes to find it "closed" every evening we look forward to having a nice dinner is getting old and I hope for their sake they can get this situation figured out as this is a huge turnoff for customers. We won't be driving back for dinner again.  Get this figured out you have a great restaurant.

bphq74h0gsfHyztSJ_T2lA.text: Came here because my boyfriend wanted mariscos and had raved about this place.  The seafood was really fresh and flavorful and the salsa that came with the chips was really good and spicy. This is where the positives end for me.  The service was extremely slow as it took over an hour to get our food. The server was apologetic though so I wasn't really super upset about the wait.   I ordered a Serrano margarita, which I thought sounded pretty cool. I'm a fan of spicy margaritas so I didn't think this would be a problem. It took about 10-15 minutes longer to receive than my boyfriend's michelada which should have been a red flag. I'm thinking maybe this isn't something people order often and the bar tender (who I think was also our server...I saw her behind the bar quite a bit) was scrambling to figure out how to make it.  What I got was nothing short of an abomination. It was really bad. It tasted like a Serrano pepper and some ice cubes went through a wood chipper and shot out the other end into a margarita glass. I couldn't taste any lime or tequila in it at all. Had my boyfriend try it and he said he'd never tasted anything like it and to send it back, which I did.    I told the server I didn't like the drink and her response was "well Serrano peppers are spicy." Yeah, I know that. That's why I ordered it. *insert eye roll*  Went with a house margarita instead, which was good but tasted like it was from a mix. At least this left little margin for error.  When we got the bill, I was still charged for both drinks. The bill was an outrageous $100 for three drinks (my two margaritas and the michelada), an appetizer and two entrees. A man who I'm guessing was the manager had come by to drop off the check and ask how everything was, and I said it was fine prior to looking at the bill. Perhaps our server had sent him over to do damage control thinking I'd complain.  I've never sent anything back in a restaurant ever so I don't know how it works but I sure didn't expect to be charged for it. So if you eat here and don't like anything you eat or drink, you might as well finish it cause you'll be paying for it anyway. I just wanted to leave at this point so I paid the bill and made sure the tip I left was less than the amount of the $13 science experiment margarita I got, which is a shame because I normally tip well.   I don't plan on ever coming back here.

aOU2kHAmgEjl0foXZ1269g.text: I'm definitely the odd man out here! Yelp.... I followed your followers to a horrible food experience! Boohoo.   I truly don't understand the number of high reviews here.  Service was extremely slow, and the timing was awful, my husband got his meal served. He waited a good 10 minutes, before I begged him to eat. I was ready to tell the server to forget my entree, when it finally arrived 15 minutes later. ( hubby was finished with his meal.)  The food was so below average to say the least, that it was extremely irritating to pay $50 for our lunch. ( tostados, shrimp stuffed peppers, and 2 beers.    I had two or three bites, and I was ready to go!  So dissatisfied, and disappointed! Never Agian

-X9xC28Q7SMvKoTTomohnQ.text: This is not a normal Mexican restaurant this is a Seafood Restaurant and it's damn good. We had the shrimp platter I forgot what it was called and the Whole Red Snapper topped with shrimp. It was probably the best Mexican meal I've ever had. I'm taking anyone and everyone that visits from out of town there

568s27yLfFuU4SctlFq1Eg.text: Came to this cute whole in the wall Mexican seafood restaurant with some girlfriends.   Love the decor of the restaurant.   Customer service was great! They served us fish  Ceviche tostada on the house. OMG that was so refreshing and yummy. It was a great surprise and random. Food kick off with a good start.  We ordered a few dishes to share and must say we are impressed with each of the dishes. I never knew how spicy Mexican food can be.   Grilled shrimps: it was cooked just perfect and the dipping sauce that came with the dish was so refreshing. The perfect amount of spice and citrus.  Fillet de pescado de la Diablo in hot red sauce. The dish is huge and best shared. The fish is meaty and cooked just right. Not overcooked or chewy and the sauce is a balance of sweet and sour. Never had this dish at any other Mexican restaurants before. Highly recommended.  Seafood Ceviche in this huge bowl of red sauce with octopus, scallops, shrimps, cucumbers, red onions and there were raw and cooked shrimps on top of the bowl. So delicious! Warning it's extremely hot.   My friend ordered draft Modelo and it came in this huge glass as big as a pitcher!   The mangolado was so perfect on a hot summer day.  Its a blended Mango drink with a shot of house tequila and tamarind. Try it you won't regret it.

c85ST-nT-AdiuAPEsJWrew.text: OMG. I love this place. We went here with a good friend and I could not believe how wonderful the food was. Truly authentic. Our dinner was a lava rock cauldron filled with a variety of meat and fish in a  scrumptious sauce that simmered in the natural pot for at least ten minutes after it arrived. Great service and a great place for families. Wait staff wears regional Mexican outfits and the decorations are bright and colorful. I felt like I was at a party in Mexico with great service and food. The restaurant does close at 9 PM on the dot so make sure you get there early enough to enjoy the great food.

LFXqNU65qF1wDt6TCvqcig.text: We really liked the food. It's definitely worth the trip if you are coming from far away. The only reason I gave them 4/5 is because they have a website that takes reservations. We made a reservation because we were a larger party. Well, when we got there, they said they were not currently accepting reservations. What?!?! So we waited 1 hour 40 min! I would think they would disable the reservation feature online or post an announcement on the home page not to try to make a reservation in an effort to keep customer service high.  Once we were seated, though, our waiters was great and, like I mentioned before, the food was

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp ceviche. It&#39;s got a tomato base, which I don&#39;t prefer. Kinda tastes like a shrimp cocktail. It was OK...
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molcajete with Steak, shrimp and chicken
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special Michelada. Now THIS was awesome!!!

sdk7s3bIrnJWz6gQUdwnlg.text: Mirachi band. Check.  Delicious appetizers. Check.  Amazing entrees. Check.  Great service. Check.   This place has it all. The seafood sampler is amazing and would reccomend for big parties to share all around.   They have great dishes and their enchiladas are very authentic. I loved coming here on a Friday with fanily and they had a live mirachi band.   Place is small and tight but worth it. The offer chips and salsa and its the best in town.   I drove 40 minutes to come here and would do it plenty more times.

UoSy6BbJ7WygxKLxkUExYA.text: Best mariscos in the valley. Hands down. Nestled in a small parking lot of central Phoenix, we took the time to visit during rush hour on a Thursday. It's a beautiful bright colored building, with colorful tiles and detailed paintings inside and out. They have a beautiful patio. We decided to sit outside, since they had misters, umbrellas, trees, and plants everywhere! Beautiful inside and outside decor and atmosphere.   We were greeted at the table with fresh fried homemade chips, and two types of salsa: red and green. My SO liked the green, I went for the red.   Our waitress was patient, funny, and hospitable! SO ordered a modelo, and we put in an order for their Ceviche de Camarone. We usually share everything we eat at restaurants, so for our entree, we figured the Molcajete Caliente. We went with the verde Culichi sauce and we did not regret our decision.   The Molcajete comes with: 3 pieces of carne asada,  6 pieces of grilled shrimp, 3 pieces grilled chicken, and 3 pieces fried fish. It also came with two plates of rice, beans, salads, and tortillas. Needless to say, we were stuffed by the end of our meal.   The ceviche came out first. It was seasoned perfectly, topped with avocado slices, and served with tostadas. We wanted to finish the ceviche so badly but we knew we had to save our appetites.   The chicken, shrimp, carne and fish were all cooked to perfection. Tender, incredibly flavorful, and the best part is dunking the meat in the sauce in the bowl. The sauce is a fish based sauce, with octopus and different fish inside. Don't let this scare you if you are a timid eater. Everything was cooked perfectly and the fish was incredibly fresh.   Our waitress came to check up on us, and we asked for more chips.... that's how damn delicious they were. Come here just for the chips and salsa if nothing else.   We checked in to yelp as well, and received a free slice of chocolate cake to end our meal. Even though we were stuffed we still somehow had room for a giant slice of decadent chocolate cake... that's usually how it goes, right?   You have the option of coconut, chocolate, and vanilla (I believe). Highly recommend checking in!   I can't wait to come back here.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And the star of the show. The Molcajete.
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My little taco

8O0spwxau8xElKv26d1XNQ.text: This has always been my favorite authentic Mexican seafood restaurant. However my waitress is so young she doesn't remember the restaurant used to be on McDowell. Cheers to success. I ordered the Seafood Pardillo and the Margarita Bulldog. I was cautioned to call a cab. The food is great, as always PS: if you're not a fan of jalapenos, just eat the seafood and skip the sauce. Four plates of food in all for $22.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Octopus and scallops, primarily.

kifPdYinHuF0UoDunHRyZA.text: Excellent food! Awesome service and decent prices  I highly recommend stopping by for lunch...than you'll be coming for dinner.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corner seating...

yddtMIffrAEoHomPIiOyIw.text: Thanks for the lead on this one Yelp!  We went down to this place with no expectations but hope that it would be a good experience with good food, simple as that.  Upon arriving, it appeared to be a rather small place but the parking lot was filled and as soon as we walked in, it was packed.  Mariel was our server and greeted us promptly with a smile.  Salsa and chips were served immediately.  There was a green salsa and a red salsa.  The red was a bit hotter for us so we went through several bowls of the green salsa which was delicious.  Mariel brought us a sample of the seafood ceviche on a crispy corn tortilla.  It was amazing.  I ordered the three taco sampler plate with beans and rice.  The tacos were shrimp, beef and chicken.  All were amazing but I liked the shrimp and the beef the best.  My wife ordered the garlic shrimp and the butter sauce was out of this world!  They wouldn't share the secret on how they made it but it is a must try!  For dessert, we had a flan and a chocolate cake.  Both are homemade and delicious!  We are definitely going to try the red snapper next time.  We watched as about 10 people ordered this and it looked delicious and interesting.  This is a family owned business and the pride that the manager and owner Manual and team takes in the business shows well.  Nothing better than eating at a restaurant when it is full of happy people.  Say hi to Manuel when you are there.  His mom started this restaurant many years ago and he has continued the tradition.  Ask for Mariel too!  She was great and took good care of us.  If you are looking for a quiet place, this is not it.  We loved the energy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flan and chocolate cake....make sure to save some room!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos!
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic shrimp with beans rice...so delicious!

MYrLsd-oC4yMzMLArS3QkQ.text: 100% Gem!! Everything we have ever had at this restaurant has been on point phenomenal! Discovered it over 15 years ago and have never been disappointed. Yoooo Mariscos Playa Hermosa is the real deal! Over the top Mexican decor, bright colors...The food is like what you would get in Mexico where fresh fish is done right everywhere. Salsas are spicy, chips warm from the fryer. And, the menu offers a wide range of choices, mostly centered around shrimp and fish, prepared in many different ways. We all ways ordered the Mocajete perfect for 2-3 people amazing tender seafood and meats! I love this place! 100% recommend!

BY5oBBhPBM3GoEwEE3qy8Q.text: A little piece of old Mexico right here in Phoenix.  The minute you step through the door you are transposed to the Baja with food, music, lovely women, incredible atmosphere and great food.  I love  going in on Sundays and seeing all the ninos dressed in their Sunday best.  You can usually catch the Broncos on TV during football season.  The host and managers are the friendliest people anywhere.  Coming from Snottsdale this place is a breath of fresh air, vibe wise.  If you are a gringo you may feel out of place, or even uncomfortable if you are a really really gringo.   But no need to, everyone here is friendly, just reach out and smile.

Mcy_lxX2p_A_5mlgA8R7pw.text: Very good!  They have a seafood heavy menu which my table companions ordered from and they were super pleased with.  I wasn't feeling like seafood and I was pleased to find they had plenty to choose from.  The chicken burrito was huge.  The flavor felt as though they had taken the time to make it even though it wasn't their staple.    I also ordered a beer and when asked I went with the smaller size which was still ginormous when it came which was great!   My only call out is that we sat right next to the front door as there is no front of house stand.  Otherwise, though very much worth finding a parking spot to enjoy some fantastic Mexican flavors!
