eVACgSG0lQ50EmFfnpLRXw.text: Love the mariscos, tacos , rice, and beans. Everything tastes amazing. Can't beat their oyster shots! Highly recommend them!

URWUXpFTVUNj1y_q54gZpw.text: Super good seafood platters! This last visit we ordered three different shrimp entrees. Camarones culichi, camarones al mojo de ajo, and camarones fantasia. Complimentary ceviche tostadas are so good. Friendly staff and great food keeps us coming back!

I33udgAkEiMuUUOXDRdRmA.text: Excellent food and service. It's like a fancy hole in the wall with waiter service. The starter chips and guacamole salsa are very good. For an appetizer, we ordered the choriqueso which was piping hot cheese with chorizo mixed in. It was excellent! The fried shrimp came with rice and beans and was fried and seasoned very well. The refried beans were tasty. My sister let me try her carne asada taco and the meat was well done. My sister's fiance ordered bacon wrapped shrimp with cheese and it was the best thing I tried. Must get! My cousin's fried fish in garlic sauce was also good. My dad ordered caldo de camaron (shrimp soup) and he liked it a lot. Alcohol menu was decent and they make virgin margaritas, too.

Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata

SKBNXPaBtdrLhLGqL7AQwA.text: I' love this place. The drink presentation are amazing and taste great. Be familiar with Mexican sea food, it will help greatly. My favorite dish is Camarones endiablados, with a rich creamy hot spicy taste of chipotle. Favorite drink is mangoniada.

8LH1jhKcETU4XfQ3NxSCBw.text: First time here, excellent ambient, great food and great service. I had a 7 mares mariscos plate. It was bomb! Definitely will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 7 mares mariscos plate. It was bomb!

mYC5Ia5iZ166K_S3FmaD1w.text: Wow!! I'm so glad we decided to give this place a try while we're visiting. The ceviche was amazingly refreshing and flavorful, everyone loved their food. We got the Chile verde, ranchero steak, enchilada style burrito, and enchiladas.  Also, very friendly staff and good service. We'll likely come back again before we leave to try other new things, maybe even a margarita! :)

j6K24A49Zze-7QrR_BEh-g.text: Great flavors.  Lots of fish and shrimp options.    Service was nice.  If you asked for something they were happy to accommodate.    Didn't expect that the lemonade was Blue.  Or that the rice was a short grain with vegetables mixed in version.  Maybe both were a regional thing we hadn't seen before.

kZsFBkCLxTQU2fgb5_8HcA.text: This used to be my favorite spot for seafood, however they became very popular and they got more chairs and tables inside of the restaurant and some places also to eat outside however it's very crowded to sit, stand and move between other tables and the waitress coming around a lot, that you can't really enjoy your experience...maybe outside is less trouble? But then I'm not sure how often the waitress will notice you are there... Also I'm not sure if they have properly exits in case of a fire...having so many costumers inside can be a  problem without the emergency exits... I don't know I have kids so I'm always trying to figure out how to protect them. The restaurant offers a free small ceviche tostada as appetizer per person, make sure to ask to get it, a few times our waitress has forgot to bring it to our table.

UABuN2cpkoZdSoJkMUbFJw.text: Wonderful.  Great ceviche and great guacamole.  Will come back next time I'm in town.

x1o-QUaI0ALdNvQOY7N-iA.text: love this place.  The seafood cocktails and the dishes are awesome and you definitely get what you pay for.

-fyK_Ec3xN8-sPhfhb1mXA.text: This my favorite mariscos and the horchata is excellent. I would highly recommend if you like mariscos or mexican food their fajitas were excellent.

xvH3uT6WkI7Z-PY4l_fAWA.text: Fish tacos are amazing!!! The food is wodneful here.  The place is very small but its worth it.

waNAVZnF5mDbkTAiUKqAOQ.text: We went for the mariachi on a Friday night and stayed for the food!!!! I've been to some good seafood places in the past but this one blows everybody else out of the after

zSEp0yjrgyh4QLkm5Y1UmA.text: Excellent tasting food, very close to airport.  We had trouble with a rental car that we did not take from the lot and then accidentally leaving something in it and we were on the phone for quite some time before we can place our order. The server was very understanding and did not bother us too much. He did bring chips and salsa and water right away which were consumed while on the phone trying to straighten out our missing item.  After taking our order he brought out a free ceviche tostada. It had great fresh, seafood flavor and the tostada was very crispy.  Bass & shrimp "divorciados" - that means that half of the dish is covered in a spicy red/orange colored sauce and the other half is covered in a very tasty green chili sauce. A lot of Mexican places also call this Christmas because of the red and green. It was too much food along with the really creamy refried beans and a slightly different version of Spanish rice in that it had a little bit of green beans, carrots and corn in it and the rice was white, not yellow. It was moist and went well as a base for the two sauces.   Calamares & shrimp al ajo - this was a large casserole full of sauteed calamari rings and shrimp swimming, literally, in white wine, olive oil and garlic. It was just too much sauce, although fresh and flavorful.  Corn tortillas however were too processed. They need more rustic looking and more tender corn tortillas. These look, felt and tasted like a major retail brand. Not good.

4HYj_7bDbnk-3gLh31AqEg.text: Food was great one of the better Mexican style seafood service was under par for such a small place was hard to get our waitress when we needed something

rzyNrDjvZj1lMLssQz2SSQ.text: Great place great service great food had the deep fried fish...really good drinks  We had the coconut cake to die for

A0R4Ti8lGw2YYV_i6d07lA.text: First time visit and it was so yummy! La Michelada is the best. We had the shrimp ceviche which was also so good. Service was okay but the food and drinks overpowered everything! Such a cute little place

OdOXpDj9MOq8LM81YkN43A.text: Excellent authentic Mexican. The best I've had in years. Great selection of Mexican beers and some unique liquor concoctions...check out the michelada...a spicy bloody Mary with a bottle of dos xx upside down on top.   Did I mention the food is INCREDIBLE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Capitan

HIgo33RUHCTk67SJ-O2Iww.text: This was a really fun and enjoyable restaurant. Not only was the food very tasty, the service was better than some high end restaurants.  The enchilada burrito was huge and tasty, had I known they were going to start me off with ceviche, I would have ordered something smaller. My only criticism would be for the margarita, it wasn't anything special; it tasted like something I could have mixed with any generic mix.

tsSNxU4fsyX7MRH_esaheA.text: This place is awesome. Best Mariscos in Phoenix so far I had the fish fillet with the vegetables so flavorful. We had a few michialadas and margarita corona. Great customer service. My new spot I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v9KEMr34sm3lIOqVeD3IZw.text: Mariscos Playa Hermosa is wonderful.  The service is great, the staff is friendly, the menu is extensive and authentic Mariscos Mexicano.  The Mariachi band was off the charts good.  Their birthday carrot cake is delicious!  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FbyRJhXXVduMJpWx3gtwIg.text: OMG! The BEST Mariscos I've had in Phoenix. Small restaurant so there's always a wait, but it's well worth it! They go out of their way to make clients feel special. I love it!

pQcklLwr44Lq63Cw7Rmwng.text: I love this place! Best chips/salsa, and ceviche around! Good pricing and ambiance. Everyone is always so nice when we come here.  They make a bomb fresh margarita and michelada. Whenever I have friends or family come into town I bring them here.   We try and come twice a month since it's far from us, but worth the drive from Glendale!

qD0MMFBYIjSOJND-li1NnQ.text: Food was incredible. If you're a fan of Mexican and seafood you'll love this place . Super authentic. Seafood dishes and meat dishes were all outstanding . Appetizers were also top notch. Don't skip this place - you'll regret it !!

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front of restaurant
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef dish

isXMbGr4Ye6DWbVVojI-nA.text: Terrific food. Had shrimp and fish with Veracruz sauce. Fish was so fresh and good I wished I would have gotten it without the shrimp. Sauce was delectable. Service was great. Ordered a bowl of Pico to eat with the chips, it came out fast and freshly prepared. Highly recommend this restaurant!

nOx4rcpqI4k8D5WUYiERIg.text: I stuffed my face here and it was great. Had a blue colored fish taco and a giant seafood dish. All fresh and delicious.

ko5pcBtUmLVAztjiJ6Rkew.text: If you're looking for a great flavorful Mexican Seafood meal this is the place. We had the El Capitan - lots of flavors. My favorite was the culichi shrimp in the tomatillos.

OZpHodqcMqPIiuABuiBFYg.text: Went with the family for something new. Ordered the house special Molcajete, all I can say is WOW.  It had shrimp, octopus tomatillo sauce, beef, chicken and fried fish. Every food group you could possibly imagine! :)  We go the green sauce, the red sauce is a LOT spicier than I expected. If you want delicious Mexican food you can't beat Moriscos Play Hermosa. Don't be afraid of the location, my wife and I were a bit worried as it does seem like it's in the middle of nowhere and in a shadier area but well worth it!.  Make sure to check is as well and get that free slice of cake (we grabbed the coconut one mmmm).

UOCGHJrfsxfOuQgHltylTQ.text: The place is small. The food was very delicious, the drinks are amazingly good! Our waitress was very attentive and helpful.

UlWVqUNZTtX12xQojBQi5A.text: The food was great, the band was excellent and the service was wonderful. First timer from Atlanta

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qULI9OcqxC10bi8QuptkEg.text: Bomb!!!! So ever since I've been back in AZ from LA I've been on the search for a great michelada and amazing ceviche...well search is officially complete. Great Service and great food will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Michelada

dT7X68Bcl4xS-4B9i_5phg.text: Very Mexican atmoshere, lots of tiles and decorations. Food was good, the waitresses were very nice. I normally not much for ceviche stuff, but the hot meals I enjoyed. Great salsa!

VcgVyMEDHXZ0OW7_PxlIkg.text: We have eaten at this restaurant for at least 15 years. We love the seafood dishes and the the Mexican specialties. We usually have the poblano Fish filet dish, it comes with tuna ceviche served on a crispy taco, the poblano fish is served with lettuce, rice and beans.. We have eaten a number of different dishes here, but this is our favorite. The food, the prices and service are terrific!

b815-DwqM71TlpZ_m-w06A.text: First time here, wow this place was amazing. We had the molcajete and it was amazing. Great atmosphere and our server Brenda took great care of us :) we will definitely be back!

TqL2RgQTjrTLFhAFzqbN1w.text: Very good Mexican seafood, not as good as when I was living in Mexico (Guadalajara, Jal. primarily) but close enough to feel like as if I were there.

0LhoIN3YFbp3wk7kBDLnLw.text: Not sure why the high star reviews. We went here with high hopes of a shining review. Instead I got bait and switched.  Chips were thick corn and the salsa was water but the guacamole sauce was pretty good. The 'drowning shrimp' was a nice start and I thought the rest of the meal would follow suit.  I thought I was playing it safe with garlic shrimp, but I was surprised that for $15 you get six medium (seriously the 25-40 size) shrimp. The 7 seas soup was watery with little to it...the main reason we drove 30 minutes to the ghetto...think Notorious BIG "Juicy" playing in the background as you roll up.  Homeless drunk lady harassing patrons as they waited for tables and the guy I told about it seemed to care less.  The mariachi band was a nice authentic touch and was fun, but a bit intense for such a small place.    Don't get me wrong. It's a good mariscos restaurant and if you are in the area it's probably the best mexican seafood option for more than a few blocks.  My apologies for some reason my phone only saved the pic of the 'drowning shrimp' (raw shrimp over cucumber and tomato drizzled with lemon juice,salt,pepper and topped with avocado and onion ---like whole shrimp ceviche.)

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drowning shrimp....yes, thats the translation.

l9bZzdHtm167b-a_J7q-Xg.text: Best Michaladas in town! I really enjoyed the service, food and ambiance! I will definitely be visiting again soon!

DZDVTDq4TN8wRjaudkNb-w.text: Hands down my favorite mariscos place ever. All of their food is tasty! I always get their coctel de camaron which is almost as good as my dad's (can't beat home cooking). I've also had their tacos, fajitas, and camarones endiablados (super spicy). Their micheladas are some of the best and they have all the good Mexican beers (Victoria, Pacifico, and Modelo). They can also accommodate large parties. I had my bday dinner here and had about 20 people attend. On Sundays, they have mariachi starting at 4pm, so make sure to check it out during that time, but they do get busy.

CItJS3RvZXPOaS7XIt6_zQ.text: Food and drinks were great! Complimentary ceviche tostada was very tasty and fish was fresh.

pchRm5t8ViQLYoMsiHhuPA.text: We ordered shrimp in green sauce and chicken flautas. Both the shrimp and chicken were overcooked. The sides were average- nothing too special. What gives this place 3 stars was the fish I tasted from a friend's plate. It was half green sauce and half red sauce...and amazing. I'd return just for that fish. The restaurant has a fun atmosphere and is very colorful.  Service was also fairly good as we with a huge group.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken flautas
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green shrimp

_0BrQESfFiRU3ZXyYHairw.text: A family member referred me to this spot and I was not disappointed.  The food is always great and so is the service.  Obviously, weekends will always be busy. So suggest going early.

j5N0wnV6ZVeQV1SXHyN1OA.text: The food is amazing! Had the shrimp cocktail and molcajete with green sauce and it was so good! We went on a Sunday at around 6pm and it was very busy. We were asked to wait in the patio and we were seated within half an hour. The music is a bit loud but it's good upbeat Spanish music and I enjoyed it. It was difficult to hear my husband who was sitting right next to me and I felt like we had to yell just to have a conversation. Our waitress was very nice but since it was busy it took a little long to get drink refills and other things.  All in all it was a good experience and we'll be back.

P71wLbaJofLmYPORbxMw7w.text: I ate here 2 years ago and had one of the best meals. Not sure what changed, oh wait, it's the quality of the fish. I got the caldo de pescados. The sea bass was gross. So then they brought me a sea bass with ancho chiles that looked good but again, the fish was no bueno. I'm real sorry. I drove 30 minutes out of the way to come here and had 2 inedible entrees.   Crab tostada, guacamole and margarita were ok but not worth the embarrassment of not eating 2 different dinners. The staff was super nice about it and the owner didn't charge me. I wanted to pay but he refused. So nice but I felt terrible. Bad dream.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inedible sea bass.

PVtUUbHXbepFgtO07ETQNQ.text: You can stop looking for any other Mariscos or Mexican restaurant. This place is BOMB!!! I've been here more times than I can remember and the food is absolutely amazing and fresh. The ceviche is out this world!! Here are some recommendations, the divorced fish, oysters, the mocajete, shrimp cocktail, the taquitos..yes..I'm just naming everything on the menu because everything is absolutely to die for. Oh! If you like heat, you're in the right place. If you want something spicy, just ask..just be prepared :)

L-h8DSpiiQ-q0GmVOXus5Q.text: I really wanted to love it, but couldn't.  The food was good, but it didn't pop.  I had the garlic shrimp which had some nice flavor, but it wasn't unique and it didn't speak to me.  The guacamole was good.  The shrimp in garlic sauce was pretty good.  Service was solid.  I might need to come back because the menu was extensive and it could only take one or two excellent items to change my mind on the place.

6hu32u_VZUe5pmiJhXcBIg.text: Every time I come here, I get excellent service and good food!  Love this place. Great ambience, too. Great furniture.

DMghtGkYxlz2YZLg-9kLqQ.text: This place has the best mojarra frita in Arizona and the best margaritas. We drink virgen margaritas and we can taste the fruit in the drinks. Their salsa has a good kick to it, I'm picky with my salsa but this one passes the test. You should come try it if you like fish you will not be disappointed. Prices are also very reasonable. Check it out for yourself.

S4NR_LypJA-AE8OKf7CVmQ.text: really great food and nice environment. Cant wait to go again and try something else. This place is definitely a must try.

fVr-zpD1HkzQWdSUGy1yrQ.text: Food average. Horrible service. I waited 15 min before getting drinks even though there is couple of tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5zur-IIyzemqMxUN9--U_A.text: Nice authentic Mexican joint. I don't remember the name of what I ordered but it was basically a bucket of meat and spicy sauce. It was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More meat
Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bucket of meat and spicy stuff

rd-M9Ycv9cWdQRbmg4HvSA.text: Not sure why so many people wrote that this is in a sketchy neighborhood unless they have never been outside of the suburbs. Just because a neighborhood is not all white does not mean it's bad. This great place is on a main road across from a church and near a senior apartment complex and a hospital. Seriously folks. Let's not be so judgy.    Also, it is not crappy from the outside. In fact it is brightly painted, inviting, and has a patio with lights strung over it. Inside is decorated just as beautifully, with colorful paintings, lush greenery, and cozy tables. We happened to stop by on a Friday night and were entertained by a mariachi band. It did mean that it was a little loud at times, but everyone in the restaurant seemed to be having a great time. It was family oriented--several groups with kids--as well as couples on date nights.   The food was excellent. Shrimp ceviche -- incredible. The waitress recommended molcajete caliente (cheesy hotpot with fish, shrimp, chicken, carne asada, and octopus). It came with beans, rice, tortillas, and a little salad. Yum yum. Chips were a little greasier than we would like but were free and came with two good salsas. If we lived in Phoenix, we would be regulars!

WblWYB9XMPDoGF9wUNieDg.text: This place by far beats any marisco place I've been too in the city of Phoenix. It's cleanliness and attention to detail on the preparation of their food compares to any Mexican playa dish! I strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone starving for some good mariscos!

zj5y1mDcTYtM_wv3hflbag.text: I went to many Mexican restaurants and this one is a gem! The service is awesome. They have really good ceviche de pescado and molcajete caliente. We ordered the house margarita and mango diablo. They are really good!!

hoM3X_O4UYu77xrDcQ7-bw.text: This is my favorite spot! I have lunch here a few days a week due to the short distance from my corporate job. The servers are just wonderful and are always eager to offer one of their specialties or new items. My favorite is any dish with shrimp. The prepared oysters are DELICIOUS, you can't stop eating them! I usually sit in the outdoor patio and enjoy the mexican music or anywhere in the colorful restaurant inside with a delicious margarita or a cold beer in their frozen mugs! My fave in Phoenix! Must try!

7VietBiRO5e40wKSOD2fkg.text: We ordered the molcajete caliente it was very good had lots of flavor to all the food that was in it ,the horchata was very good to they put some fruit in it ,the waiter was very nice and we got a free 3 leches cake

5RfxfzyqTmsdiMH7euh_5g.text: I'm in town for a conference and tried it because it was close to the motel.  Holy cow was I pleasantly surprised.  It was excellent.  I've had a couple of disappointing Mexican seafood restaurants, but not Mariscos Playa Hermosa! The chips and both salsas were good.  I order a bean and cheese burrito to play it safe.  They brought me a free appetizer, a fish de gallo tostado and I was hooked. This east coast gringo will be back and I'll bring a couple of friends to try authentic Mexican.  Excellent!  Service was excellent to boot.  I have a new favorite in Phoenix.

8s97nbSkKOpU_dO9j-qyFw.text: Enjoyable experience!  Never expected to find this little gem in downtown, but so glad I did.  I like my margaritas strong and flavorful and they did not disappoint.  Our seafood entrees were delicious. Ambience is fun, colorful. The mariachis were unexpexted and much enjoyed! Service was attentive. The complimentary ceviche tostada was the icing on the cake. Definitely will be back.  If only they offered brunch I'd give 5 stars.

gGsdXEz_bZvllok6PEei-w.text: Food was awesome! Shrimp cocktail and the 7 mares soup was great. Our server Ingrid was also awesome.

Zr1bXp7I3wNHs4He1yebyQ.text: Love love love this place. The authentic feel to it, the food, the ambiance is amazing. Definitely one of my go to places for mariscos!!! You can't go wrong coming here. Although the area is a little sketchy it's a good place to eat and unwind!! Trust me!!!

ZkPkCKRjM1L7FeIHtIMDaA.text: I have forever been put off from trying mexican seafood. I am not sure why really.  Just something always tells me, don't risk it, you are too young!  So i finally did not listen to my gut feeling and I am glad i didn't. We got their special stone bowl with mocalate...I am 100% i spelled that wrong, there was different meat in it and it was delicious.... I am actually drooling thinking of this dish again.   Yes I will be back and I might just order that again, because it was so good. (i am sure there other items are good too).  I would pass on desserts though.

CmH4QlRRe_KkAZB4vEHztQ.text: It actually has been a year since I visited and it was great! I went with a party of 7 and we tried and shared a little of everything. It can be pricey but then again it is seafood. It satisfied my craving for mariscos.

CRI-kIvG18UlHmY8YvRwsg.text: Seriously good food...not cheap but worth it. Quality and quantity. Place is clean, colorful and service is quick. Bacon wrapped shrimp are phenomenal as well as the crab enchilada and shrimp ceviche.

photos.caption: Photo of Mariscos Playa Hermosa - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped shrimp

FR6KqqbcXsziLGMiOK1ETw.text: Without a doubt, this is the best mariscos in Phoenix! They were very accommodating to my shrimp allergy and assured that dishes I ordered would be made without. Service was prompt, friendly and attentive. We ordered oysters preparado, ceviche, seafood cocktail and al pastor. All were divine! Can't wait to go back!

2SGlceTg1arkuUDhIGhWEA.text: We looked for a locally owned Mexican restaurant and this one was close to our hotel (and airport). Fun atmosphere. Great patio. Food was fantastic and the service friendly and attentive. Wish they were in Denver we'd come all the time.

CUjpWre4fD6TuhFbbAnX8w.text: Great food! Loved the ceviche and the different shrimp combinations! Great service and nice atmosphere
